story:
Anyone who has ever used a collapsible container with a standard narrow opening knows how frustrating it is to fill. If you have ever tried to fill one in the outdoors, it is doubly hard, since you need to find just the right flow of water to fill the container. We wanted a product that would make it easy to fill a water container outdoors while staying functional and usable.

 

 

The Vecto design has three main goals: easy to fill using the wide opening, easy to drink and filter using the standard narrow opening, and collapsible for easy carrying. The Vecto makes filling your collapsible container easy and quick, leaving you with more time to enjoy the outdoors and less time wasted on dealing with necessities. 

The wide opening allows for the Vecto to be filled easily in any water conditions: running or standing water. You no longer need to find that perfect flow of water to fill your container, or improvise filling with a secondary vessel (and contaminating your cup) - just open the wide opening and scoop the water in seconds.

The dual opening design means that you are not bound by one method to treat water - you have the ability to adapt to conditions as they change. The standard soda bottle screw neck allows the use of Sawyer filters, or similar filters, while the wide opening means you can use a UV purifier or chemical treatment.

The Vecto is not just made to give you life-saving water in the backcountry; it can hold just about any liquid you might want - from cocktails to cold brews, the wide opening lets you mix things easily and add ice, tea bags, limes or anything else. Since it holds water in, it can also keep water out and be used as a dry bag: just put your things inside via the wide opening, seal with the slider, open the screw top to release air and close the cap.

At only 80 grams (2.8 oz)*, the Vecto is lighter than a double Snickers bar, making taking it along on any adventure a simple decision.

* final weight for the Vecto is an estimate and could increase or decrease slightly with the final product.

Not only is the Vecto light, it is so small (7x2x1 inches) that it will fit easily into any pocket, even on a running belt, in the back pocket or in a hip belt. The Vecto can be used as the primary water container on your trip or as part of your camp setup or emergency carry.

Made from Thermoplastic Polyurethane (TPU), the Vecto is soft to hold but highly durable with a break point of 100kg (220lb). This means that you can toss it, drop it, crush it or stand on it (no idea why you would, but you could!) and it will stay with you. The TPU is naturally elastic, so even if your gear is one big jumble when stuffed in your bag, it won't break,  just bend.

We want you to keep on using the Vecto for years, so we designed it to be easy to clean: just fit your hand (any size under XXL) in the container with some dish soap and a scruber, and give it a good clean. Even if you took it to the backcountry for some nasty water treatment, you can wash it easily at home and load up with your favorite cocktail for the next picnic with no worries.

Bisphenol A (BPA) is not only bad for you, it is also illegal in kids' water containers and we want you to be able to make sure your kids are hydrated safely, too! The Vecto is made from BPA free, FDA approved TPU, so you can drink in peace.

We have been working with a partnering factory in China for the last year, developing the materials, design, and bonding to make the Vecto just right.

The Vecto is made from 5 different molds for each part: the body, the neck, the wide opening, the slider and the cap. Our partners are experts in mold injections and have been making hydration bladders and containers for years.

After 4 prototypes, we have now commissioned the creation of the last set of molds to make the Vecto, and this campaign is to be able to finalize the molds.

The cost to make something tends to be a fixed cost: making the Vecto will have a set cost no matter where it is sold. When something is sold in a retail store, everyone along the way needs to make some money - the factory, the brand, the distributor, the retailer. All those entities along the way roll that cost on you, the customer.

At Cnoc Outdoors we believe that gear should be accessible, not over priced, so we sell our gear straight to you, here on Kickstarter or on our site. By selling straight to you we cut out the top layer of costs, enabling us to offer the Vecto at an estimated retail price of $18, not $35-40 if it was in the store. Because of that, we also can't offer 50% or more discount on our items, since we want to pay our factories fairly.

Help us make gear accessible again by buying directly from brands.

Most of the time, Cnoc Outdoors is just me: Gilad Nachmani, founder, and one man show. I started Cnoc Outdoors after years in the outdoors retail environment, seeing how brands were selling gear that is either too flimsy or too bulky, all at a premium price. I wanted to change that paradigm with comfortable, lightweight and affordable backpacking gear.  

Support, words and all around keeping the dream alive - Mika Nachmani

Ideas, support, and number one user - David Sullivan

Legal, patenting and adult supervision - Robert Sullivan

Creative work, photography, and filming - Greg Clarke (Canteen Photography)

Photography - Dawn Pisto

Real life video cast - Colin Platt, Liberty Peru and Alana Epstein

Introduction voice over - Rex Anderson

Music provided by DJ Lang. Licensed under Creative Commons Attribution (3.0)

story:
Our Story

Gareth came from England to Salta on his back-packing travels around the world, met a local girl, Irma, fell in love and they married and settled down. Gareth, who spoke very little Spanish was immersed into family life in Salta and began to get a command of the language. He started a small travel agency and was making progress when disaster struck. His brother David who had come to visit Gareth & Irma in Salta for the arrival of their first child, was killed in a paragliding incident.

There were two outcomes of this family tragedy that have impacted on why we are asking for your support at this time.

Firstly Gareth’s initial travel company closed as the whole family came to terms with what had happened and secondly it was decided to start a Fundación in David’s name.

 The Fundación David Mather has been running for eight years, with the support of our partner Foundation in the UK, The David Mather Foundation. It has supported over sixty, academically bright, young people from highly disadvantaged backgrounds to be the first in their families to attend Higher and Further Education programmes.

Many of these young people, having gained their qualifications, are now experiencing great difficulty in finding appropriate, professional employment. They do not have the networks to help them to get started on the professional ladder. Our intention, in our new company, is to make a successful business that can also offer them employment opportunities. 

The Company

We are a family company with Gareth as the CEO and major driving force. We offer private tours specialising in Salta and the North West of Argentina but can also organise ‘Highlights of South America’, such as Rio, Machu Picchu and Iguacu Falls.

Please visit our website www.fivesensestraveller.com and our pages on Facebook and Instagram and our YouTube channel – 'Five Senses Travel Company'

Photographic & Sound Equipment;

You will see from our video that we have had to beg & borrow equipment and the quality is, therefore, not too good. We apologise for the sound quality in particular. Imports are discouraged and heavily taxed and so it is not possible to find many of the types of equipment found in Europe or the US and the cost of even the most basic equipment is high.

With the importance of Social Media to all businesses we know that we need first-class equipment and well trained staff to ensure our promotional materials are up to scratch.

Our People

Argentina is suffering from inflation at 27% and poor employment opportunities. Wages are very low, particularly here in the North West and we believe, as a company, we can help local people break out of these challenging circumstances .

We want to offer four local people internships through the Fundacion to enable them to volunteer in the company, for six months at a time, in part-time roles, to be involved in sales and marketing of the company.

We would normally pay people through commission on sales, but as a new business we are building our customer base and whilst things have started quite well, we are having to plough any profits back into the business.  This means we cannot pay any salaries or retainers, YET.

We hope to be able to take these first people on full-time after six months when we are more established, so need your help in the meantime.

If this is successful we would then offer three more young people a six-month, paid internship to help them gain real work-experience and to add to their CV.

Our first three people from the Fundación are;

Rocio Saica – 23 years old, Fundación Student in her final year of a Business Studies Degree at our local university UNSA. She also has good English skills, partly through lessons at the Fundación and partly self-taught. She wants to work in tourism. 


Fernando Guedilla - 23 years old, Fundación student – completed his degree in Human Resources and having been unable to find work is now studying Health & Safety to enhance his chances. He is interested in all aspects of tourism

Ana Choque – 23 years old and in her final year of an Education degree. She needs to gain experience in a working environment before she can apply to work in Universities.

Our first local employee for future full-time employment is Luciana Carrizo, official Tourist Company Link – a must-have employee to sign off on tours etc directed by the local Authority but unpaid. She is very positive about the future of the company and wants to be part of its development.

Our Campaign

We came to the suggested salaries below through discussion with the young people concerned.

Our target is US$ 10,000 to be used as follows;

1.       To pay three part-time internships for six months

4000 pesos (240 US$) each person per month = 72,000 pesos (4235 US$).

2.       To pay our tourism official, Luciana for six months

8000 pesos (500 US$) per month = 4800 pesos (2800 US$).

3.       To purchase decent camera equipment to enable the company and the new employees to promote our company with quality images and videos = 2000 US$

4.       To facilitate some media & digital marketing = 500 US$

5.       To pay council and employment taxes and administrative charges for four employees for six months = 465 US$

Total = 10,000 US$

We will keep all supporters informed of the progress of the company and our new employees.

We really need new friends to support us.

The UK David Mather Foundation closed in December 2016 as family and friends had been supporting us for eight years and as most of our young people had gained their qualifications, we felt it was unfair to ask them to continue. The Fundacion David Mather in Salta, with Gareth as its President, continues in its attempts to support our young people getting into employment.

We, therefore, want to do our campaign without asking family and friends in the UK who have supported our Foundation to support us again.

We are hoping that we can persuade new friends to help us raise our target.

Our previously detailed website http://dmf.tenemportal.com/ is now being altered to become a small number of memorial pages and will summarise the work we have been doing and give future updates on students’ progress.

At www.fivesensestraveller.com you will be able to see our set tours and bespoke options. Please read our blog and learn more about living and travelling in Arentina.

Please also follow us on Facebook, YouTube, Instagram and LinkedIn and please share our sites with your social network friends– we want to thank you for your support and stay friends.

We would appreciate receiving your views and comments on our campaign and website.

Please e-mail;    iancraigmather@gmail.com

Finally, we hope you feel we are a company worth supporting and we hope to see you, with your voucher, here in Salta, soon.

Best wishes

Gareth, Irma, Ceri, Ian , Sofia (8) & Nico (1)

story:
Short Summary

Well, hullo!

Firstly I'd like to say, please don't be put off by the fundraising target.

We are hoping to reach a target of £100, but the amount shown is the lowest we can put into the box, for some reason. Under our funding arrangement we'll still get the money (it's not all-or-nothing).

We are a group of friends who would like to bring just a little more silliness to the world by sharing our creation, Geefer.

Geefer is the part-giraffe, part-car soapbox racer created by Girrari (i.e. us). He may well be the fastest wheeled-giraffe out there. We'd like to find out by taking him along to the RedBull Soapbox Race at Alexandra Palace on 12th July.

There's a lot of competition to even win a place on the starting grid, so we've done well to get this far. We'd like some funds to make sure we really do make it to the start (if not the finish) line.

Soapbox racing is fuelled by gravity (no engines involved) and relies on daring, creativity and silliness, so it would mean a huge amount to the team if you felt able to contribute a small amount.

What We Need 

  • Costumes - performance is vital, and we've got our eyes on some pretty spiffing items on ebay that will really add to the impression our team makes on the day
  • Parts - we've made some good progress with Geefer, but we still have a few more things to buy, like bolts and padding
  • Transport - it's going to be a bit tricky to get Geefer uphill for the start of the race, so we'd like to hire a van to get him from his garage in south London to Ally Pally

Why

  • The race is a great family day out, and the more prepared we are the more we can entertain the crowds
  • The more entertaining we are, the more likely we are to end up on Dave (not sure whether this is a good thing or not...!)

Risks & Challenges

Getting the team together is tricky, after all we're all busy people, but we're also creative & committed, having made a lot of progress in a short amount of time.

We weren't sure about some of the engineering challenges at first - such as how we were going to mount the wheels, but we now have it all planned out.

You can follow our progress on Twitter via @GirrariGeefer #goGeeferGo

As for the day itself - well, who knows what is going to happen? It'll be a triumph if we make it to the bottom with four wheels.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute to this sort of thing, but any retweets or offers of moral support are very, very much appreciated.


Thank you.

story:
The Carpe Diem Eco Project is a humanitarian eco-tourism project. The goal is to empower the local people of Nicaragua by utilizing its tremendous tourism potential, while minimizing environmental impact.

In order to accomplish this, I wish to build a sustainable ecolodge, with the help of others, interested in supporting this cause. The ecolodge will immediately reinvest the profits that it generates to create or fund local and vetted humanitarian and conservation initiatives. It will serve as an educational centre, create employment opportunities and economic benefits for local people. It will also provide free accommodations for legitimate humanitarian organizations and at the same time, it will provide nice and affordable lodging for travellers.


For the construction of the lodge, I will be using the Cob building technique. After extensive research, I fell in love with Cob building because of its sturdiness, minimal environmental impact, and low cost. Cob is a mixture made from clay, sand, straw and water. It is the key material for the construction of the ecolodge. Cob is natural, fireproof, termite-proof, resistant to seismic activities, inexpensive, easy to build and so much more! 

                                     


The location of the lodge is on a peninsula called Isla Los Brasiles, 30 minutes away from the beautiful colonial city of Leon on the Pacific coast of Nicaragua. For the past three years, I have been researching, working, and saving for this project. In order to avoid loans and investors (that could potentially compromise the integrity of the mission for financial gain), I worked for years, while keeping my living costs very lean, so that I could save enough money to purchase the land myself. I have full confidence in the ecolodge, and in May 2014, I completed the purchase of 10,500 square meters of beachfront property. This is now the site of the ecolodge, and already has 50 trees planted by myself and an employee hired to maintain the land. With wild nature, untouched beaches, no cars, amazing sunsets, and millions of stars, it is paradise!!! After the lodge is built, I will manage the lodge using my thorough knowledge of the area, and my extensive experience in hospitality.

                                         


Any kind of help is more than welcome, but there are 4 ways that you can make a big difference.

1. Help finance the building of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.

Help jumpstart the project by making a donation to the construction of the ecolodge. For your donation, you will receive a gift certificate valued at your donation dollar amount to spend at the lodge.

2. Help with the construction efforts of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.

You don't need special skills to build with cob – nearly everyone can do it, and there will be experienced builders around you. It is not difficult, but it is time-consuming. Come and join us this winter. We will be there from January until June 2015. Escape the cold and join us where it is warm year-round! The campground will be provided for free, just bring your tent. Help with construction a few hours a day and spend the rest of your day enjoying the sun, the beach, the beautiful Nicaragua. We are going to have a great time!

3. Choose the Carpe Diem Ecolodge for your next holiday. 

The profits will be reinvested in the local communities, so just by having a great time staying at the Carpe Diem Ecolodge, you are making a difference!

4. Share the promotion video and spread the word with your friends.

The more people know about the project, the greater impact we can make!

Please visit the Carpediemecoproject.com web page for more information and to watch the complete video.

Thank You!

The goal is to empower the local people of Nicaragua by utilizing its tremendous tourism potential, while minimizing environmental impact.In order to accomplish this, I wish to build a sustainable ecolodge, with the help of others, interested in supporting this cause. The ecolodge will immediately reinvest the profits that it generates to create or fund local and vetted humanitarian and conservation initiatives. It will serve as an educational centre, create employment opportunities and economic benefits for local people. It will also provide free accommodations for legitimate humanitarian organizations and at the same time, it will provide nice and affordable lodging for travellers.For the construction of the lodge, I will be using the Cob building technique. After extensive research, I fell in love with Cob building because of its sturdiness, minimal environmental impact, and low cost. Cob is a mixture made from clay, sand, straw and water. It is the key material for the construction of the ecolodge. Cob is natural, fireproof, termite-proof, resistant to seismic activities, inexpensive, easy to build and so much more!                                      The location of the lodge is on a peninsula called Isla Los Brasiles, 30 minutes away from the beautiful colonial city of Leon on the Pacific coast of Nicaragua. For the past three years, I have been researching, working, and saving for this project. In order to avoid loans and investors (that could potentially compromise the integrity of the mission for financial gain), I worked for years, while keeping my living costs very lean, so that I could save enough money to purchase the land myself. I have full confidence in the ecolodge, and in May 2014, I completed the purchase of 10,500 square meters of beachfront property. This is now the site of the ecolodge, and already has 50 trees planted by myself and an employee hired to maintain the land. With wild nature, untouched beaches, no cars, amazing sunsets, and millions of stars, it is paradise!!! After the lodge is built, I will manage the lodge using my thorough knowledge of the area, and my extensive experience in hospitality.                                         Any kind of help is more than welcome, but there are 4 ways that you can make a big difference.1. Help finance the building of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.Help jumpstart the project by making a donation to the construction of the ecolodge. For your donation, you will receive a gift certificate valued at your donation dollar amount to spend at the lodge.2. Help with the construction efforts of the Carpe Diem Ecolodge.You don't need special skills to build with cob – nearly everyone can do it, and there will be experienced builders around you. It is not difficult, but it is time-consuming. Come and join us this winter. We will be there from January until June 2015. Escape the cold and join us where it is warm year-round! The campground will be provided for free, just bring your tent. Help with construction a few hours a day and spend the rest of your day enjoying the sun, the beach, the beautiful Nicaragua. We are going to have a great time!3. Choose the Carpe Diem Ecolodge for your next holiday. The profits will be reinvested in the local communities, so just by having a great time staying at the Carpe Diem Ecolodge, you are making a difference!4. Share the promotion video and spread the word with your friends.The more people know about the project, the greater impact we can make!Please visit the Carpediemecoproject.com web page for more information and to watch the complete video.Thank You!

story:
Hi, my name is Daniel and for me the mission of the year is a motorcycle trip around europe but let me tell you more about me.

In 2008  my brother and I decide to buy a bicycle and riding from London to Edinburg and nobody would ever immagine that we could complete that mission; but we did! and that was the best experience of my life.

23 day of cicling around, getting lost, camping in someone else garden, swearing, and finally believe in ourself and reaching the goal.

This time the challenge is easy compared to that one but hey... we are getting old, so the plan is to ride a sportbike (not the most confortable for this kind of things) from London to Turin passing trough France Germany and Swizzerland and Italy where we gonna meet other bikers and riding together.

All trip will be recorded by 4 sport action cameras and a documentary with the best moment of the trip will be created.

We already have the needed equipment and safety gear so the money raised will be used to pay food, petrol, toll charges, eventually hotels

Thank you for reading and please if you have passion for bikes donate!


Ciao, mi chiamo Daniel e per me la missione dell 'anno è un viaggio in moto in Europa, ma lasciate che vi dica di più su di me.

Nel 2008 io e mio fratello decidiamo di comprare due biciclette cavalcando da Londra a Edimburgo e nessuno avrebbe mai immaginato che avremo potuto completare la missione; ma l'abbiamo fatto! Éstata la migliore esperienza della mia vita.

23 giorni di ciclismo, perdersi, campeggio in un altro giardino, giurando, e, infine, credere in noi stessi e raggiungere l'obiettivo.

Questa volta la sfida è facile rispetto a quella, ma hey ... stiamo diventando vecchi,  il piano è quello di guidare una moto sportiva (non  comodo per questo genere di cose) da Londra a Torino passando per Francia Germania svizzera e Italia, dove abbiamo intenzione di incontrare altri motociclisti.

Tutto viaggio sarà registrato da 4 telecamere di azione sportiva e verrà creato un documentario con i migliori momenti del viaggio.

Abbiamo già le attrezzature necessarie e gli attrezzi di sicurezza in modo che il denaro raccolto sarà utilizzato per pagare il cibo, benzina, pedaggi, infine alberghi

Grazie per la lettura e per favore se avete la passione per le moto donate!

story:
Help make life accessible for all

It seems unimaginable to an abled-bodied person that something so simple--like a step--could exclude someone from their favorite restaurant or bar, but that's what happens daily to those who have a mobility impairment. And even if they find a way around the stairs, how do they know that the bathroom will be big enough to accommodate a wheelchair? These are the issues that people with mobility disabilities face each day, and there seems little that can be done to help.

But, what if all the accessible places were put on one map? AXS Map ('access map') does just that. With a click of a mouse, or a tap of a smartphone, you can contribute to making the world equally accessible for all. With AXS Map, the power to ignite a movement around accessibility is (literally) in your hands.

Jason DaSilva came up with the idea for AXS Map when working on his film "When I Walk" (trailer link below), which follows his life with multiple sclerosis. Throughout the film Jason finds it more and more of a challenge to get outside. For such an outgoing person, Jason was forced to stand by, as his world became ever more isolating. So much so that he felt compelled to come up with AXS Map, a way to help himself, and others in his situation, get around the problem of inaccessibility.

Link to a trailer for Jason's film 'When I Walk' 

The next steps needed to complete AXS Map

Right now we have a working web prototype of AXS Map.  Your contributions would go towards hiring the programmers who will build the AXS Map mobile applications for smartphones.

Beyond the completion of the app, we want to integrate a greater social layer, a place where people can spend time viewing others stories and sharing their own; on why they care about access.

 

Stuff! Glorious stuff...

In return for your help you will recieve our heartfelt appreciation, and the knowledge that you are helping all those currently--and those in future--who have a mobility impairment. Remember any donation, no matter how small, helps.

Appreciation is all well and good, but what of the goodies - we hear you cry? Well there's everything from decals, tshirts, to all of Jason's film on DVD. Check out the breakdown on the right.

Why AXS Map matters

See what the problem is

Watch the mapping begin

It has been a long road since Jason first came up with the idea for AXS Map back in 2008, but with your help, he can now get AXS Map out there, helping make a positive change in the lives of people with mobility impairments.

If you are unable to make a donation at this time, you can still help by registering on www.axsmap.com, and populating the database when we launch. 

That's all, thanks!

story:
Short Summary

As a passionate photographer, for a long time now it has been my dream to make a photography book. I currently sell my portraits and since visiting Paris Foto last year, I made the decision that my next big project would be to make a book. 

A couple of weeks ago I made a very last minute decision to travel from Australia to France. The short version of the story is that I received an email on a Friday saying that I had won a First, Second and Third Prize in a Parisian Photographic Competition. I was invited to attend the exhibition opening which would be in Paris and then to travel to Arles for the best Photography Festival in France where more of the work would be shown. So that Monday I made the decision to leave for France, alone. My ticket was booked only a few hours before my departure and I left with $2 in my bank account. I had to borrow money so that my bank account wasn't empty when I arrived in France - otherwise I may not even get into the country! (I have since been payed!!)

Being at the Arles photography festival has been an amazing experience. I have met some amazing industry people and have been given some amazing opportunities - including the offer of a projection of my works. Discussions with the people that I have met and just being here has cemented in my mind the fact that I want to make a book. 

I want to share the amazing places that I have seen, introduce the beautiful people I have met and share the funny stories that I have encountered along the way. The book would be a combination of photographs and words. Portraits of people, photographs of the stunning scenery and a description of each photograph included in the book. 

Now that I am here, I want to continue to travel for as long as I can so that I can keep adding to the book. I hope that this will be the first of many travel journals. I hope that it will make a beautiful coffee table book and be a different take on travel books. 

What We Need & What You Get

Any funding will be incredibly helpful in making this dream happen. Already being in Europe, I feel its better to stay for as long as I can and continue to add to my body of work, so that, in the end I can put together a fantastic presentation. 

Currently I am staying in budget accommodation and have been making salads and eating fruit. I don't want to waste money on eating out! I will continue to do this for the rest of the trip. I have also been lucky in that I have had offers from friends, new and old for free accommodation which is great. It means I can stay a little longer and will have some local knowledge! 

My plan is to head from Arles to Spain, Spain to Morocco, Morocco back through France, France to Italy, Italy to Belgium, Belgium to Germany. Maybe not in that order but those are the places that I would like to go. 

When I first began taking photos, my intention was to take photos that could be used to help people. Whether this be through sharing a story or raising awareness of a particular issue. This would also be a goal of creating this book. I will seek out minorities that need help exposing an issue, get to know locals in smaller communities and help them in any way I can. 

Funding will be used to help with travel costs and the costs involved in putting my book together and getting it out there. I will be putting the book together with or without the help of funding so any funds raised will be going towards this cause, nothing will be wasted. Contributors perks will include photographic prints and copies of the book. 

Back in Australia, I own a fine art Photographic Printer and would use this to print the images myself, thus ensuring they are of the best possible quality. All photographs would be printed on Archival Photographic Cotton, ensuring the colours are most vibrant and the prints most impressive. The book will be a collection of A4 prints that can be framed and hung on the wall if this is your intention.

The Impact

Your contribution will make it a whole lot easier and quicker for the project to come together. The project is something I intend to carry out with funding or without but any contributions will help immensely. 

My Track Record

I am currently represented by and Art Gallery in Brighton Australia for the sale of my portraits. I have also been selected for numerous exhibitions throughout Australia, Paris, Arles, Aspen and New York.

I have also been lucky enough to receive a number of Photography Awards both nationally and internationally. These include:

First Place Grand Prix de la Photographie / PX3

Second Place Grand Prix de la Photographie / PX3

Third Place Grand Prix de la Photographie / PX3

Winner Moran Contemporary Photographic Prize 2012

Winner Click 11 Photography Prize

Honourable Mention 8th Black and White Spider Awards

Finalist Realise Your Dream Award, British Council Australia 2013

Jury Award of Merit Grand Prix de la Decouverte

Honourable Mention Grand Prix de la Photographie Paris / PX3

Judges Merit Award Picture This Photography Prize

4 x Bronze Merit Awards International Loupe Awards

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge I think that I will face is travelling alone to countries that I have not been to before and do not speak the language of. I am doing everything I can to be careful! 

The other challenge is getting people to let you into their world. So far, I have found everyone incredibly warm and welcoming. I think that being in a place long enough that people start to become familiar with you also helps. On the plus side, this is the way I like to travel. I am not that interested in running around like a crazy person trying to see all the monuments and famous places in one day. In fact, I'm not even all that interested in that side of things. Yes it is great to see, but I am much more interested in getting to know the locals, making friends with them and living like them. I think by travelling in this way, I will have no trouble finding interesting content for my book. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I will also be selling my photographic prints at discounted rates and taking bookings for work when I get back. With my last minute visa, my maximum stay is 3 months so I will be back in Australia mid October at the latest. If this is something that you may be interested in, please email a@ashleighlauren.com 

If you don't want to or aren't in a position to contribute money, please spread the word for me! Any help is greatly appreciated!! 

Thank you for reading my story! xx

story:
Emergency kits and bug-out-bags aren't new...we get it. That’s the problem. So, we fused the knowledge from first responders, survivalists and designers to develop Companion.

A product built to save lives.

 

 

Floods, Fires, Hurricanes, & Earthquakes are becoming more frequent and intense year after year. Combined with growing overpopulation and outdated infrastructure, such disasters will only grow in magnitude.

In any one of these scenarios, the first 72 hours are the most challenging. With first responders spread thin or without access to areas, it could very well be the difference between life or death.

 

Our company is guided by one mission: to save lives in the event of any emergency situation.

And to do this without fail, we needed to create our own product line from the ground up. Meaning, every component had to be built and rebuilt by ourselves -

To craft a company that redefines the preparedness standard.

 

It all starts with our quick access base. With a customized velcro backing, you will always have immediate access to any sub-section. Reconfigure, swap, or refill within mere seconds.

story:
Pre-order your Wootz EDC Now!

It's not easy to find the perfect pocket tool with a side clip, folding blade, and a bottle opener. Around 18 months ago we challenged ourselves to create a tool that would be light, practical and affordable. 

The Wootz EDC is the ideal tool for any adventure where weight and space are a consideration. Its versatility makes it a must-have companion for every adventurer, or eighter you’re just grilling in the backyard with a cold one.

It's manufactured from the highest-carbon stainless steel and weighs just 1.9 ounces or 55 grams. The Wootz EDC handles common BBQ functions in a pleasing, easy to handle shape.

         

                          

                                                        

                       

                       

THE WOOTZ EDC IDEA

Wootz EDC (Every Day Carry) founders wished to reduce the amount of gear you would need when heading into the wild, knowing that every ounce on your back becomes a kilogram when carried over the distance. We began with a simple keychain as a jumping-off point but also wanted to design a tool that would handle every step when preparing a meal around the campfire. 

Every function of the Wootz EDC had to work great in its own right. For durability, stainless steel 440C was a perfect choice.

                                                     

DESIGN  

After 18 months of design work and hundreds of different prototypes, the Wootz EDC was born. Wootz EDC makes a unique gear, based on our love for barbeque and beer. 

Whether you are backpacking around the world or spending a day in the woods, we want to be with you. 

Our team consists of curios-minded mavericks, creating unique products that are practical, functional and aesthetically pleasing in the real world. 

SPECIFICATIONS  

  • Light Weight: 1.9oz (55 g)
  • Blade Length: 2.3in (5.5 cm)
  • Blade Thickness: 0.09in (2.3 mm)
  • Open Body Length: 5.5in (14 cm)
  • Handle Length: 3in (8 cm)
  • Closed Width: 0.8in (2.2 cm)
  • Body Materials: 440C heat treated stainless steel 
  • Hardness: 58-60HRC 
  • Color: Grey, Matte Black 
  • Lock: Linerlock

Some of our valued early members have suggested a Tanto blade option for their Wootz EDC. We loved this idea so much we went back to the drawing board and designed, sketched and modelled a Tanto version as seen above. Due to the production schedule, we have decided to introduce the Tanto design as a stretch goal for our campaign.

 

         

               

Team

 

      

 100% Satisfaction guaranteed

The Wootz EDC handles common BBQ functions in a pleasing, easy to handle shape.440c Stainless SteelBeer anyone?Just the Essentials         Recent Media Coverage Cracking Open A Cold One With The Boys > Tag Your Friends <                                                                                      One-hand opening & easy to open and shutHandy bottle opener to crack open a cold one with the boys :D
                         Matte Black with Carbon Fiber ScaleGrey with Hardwood ScaleBy pledging, you have the option to customize a color combination that matches your style. Once the campaign is over, we'll collect your color choices in a survey                       THE WOOTZ EDC IDEAWootz EDC (Every Day Carry) founders wished to reduce the amount of gear you would need when heading into the wild, knowing that every ounce on your back becomes a kilogram when carried over the distance. We began with a simple keychain as a jumping-off point but also wanted to design a tool that would handle every step when preparing a meal around the campfire. Every function of the Wootz EDC had to work great in its own right. For durability, stainless steel 440C was a perfect choice.Keep things slick while getting more than just a traditional money clip 
Cracking Open A Cold One With The Boys > Tag Your Friends <                                                     DESIGN  After 18 months of design work and hundreds of different prototypes, the Wootz EDC was born. Wootz EDC makes a unique gear, based on our love for barbeque and beer. Whether you are backpacking around the world or spending a day in the woods, we want to be with you. Our team consists of curios-minded mavericks, creating unique products that are practical, functional and aesthetically pleasing in the real world. 3D CAD drawings along with 2D dimensionsComputer-aided design and draftingSPECIFICATIONS  
Light Weight: 1.9oz (55 g)
Blade Length: 2.3in (5.5 cm)
Blade Thickness: 0.09in (2.3 mm)
Open Body Length: 5.5in (14 cm)
Handle Length: 3in (8 cm)
Closed Width: 0.8in (2.2 cm)
Body Materials: 440C heat treated stainless steel 
Hardness: 58-60HRC 
Color: Grey, Matte Black 
Lock: Linerlock
Some of our valued early members have suggested a Tanto blade option for their Wootz EDC. We loved this idea so much we went back to the drawing board and designed, sketched and modelled a Tanto version as seen above. Due to the production schedule, we have decided to introduce the Tanto design as a stretch goal for our campaign.                         Team         100% Satisfaction guaranteed

story:
Want yours by Christmas? Back the "Christmas Pledges" by December 15th, 2013 and we'll get it to you in time (US only)

“Prepare for the unknown by studying how others in the past have coped with the unforeseeable and the unpredictable” – General George S. Patton

1) Why do I need an everyday survival kit?

Statistically, by the time this IndieGoGo campaign concludes:

  • The president will have declared 4 natural disasters via FEMA
  • The US Coast guard will assist nearly 6000 people during 3100+ search and rescue operations, saving the lives of 497 people. Sadly, 71 people won’t survive. 
  • 2.5 Million Americans will travel internationally for a typical stay of 2+ weeks
  • The average American will spend nearly 24 hours driving in their car

Bottom line: Emergencies, disasters and potential survival situations are a part of our everyday lives and we need powerful everyday survival gear to effectively combat them. Ranging from inconvenient and minor to life threatening and severe, these emergencies will strike without warning or prejudice toward lifestyle, income, age, race, or gender. Murphy (from Murphy’s Law), is ruthless: he will strike us at the absolutely worst moment when we are unequipped, unprepared, and vulnerable. Don’t let him catch you offguard, keep a survival kit with you at all times.

     Who is GyverGear for?

  • “Preppers”, Travellers, Do-It-Yourselfers, Military, Law Enforcement, Public Service Personnel, Pilots and Flight Attendants, Hikers, Campers, Boaters, Hunters, Parents…really anyone

     Who is GyverGear not for?

  • Anyone who likes being caught unprepared or thinks they are immune from everyday emergencies or disasters

2) GyverGear Story

Even from day one of BUD/s (Navy SEAL Training program) the SEAL obsession with preparation and resourcefulness was pounded into our psyches. “Never be caught unprepared, have backups to everything, and learn to use what’s available in new and clever ways”. It’s our standard procedure to have an emergency kit within arms reach at all times. Usually, we carry it in a durable bottle that can fit nearly anywhere: a backpack pouch, a cargo pocket, or even a belt loop. When I came back from my most recent combat deployment I realized that my family and friends wouldn’t have this incredible “tool” at their fingertips during a crisis. So, I went out to buy it for them, only to discover that it doesn’t exist. The only options were uselessly cheap, inadequate or completely out of touch with realistic survival situations. It was from this void that GyverGear was born with a mission: to create the ultimate everyday survival kits - small enough to carry, yet powerful enough to count.

Every survival kit, commercial or homemade, is built upon three pillars

1) Affordability

2) Size to usefulness ratio

3) Durability and quality

Until now, it has been virtually impossible to find a comprehensive survival kit prioritizing all three of these pillars. GyverGear is here to change that.

3) Where do I store GyverGear?

Good (in car)      -      Better (in bag)      -      Best (on person)

(Hard-Core: All three)

4) GyverGear vs. Others

5) Perks

6) Status: Finished Prototype

  • Our prototypes are 90% complete, and manufacturers have already been notified. The only things we are missing are the criticisms, suggestions, inputs, and refinements provided by our backers. Once we perform our final tweaks and additions, we can pull the trigger on a days notice.

7) Why IndieGoGo?

  • After I came home from deployment, I sold my guns and some tactical gear in order to scrounge up enough cash to prototype and design GyverGear. Now, in order to actually produce this quality of gear at low enough prices, we have to order from our manufacturers in bulk (otherwise our kits would cost double their current prices). And in order to cover our production, assembly and shipping costs, we need to raise a minimum of $10,000 to break even. Hence our $10K goal. 

8) Production Timeline

9) FAQ

Are GyverTin and GyverCan TSA Safe?
Depending on TSA's mood any given day, nail clippers aren't safe. However, as long as the knife/razor blades are removed, GyverTin and GyverCan both comply with TSA policies. Having said that, we recommend checking it in a bag when traveling by plane to ensure TSA doesn't get jealous and confiscate it for themselves.

What do I need to add to my kit when it arrives?

We recommend adding the following to make your kit as full as possible: Cash, USB charging cord for your specific phone, medicine according to your needs (though we include recommendations with the kits), USB drive with electronic backups of important information and documents

story:
Let me take you to a place where you can catch your own breakfast, do volcano boarding in the afternoon, swim with sharks on weekends and dance with new old friends at an underground jungle party.
 

>

But first, meet me.

This is Luis, (previous hostel owner, international traveler & UNICEF-backed entrepreneur ) founder of Vynil, inviting you to be part of our tribe.

Born and raised in Nicaragua. My entrepreneurial journey has taken me to more than 7 countries across 3 continents. I never expected to connect with so many wonderful individuals and decided I would dedicate my life to making traveling affordable & awesome.

We all desire more from life... a sense of self and understanding that is only clear when we travel and have adventures that push us out of our comfort zones.

 


That is why myself and a global team of designers, psychologists, & economists  decided to build Vynil.

A mobile application that helps young tourists find unique events and venues across Latin America based on their proximity, mood, and budget while providing discounts and empowering local economies.

...and why does it matter?
Corporate tourism doesn't only affect tourists looking for unique experiences... it a̶f̶f̶e̶c̶t̶s̶   destroys the livelihood of local businesses in tourist locations that DO provide unique inspired experiences.



With a donation of $15+ you will help make visible 100+ local businesses all across Latin America!

  • Plus you will get an invite to our exclusive community group (Vynil Global Tribe)
  • Get tailored made discounts, personalized customer service,
  • Local hot spots recommendations
  • Connect you with our friends and show you how to fun while staying on budget!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am 17 and a Senior and Jenks High School.
  • This may possibly be my last trip to Belize.....at least as a student.  Maybe some day I'll return as a sponsor!
  • I was a part of the Drama Team last year and it was a great ministry tool.  I am ready to bring the gospel to the people of Belize again this year!

What I Need

  • The total cost for the trip is $1500.00.  I am requesting $750.00 here because I and hoping to raise the rest in other ways.  If this brings in more than $750.00 it will go directly to my personal account at the church to pay for this or other mission trips.

The Impact

  • We are working with a minister in Belize and have been in the process of planting a church there to reach the people of Belize for Christ.
  • As a church, we have been ministering to the people of Belize for 8 years.  I am excited to be a part of that!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  I request that you:

    • Pass this on to others in hopes that they may be able to help and
    • PRAY, PRAY, PRAY!

    Thank you and God bless!

story:
Units Ready to Be Shipped

We will begin shipping the first round of USA backers who ordered before November 20th, 2017 in early December.

We will be shipping the next round of orders late January or early February 2018. 

 

 

 

How many gallons can it filter?

Up to 100 gallons.

Are the filters replaceable?

No, not at this time. We are hoping this may be an option in the future.

Does it only fit camelbaks?

No, the FIXT Nomad works with almost all water bladders. Your nomad includes 9 total fittings and connectors to go from the straw to water bladder to hot water tank.

What does the FIXT Nomad remove?

Aesthetics, bacteria, chemical and radiological contaminants, including fluoride, chlorine, heavy metals and prescription drugs.

What can't the FIXT Nomad filter remove?

The FIXT Nomad can filter almost any water source, except for saltwater.

Where can I see the studies proving what the FIXT Nomad can remove?

See the story section on the campaign page.

Is your dog's name really Poseidon?

Yes, Ian is that passionate about water. :)

How much does the FIXT Nomad weigh?

The unit itself weighs just 2.45oz.

What are the dimensions of the Nomad?

The FIXT Nomad is smaller than a deck of cards, it is only 2.5"x4.5"x1.25".

When will I receive my FIXT Nomad?

We will begin shipping the first round of orders from the USA received before November 20th, 2017 in early December. Other backers can expect their Nomad in late March to early April.

What other Products does FIXT Water sell?

We at FIXT Water are passionate about clean water that goes both into and on your body. See our pitcher, water bottle, life straw and shower head.

Who do I contact if I have a question?

Please comment here on the campaign board or email happiness@fixtwater.com.

What if I want to buy more than 50 Nomads?

Please contact happiness@fixtwater.com and we would be happy to work with you to make a package.

Where are the filters made?

The filters are made and assembled here in the USA. Some of the components come from our manufacturer's sister company in China.

Is it hard to suck water through the straw?

No, it isn't hard. That said it does require enough suction to draw water through the filter.

What kind of testing is done on the Nomad?

Each FIXT Nomad is individually flushed, dried and packaged to ensure water flow and that any particles or materials from manufacturing are removed. It has been extensively tested by independent state and EPA laboratories. It is tested to NSF/ANSI protocol 42 & 53.

Did Ian really drink out of that toilet?

Yes, Ian drank from the toilet as you saw in the video. He has drunk from numerous toilets, including one at LAX, as well as has tested other FIXT products in stagnant lakes, jacuzzis, fountains and a few other gross water sources.

Does it really remove bacteria? Can I travel to 3rd world countries with this?

Absolutely! It is one of the great uses of the FIXT Nomad, traveling. The filters remove 99.999% of bacteria.

Do you ship worldwide?

We do! We have shipped out to many countries and we have a flat rate for the EU. If your county is not listed, please get in touch with us at happiness@fixtwater.com and we will provide a shipping quote.

How do I know when I need to replace my filter?

The Nomad will get more difficult to draw water through and eventually it will stop being able to draw water completely once the filter has reached its lifespan. The filtering ability will not degrade over time, it is safe to continue using until the point where water can no longer.

What is the filter micron rating?

The filter has a 2micron rating.

story:
SIMPLE TRAVEL SHIRTS WITH INCREASED SECURITY

TRAVEL ANYWHERE, ANYTIME WITH PIECE OF MIND!

FOLLOW US : @instagram / Facebook / website

 

FEATURED ON

 

Our vision is to help people create ever lasting memories through stress-fee travels!

inFLIGHT Apparel is a new innovative bamboo travel shirt with built-in invisible security pockets for your passport, cellphone, money and cards.

Our shirts are made with a unique fabric made of Rayon from Bamboo, cotton stretch jersey. The shirts offer all the benefits of Bamboo with the right level of stretch to ensure they keep their shape and quality for a long time.

I wanted to introduce you to inFLIGHT apparel, a stylish and simple travel shirt that has three invisible security pockets and can be worn for a week without being washed.

So, ditch your uncool fanny packs, uncomfortable security under belts, unusable security belts or any other unpractical solution, and upgrade your next trip with inFLIGHT! 

In addition, we wanted to build a socially responsible brand that could have a positive impact on the world. This is why we will contribute 1% of our sales to Project Aware, to support their work in keeping our oceans clean and healthy

 

 

Our men's shirts have 3 security pockets, 1 security pocket on each side to safely store your phone, money and cards, and a security passport pocket at the bottom right inside of the shirt.

 

 

Our women's shirts also have three security pockets that is naked to the eye

1 security pocket on each side of the neckline to safely store your money and cards, and a security passport pocket is located at the bottom right inside of the shirt.

 

 

 

The slim fit, soft feel and V-neck style can be dressed up with a blazer for the office, or can be dressed down for a night on the town

 

 

 

The versatile design makes it the perfect shirt for real life, with active kids during your travels

With inFLIGHT you can spend time on what truly is important, creating memories!

WE INVITE YOU TO COME ON AN ADVENTURE AND LIVE THE inFLIGHT EXPERIENCE, WITHOUT THE MENTAL & PHYSICAL BURDEN OF SECURITY & WORRIES OF WORRYING ABOUT YOUR CASH, CARDS OR PASSPORT.

NO MORE OF THIS!!! 

 

In inches

 

 

inFLIGHT apparel is a family founded company, with the purpose to help people to create everlasting memories through travel

My wife and I came up with the idea behind inFLIGHT on our first backpacking trip in Italy together, as young university graduates. We were young, full of energy, with not a care in the world (This is before kids). It was a hot summer day and I was wearing a cotton T-shirt and Bermuda shorts, where I was carrying my wallet. After carrying our heavy luggage to our hostel, we decided to start our sightseeing adventure and jumped on a crowed city bus to downtown Rome. As we disembarked the bus, I reached into my pocket to pull out my wallet to discover that I had been victim of a pickpocket!

There is nothing more violating and frustrating to be a pickpocket victim!!!

After that day, we used a combination of money belts, waist belts, fanny packs, to carry our cash, credit cards, and identifications

However, after each day we came to the conclusion that there had to be a better way. The cash belt was so inconvenient to use, the fanny pack was so dorky, the waist belt got super stinky and uncomfortable. In addition, we couldn’t find a proper travel shirt that could enable us to minimize our packing, reduce the need to wash our clothes multiple times throughout our trip (As the majority of our shirts were made of cotton)

We were seeking a way to take the stress and hassles out of travelling

inFLIGHT apparel was created with that same spirit in mind – to solve a problem that we all have encountered on our adventures away from home. Turns out, stressing over the security of our valuables and hauling around heavy luggage was no way to see the world

inFLIGHT shirts were designed and tested in the streets, planes, and cruises

Our purpose is to enable people to spend time on what is truly important – creating wonderful memories with your loved ones through the magic of travel

With inFLIGHT we want to enable everyone to go anywhere, any time with peace of mind!!!

The cash belt was so inconvenient to use, the fanny pack was so dorky, the waist belt got super stinky and uncomfortable. In addition, we couldn’t find a proper travel shirt that could enable us to minimize our packing, reduce the need to wash our clothes multiple times throughout our trip (As the majority of our shirts were made of cotton)We were seeking a way to take the stress and hassles out of travellinginFLIGHT apparel was created with that same spirit in mind – to solve a problem that we all have encountered on our adventures away from home. Turns out, stressing over the security of our valuables and hauling around heavy luggage was no way to see the worldinFLIGHT shirts were designed and tested in the streets, planes, and cruisesOur purpose is to enable people to spend time on what is truly important – creating wonderful memories with your loved ones through the magic of travelWith inFLIGHT we want to enable everyone to go anywhere, any time with peace of mind!!!

story:
The Oomph is the worlds fastest hand powered portable coffee maker and travel cup: Pressure brewing the perfect coffee in under 2 minutes! 

Elegant in design, The Oomph pressure brews the perfect coffee at home, in the office or when out and about travelling. 

 

 

 

 

 

Created by a desire to always have an amazing cup of coffee, The Oomph is a simple to use coffee maker insulated by an air barrier that keeps your freshly brewed coffee at the perfect temperature. It uses your movement to stir – ensuring for a great cup of coffee from the first to the last sip.

 

     

 

 

    
 

 

 

 1. Add coffee. The Oomph has an internal marker indicating the perfect amount of coffee to use. We found the perfect amount to be between 25 and 28 grams of coffee. We have tested with all kinds of grinds (eg; espresso, cafetiere and omni) - and they all produce a wonderfully smooth cup of coffee!

2. Add hot water. Simply fill the Oomph with hot water and wait for a few seconds. A fill line indicates how much water to use. If you'd like a smaller or stronger coffee simply use less water.
 
3. Add pressure. Pressing down the outer shell of the Oomph forces pressurized water through the ground coffee; the perfectly brewed coffee then travels up the exterior walls and back into the internal chamber, resulting in an incredibly smooth and rich coffee. (This process also stirs the coffee)

Once brewed you can pour the coffee into a cup or grab your bag and keys and take The Oomph right out the door with you!

The Oomph is way more than just a just a fancy Cafetiere and (unlike a french press) pressure brews the coffee - resulting in a deliciously smooth and rich coffee. We have performed numerous tests against several coffee devices with the Oomph coming out on top. See below where we've pitched the Oomph against the French Press.

 

 

 

 

 

Out and about

 

At Home

 

In the office

 

 

The Oomph can hold upto 13fl oz (around 380ml) of brewed coffee within the internal chamber. For this amount of delicious coffee we suggest between 25g and 28g of freshly ground coffee. The Oomph has been designed with an internal line so you don’t need a measuring spoon or scale.

 

 

 

                            

 

 

 

 

Want to Add Sugar and Milk? We’ve got that covered too. Once you’ve plunged fully, you can unscrew the lid and add your milk & sugar. Screw the cap back on and enjoy your cup of coffee. 

 

             

 

Super Quick to Clean. We’ve designed The Oomph to take a matter of seconds to clean and be ready for reuse. Remove the shell, tap out the grinds and add a small amount of water. Return the shell and plunge up and down for around 20 seconds and pour out the water. You are now ready to brew again.

 

             
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We’ve taken testing of The Oomph seriously. We’ve had the device tested by several experts, including Jonny England, A World Barista Championship Judge, Q Grader & SCAE certified trainer.

In the video below Jonny explains his findings from a day of testing The Oomph portable coffee maker.

    

 

 

 

 

 

Our backers agree - the Oomph is the perfect companion. Here are some of our favourite pictures sent in by our customers:

 

 

 

 

 

The Work Commute: An issue for many coffee lovers, the morning or evening commute can often mean spending several pounds on mediocre coffee on the high street or even on the train. As a Make & Take device, you can make your perfect brew at home knowing that it will remain warm until you get to work. The Oomph also fits perfectly in most car cup holders. 

In The Office: The Oomph will give you ultimate bragging rights on who has the best gadget along with the best coffee in the office. No longer will instant coffee or the percolator haunt your daily working. Plus because you can drink from the device or decant into cup, you could even consider share your coffee with colleagues... 

Camping and Hiking: When we are out in the wilderness we are all guilty of missing great coffee. As a self contained unit you can really make your perfect brew when out and about. As long as you’ve got hot water fresh from your camping stove and coffee, you will be the envy of the camp site (or the top of the mountain) with your delicious cup of coffee. 

At Home: Of course, The Oomph isn’t just about Better Coffee on the Go, it’s about having an amazing cup of coffee everywhere – this includes at home. The sleek and stylish design and range of colours mean that The Oomph will fit well into any kitchen or home office.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

During the past few years, Matthew has filed and has patents pending on the device. He has been working with industry experts (in coffee, plastics and other fields) and with a final prototype has completed a crowdfunding campaign.

Get in Touch

Matthew Deasy, Creator: Matthew*at*The-Oomph.com
Neil Harrison, Marketing: Neil*at*The-Oomph.com

story:
People love summer but nobody likes to get overheated. When the sun becomes too much to handle, it would be perfect to have a personal air conditioner. But typical air conditioners are too heavy and cumbersome to take on the go.
 

 

That’s why we created Coolingstyle, a compact and portable, go-anywhere, multifunctional air conditioner with 3 cooling effects and other useful functions.

 

For those who want to escape from the heat wave and stay cool, Coolingstyle is a must-have gadget.


Coolingstyle works perfectly both outdoors and indoors. It is a super portable device for you to stay cool during any outdoor activities such as camping, on the beach, in the backyard or for use in the home/office to have perfect cooling anytime.
 

Tent
 

Beach
 

Yard
 

For indoor usage, just plug it into the nearest outlet and simply attach the hose, then extend the other end outside through a door or window. The 3 levels of cooling can quickly cool down any space.

                                          
  • Beat the Heat with Coolingstyle

Coolingstyle uses specially designed micro rotary compression refrigeration technology. This latest tech means big power out of small compressors, allowing for a new class of compact and efficient air conditioners. With a 1700BTU/H cooling capacity, Coolingstyle can cool down a 55 square ft. room in a few minutes.
 

  • Compact and Easy to Carry 

At only 5.6KG weight and almost the same size as a backpack, Coolingstyle can easily go anywhere your activities take you.
 

  • Easy to Use

Coolingstyle provides 3 cooling settings for the perfect breeze level for any occasion. The adjustable cooling levels conserve energy.
 


It can be used with a standard power plug, a car charging adapter or the Coolingstyle portable rechargeable battery which can last for more than 5 hours on a single charge.
 

 
  • Other Useful Functions

Coolingstyle has a silent, ultrasonic mosquito repellent for more comfortable outdoor activities, two USB ports to charge your phone or mobile devices and a bright LED light for nighttime use. In the event of an emergency the LED has a red SOS light signal function to be seen from long distances.
 

                                           

 
Working Prototype：

story:
Hi everyone.

I am 17 years old.   Those of you who know me well can attest to the fact that I live to ride my bike down steep hills very fast.   I have been shredding mountains on 2 wheels for my whole life.  I've been passionate about the sport since I was very young.  I hadn't ever intended on riding competitively, but after achieving very strong race results on the BC Cup circut in 2011 and 2012 (without previous coaching or training), my fire was lit. Nelson and the West Kootenay region is sheltered from the mountain bike racing scene,  so my strong race results really made me stand out amongst the provincial race community.  

Due to these strong results, and my commitment to working hard,  I have been chose for a very prestigious spot on the PerformX Junior Development Team. This is an enormous opportunity for a young rider, and it will open  many doors for my future in racing. With the proffesional coaching, training and sponsors that come with this team I will be racing on the Canadian National Circut and with a lot of hard work and good results I will be fed into the Professional World Cup Downhill Circut. This is a dream for me personally, but it's also an opportunity to represent the West Kootenay and my province.  I'm working hard to fund raise, and my folks are helping me out.  With your help though, I can make this dream come true.   

In total, my season will cost about $8000.  I'll face expenses for training, travel, and race fees.   I'm working part-time while finishing grade 12 so everything I earn is going towards my riding.  I'm also being sponsored by Kootenay Mountain Sports in Kaslo, Nelson & District Credit Union, NRG Enterprises, The Nelson Lions CLub and the Nelson Cycling Club. Through Indie Gogo I'm hoping to raise $3000 of the $8000 I need.  

Please consider making a donation to help me cover my riding expenses.  Every little bit will be very helpful.  If you can't make a financial donation, then please help spread the word about my campaign either through your personal connections or on Facebook. There may be others out there who would be keen to support a kid like me.   

Click below to view more information about me on my website, the recent Nelson Star Newspaper Article, and Facebook.  THANKS!

story:
Chasing the Lights

This project will chase the Northern Lights thru Alaska over the Winter of 2012-2013. I am fortunate to have an employer that allows me to work a 7 day on and 7 day off work schedule. My plan is to spend 8 weeks (every other week) over a period of four months traveling in Alaska from Anchorage to Deadhorse, Fairbanks, Tok, Valdez, and other remote and senic areas to capture the Aurora Borealis pheonomenon while documenting Alaska's natural beauty.

Currently I have funded and purchased the required photographic gear. I invested in a Nikon D800 36 megapixel camera to update the D300 I have used in the past, to capture in greater detail. I have invested in Nikon lenses and other equipment required.

The costs of pursuing this project includes gasoline to travel an estimated 8200 miles during the course of this project. The costs for fuel are approximated at $1,700.00.

Shelter and food during the 8 weeks are etimated at approximately $8400.00. Otherwise the plan is to sleep in my SUV in a sleeping bag rated for -40. Temperatures will range from +20 to -60 during this project. 

Total expenses and project costs are estimated to be $10,250. I have sent the minimum goal at $1,000, but am hoping to fully fund the project. Any funds above the goal amont will be spent on additional equipment.

Alaska is a place of enchanting beauty, and I am greatful to be able to continue photographing and sharing in it's beauty.

story:
Cowley’s “Passing of the Legends” will become part of its name as of January 1st, 2014. It is with sincere sadness that Cowley’s Rafter Six Ranch Resort as we know it, will be closing.

38 years ago, Stan Cowley - a visionary and entrepreneur, came across the ranch in the Canadian Rockies and realized there was something very special about this ranch and decided it was too nice not to share. Rafter Six is an Alberta family run business, and they have dedicated their entire lives, home, sweat and tears to the sharing and preserving Canada’s  historical “cowboy western lifestyle” with the world.

As you may, or may not be aware, Stan and Gloria entered into an agreement with a Calgary resort developer in 2008 to expand Rafter Six Ranch Resort. The resort land and buildings were put into the agreement and the joint venture partner would provide the development expertise and funding. Unfortunately, it was at the beginning of the recession and our joint venture partner went into a form of receivership which left us on our own to swim in the sea of debt that was amassed during the initial stages of the agreement. We have now become a casualty of this event.

Sadly, after being on the losing end of this long struggle, the Ranch will be closing in January and the Cowley’s will be uprooted from their business, home and livelihood shortly after Christmas. This tragic event will leave the Cowley family with just the memories.
…and they say cowboys don’t cry.

The Cowley's have sincerely done their best to provide a unique, quality service with genuine hospitality for the past 38 years. Thank you all for being a part of this history. Your respect of our family, ideals, vision and hope for the future will be cherished as they move through this transition.

Millions of people have come to Rafter Six Ranch Resort and stayed, played, married, worked, prayed, made friendships, conquered fears, fallen in love, and made memories of a lifetime…If Rafter Six Ranch Resort has touched your lives, please touch the lives of the ones who have had stewardship over the past four decades.

 If we aim high enough, we can continue the legacy and with your help and contributions, the Cowley’s will be able to get back on their feet to start a new life. You can help by donating to help ease legal, moving & storage costs, horse hay, time, kind words… it all helps.

To everyone that has been touched by Rafter Six Ranch and/or the Cowley family, please share your story to be placed on our “Wall of Legends” and showcased for the world to see how we have contributed to your life in some way. We hope the love and passion we have put into Rafter Six Ranch over the years have left a legacy in your heart. Please share your stories, memories, photographs and prayers and raise awareness on Facebook and other social media. Share this link and lets help the west stay alive!

Email your stories to kateri@raftersix.com

God bless and Happy Trails… Until we meet again.

story:
THE NEED

 A centralized economy doesn't work for most rural Americans. Building the Agricultural City demonstrates the case for rural Americans to work cooperatively to create self-reliant, decentralized economies. And now you can help share tools for self-reliance and sustainability applicable to any region, and help promote decentralized economies. Building the Agricultural City will enable rural Americans to create productive economies that grow prosperity and democracy. This is the rural America you can help create with your support.

 

WHAT CAN BE DONE

To restore health to their regions, rural Americans must transform their service economies into productive economies. Building the Agricultural City describes the tools that can do this. These tools, which are scattered across the country, can be assembled within various regions to establish self-reliant, sustainable economies. Here are a few:

1.Community development banks, whose mandate is to serve the under-served, would focus on small business start-ups. There are only 66 community development banks in the United States. We need more.

2. What kind of businesses? Ideally, worker-owned cooperatives. The Emilia Romagna region in Italy has thousands and it has the third highest per capita income in Italy.

3. Closed-loop agricultural systems that raised fish and vegetables would provide locally grown, fresh food year round.

4.Municipal owned utilities powered by renewable energy .

THE PROCESS

Rural Americans now understand that they must be self-reliant, that regionalism is the only counter to globalism. By buying, reading. and passing Building the Agricultural City on to others, you will help promote the idea of a decentralized economy.

One hundred copies of the book will be given to community leaders in the Driftless region with the understanding that they provide feedback to those of us working on this project. I will give readings and hold discussions throughout the Driftless region and friends of the project will host events in their homes.

CHALLENGES

Many rural Americans are conservative, distrustful of change. Many cannot see alternatives to the present system, even when they know their towns are dying. Others have a vested interest in keeping things the way they are. Those of us involved in this project have no illusions about winning everyone over, or that building a cooperative regional economy will take a few years. It will be a long, arduous process. But we have no alternative but to try. And there are enough creative people who have pledged to work on the project's behalf that we know we can build successful models that will win more people over.

 

 

Building the Agricultural City focuses on the Driftless region of the Midwest, but its lessons are applicable to all rural areas. Your support will spread our message across America, giving hope to those who feel powerless within the present system. With your help we can begin to transform rural America. If you are unable to support this project financially, please email this link your friends and post on Facebook. You can use the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

WHERE THE MONEY GOES

* Printing (including set-up and proofs).

* Shipping (from printer to Iowa).

* 100 books given away to community leaders.

* The Pitch Video.

* Travel (a 300 mile circuit of readings and discussions.)

*  Marketing (mailing books to journalists and talk show hosts).

*  Postcards (printing).

WHAT IS AN AGRICULTURAL CITY?

Imagine that towns in neighboring rural counties no longer see themselves as distinct entities, but as nodes of population within one city. It is a different kind of city.  Call it an Agricultural City. Imagine that these clusters of towns no longer see themselves as rivals; they understand that only cooperation and coordinated effort will reverse decline and restore prosperity. 

Building the Agricultural City describes a vision of a human-centered regional economy and how we might transform  the vision into reality.
