story:
Our Story

 

Grey Horse Apps is an equestrian startup from Ireland. We are passionate horse people and avid tech entrepreneurs. We believe in 'big concept' horsemanship training and we want to make this knowledge accessible to everyone. We will create a pioneering iPhone and iPad app, distributed worldwide, that aims to teach the ‘big concepts’ of good horsemanship - feel, balance and timing.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need your help to make this app.  Every person who supports our indiegogo.com project will make a huge difference.

 

 

 

  1. Contribute to our development fund and earn some great rewards in return, including free horse training notes,  rosettes, books signed by the author, cdroms, superb  www.HamishandOzzie.com hand made sterling silver horsehair bracelets, custom made from your own horse’s tail hair, or lunch with the Grey Horse Apps CEO in our favourite restaurant located in Dublin
  2. Share our badges with your friends on facebook and twitter.
  3. Let your friends and equine colleagues know about our project.  Getting the word out about this project means the world to us
  4. Follow us on twitter: @greyhorseapps or www.facebook.com/greyhorseapps
  5. If you have any great ideas, we’d love to hear them.  Contact us at: irishnh@gmail.com

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Where the money goes

 

All design and graphic work for this horsemanship app will be done by the Grey Horse. The money raised will all go to the development costs of this app. A lot of custom work will be involved.

 

The more money we can raise, the more lessons we can include in the app. Indiegogo also takes some fees to host this project: 7% of funds raised cover the standard indiegogo.com costs. “When your campaign raises money, IndieGoGo charges a 4% fee on the money you raise. If you don't reach your goal, the fee is 9% on the money you raise. Third party payment processors charge an additional fee of about 3%.”

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Big concept horsemanship principals

 

 

Here are the 'big concept' horsemanship lessons we want to create. The more funds we raise, the more exercises we can include in this app.

 

Soft feel:Picking up a soft feel using the reins as cues, is the beginning of collection. A soft feel has to go from your hands to the horse’s mouth, through the horse’s body, and to his feet. A soft feel is when the horse isn’t pushing on you through the reins, and you’re not pushing on your horse with the rein either. It feels like you are both concentrating very hard on each other mentally. You will feel a lightness and softness in your hands and throughout the horse’s body. Being able to ask your horse for a soft feel will make a huge difference in the quality of ALL of your ridden work.

 

Footfall: As riders we need to know the footfall of all gaits in order to ride with knowledge and influence the horse’s movement efficiently.

 

Getting in time with your horse’s feet: When you ask your horse to turn or yield, without being aware of what his four feet are doing at that time, feels to the horse like you are purposely trying to trip him up. This app will teach you how to influence each leg – at the most appropriate and favourable time, in walk, trot and canter. Combined with soft feel, being able to truly ride in time with your horse’s feet takes riding up to much higher levels of performance.

 

Achieving a balanced horse at halt: At the halt, the horse should be 50% forwards and 50% backwards. He should be equally prepared to move in any direct you ask him. At halt, some horses can lean on their forequarters and feel like they want to go forwards, more than any other direction. They are not in balance. This exercise teaches you how to address this and rebalance your horse so he is more prepared for any move you ask – not just forwards.

 

Using a change of balance at halt to prepare to move one foot laterally: To ask a horse to move his leg sideways, you must prepare by redistributing your weight on his back to allow him to do this easily. If a lot of your weight is actually going down to the foot you want to move, it makes it much more different for your horse to lift that foot. This exercise teaches you where to position your body in the saddle to allow each specified foot to move freely when asked.

 

Ask your horse to concentrate physically and mentally on your work together:To work well together, the horse and the rider must be constantly listening to each other. This exercise will teach you how to recognise when you horse looses focus on you, and how to get their attention back again in an efficient and simple way.

 

Teaching personal space: It is very important that you teach your horse to respect your personal space. So he should not push into you, walk over you, or stand on top of you. This exercises gives you the tools to recognise when you are being pushed on, and how to improve the situation.

 

Backup with soft feel: A horse should backup with softness and lightness, in a two beat gait.This exercise will teach you the steps to achieve this.

 

Always do less: This is one of the biggest concepts in horsemanship and is the key to continuously make daily improvements in your riding. This exercise demonstrates the principal in practical terms.

 

Feeling for and of the horse: When you use the reins, you should slowly pick up any slack, rather then surprise your horse by pulling on a slack rein suddenly and bumping on his mouth. Picking up the slack in the rein slowly give your horse time to be ready for a change and keeps him feeling relaxed.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

About us

 

Grey Horse Apps is an Irish based equestrian startup. We are passionate horse people and avid tech entrepreneurs. We were recently awarded 2nd place in the ‘Best ever apps’ awards in San Francisco for our free ‘Save a horse’ app, created to support the work of the Irish Horse Welfare Trust in Ireland. We have a number of equine reference apps published, including ‘groundwork’, ‘equine vet’ and ‘riding exercises’. ‘Feel, timing and balance’ is our first large scale interactive app.  We are looking for your help, support and feedback to make this a groundbreaking product. The Grey Horse is a beautiful and opinionated grey Connemara called Ozzie. He kindly features in our promotional campaigns and reviews and road tests all of our products.
story_txt:
Our Story
 
Grey Horse Apps is an equestrian startup from Ireland. We are passionate horse people and avid tech entrepreneurs. We believe in 'big concept' horsemanship training and we want to make this knowledge accessible to everyone. We will create a pioneering iPhone and iPad app, distributed worldwide, that aims to teach the ‘big concepts’ of good horsemanship - feel, balance and timing.
 


 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
What We Need & What You Get
 
We need your help to make this app.  Every person who supports our indiegogo.com project will make a huge difference. 
 
 
 


Contribute to our development fund and earn some great rewards in return, including free horse training notes,  rosettes, books signed by the author, cdroms, superb  www.HamishandOzzie.com hand made sterling silver horsehair bracelets, custom made from your own horse’s tail hair, or lunch with the Grey Horse Apps CEO in our favourite restaurant located in Dublin

Share our badges with your friends on facebook and twitter. 
Let your friends and equine colleagues know about our project.  Getting the word out about this project means the world to us
Follow us on twitter: @greyhorseapps or www.facebook.com/greyhorseapps
If you have any great ideas, we’d love to hear them.  Contact us at: irishnh@gmail.com
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
Where the money goes
 
All design and graphic work for this horsemanship app will be done by the Grey Horse. The money raised will all go to the development costs of this app. A lot of custom work will be involved. 
 
The more money we can raise, the more lessons we can include in the app. Indiegogo also takes some fees to host this project: 7% of funds raised cover the standard indiegogo.com costs. “When your campaign raises money, IndieGoGo charges a 4% fee on the money you raise. If you don't reach your goal, the fee is 9% on the money you raise. Third party payment processors charge an additional fee of about 3%.”
 
 
 
 
 


 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Big concept horsemanship principals
 
 
Here are the 'big concept' horsemanship lessons we want to create. The more funds we raise, the more exercises we can include in this app. 
 
Soft feel:Picking up a soft feel using the reins as cues, is the beginning of collection. A soft feel has to go from your hands to the horse’s mouth, through the horse’s body, and to his feet. A soft feel is when the horse isn’t pushing on you through the reins, and you’re not pushing on your horse with the rein either. It feels like you are both concentrating very hard on each other mentally. You will feel a lightness and softness in your hands and throughout the horse’s body. Being able to ask your horse for a soft feel will make a huge difference in the quality of ALL of your ridden work.
 
Footfall: As riders we need to know the footfall of all gaits in order to ride with knowledge and influence the horse’s movement efficiently.
 
Getting in time with your horse’s feet: When you ask your horse to turn or yield, without being aware of what his four feet are doing at that time, feels to the horse like you are purposely trying to trip him up. This app will teach you how to influence each leg – at the most appropriate and favourable time, in walk, trot and canter. Combined with soft feel, being able to truly ride in time with your horse’s feet takes riding up to much higher levels of performance. 
 
Achieving a balanced horse at halt: At the halt, the horse should be 50% forwards and 50% backwards. He should be equally prepared to move in any direct you ask him. At halt, some horses can lean on their forequarters and feel like they want to go forwards, more than any other direction. They are not in balance. This exercise teaches you how to address this and rebalance your horse so he is more prepared for any move you ask – not just forwards.
 
Using a change of balance at halt to prepare to move one foot laterally: To ask a horse to move his leg sideways, you must prepare by redistributing your weight on his back to allow him to do this easily. If a lot of your weight is actually going down to the foot you want to move, it makes it much more different for your horse to lift that foot. This exercise teaches you where to position your body in the saddle to allow each specified foot to move freely when asked.
 
Ask your horse to concentrate physically and mentally on your work together:To work well together, the horse and the rider must be constantly listening to each other. This exercise will teach you how to recognise when you horse looses focus on you, and how to get their attention back again in an efficient and simple way. 
 
Teaching personal space: It is very important that you teach your horse to respect your personal space. So he should not push into you, walk over you, or stand on top of you. This exercises gives you the tools to recognise when you are being pushed on, and how to improve the situation. 
 
Backup with soft feel: A horse should backup with softness and lightness, in a two beat gait.This exercise will teach you the steps to achieve this. 
 
Always do less: This is one of the biggest concepts in horsemanship and is the key to continuously make daily improvements in your riding. This exercise demonstrates the principal in practical terms. 
 
Feeling for and of the horse: When you use the reins, you should slowly pick up any slack, rather then surprise your horse by pulling on a slack rein suddenly and bumping on his mouth. Picking up the slack in the rein slowly give your horse time to be ready for a change and keeps him feeling relaxed.
 
 


 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

About us

 
Grey Horse Apps is an Irish based equestrian startup. We are passionate horse people and avid tech entrepreneurs. We were recently awarded 2nd place in the ‘Best ever apps’ awards in San Francisco for our free ‘Save a horse’ app, created to support the work of the Irish Horse Welfare Trust in Ireland. We have a number of equine reference apps published, including ‘groundwork’, ‘equine vet’ and ‘riding exercises’. ‘Feel, timing and balance’ is our first large scale interactive app.  We are looking for your help, support and feedback to make this a groundbreaking product. The Grey Horse is a beautiful and opinionated grey Connemara called Ozzie. He kindly features in our promotional campaigns and reviews and road tests all of our products.

story:
Watly is the first solar-powered computer that purifies water from any source of contamination, generates electricity off-grid, and allows internet connectivity everywhere.

OUR MISSION 

With this crowdfunding campaign, we will consolidate our technological proposition and help our first 3000 people. Join our movement today to transform the lives of millions of people in need and #bewatly 

 


During its 15 years of service, one Watly can reduce as much as 2500 tons of greenhouse gas emissions(CO2) equivalent to 5000 barrels of oil. 





WATLY TEAM EXPLAINS THE PRODUCT:  


  





  


 

 



 

 


 

         


 

 




 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 


 


 

 

 

 

What is the meaning of your tagline: Life Energy Future?

Our actual tagline is based on three powerful concepts: Life. Energy. Future.

They are our fundamental pillars upon which we intend to build our company value proposition.

“Life” is related to Water, since water is the source of life for every living being.

“Energy” is a synonym of Electricity, certainly the modern way for empowering people.

“Future” refers to Connectivity, as a means of education, social evolution, future well being. In the XXIst century, the internet is everywhere and there is no future for disconnected communities.


Why are you combining water treatment, solar energy and Wifi all in the same device?

We could not design a modern solution and not think about integrating these three elements altogether. The beauty is that these services can be generated by exclusively harvesting solar energy. We provide clean water by leveraging the thermal effect of the solar irradiation. Through photovoltaic technology we generate electricity. With electricity we can power internal telecommunications devices (for satellite or 4G connection). 

Watly provides multiple services because each one is the consequence of the other. Watly is a multi-utility solar HUB and does not compete neither with water filtration systems or off-grid electricity generators. We are not simply building a product but a technological paradigm. Watly is something entirely new never seen before. And if this is not enough, wait to see how in the next future, Watly will also integrate many other amazing features.


How many people will you deliver water to?

One standard unit of Watly can deliver water to communities of up to 3000 people. It can purify up to 5000L of clean water in an average sunny day. Watly is scalable and can also be replicated, and so can the number of people that can benefit from it.


How will you control Water supply for everyone in an equal way?

We are developing W-Tank, a 5L plastic water tank for personal usage. We will deliver one to each individual. Watly automatically refills this tanks when inserted in the machine by it’s owner, we can track the usage through its internal RFID chip.


How many people will you deliver electricity to and how?

In theory one standard unit of Watly could recharge as many as 20000 smart-phones a day or about 5000 W-lights. Practically, we will serve hundreds of people each day for being able to be energy independent for 5-7 days.


How are people going to know how to use this machine?

We count with the help of NGO’s and field partners to instruct communities about how Watly works. Anyways, we are designing simple visual instructions and sound effects that will guide people through the daily use of Watly, it interacts with people through different interfaces and multi-utilities workstations..  


How will you assure security and theft?

Watly is pre-built in a factory, it is extremely difficult to disassemble any piece. Our designers have avoided using visible screws to prevent temptation and create beautiful lines.


How are you going to transport this machine to hard to reach villages?

Watly is made of pre-built macro components. A complete and fully operational unit of Watly equipped with 3000 water tanks and 1000 battery power LED lights can be delivered to any location of the world by deploying five 40” high cube containers, each transportable by standard trucks. All Watly’s macro-components fit together automatically, only between four to eight days are needed from receiving the components to having the machine fully operational.


Have you proven your technology?

Our first prototype has been tested since July 2013, providing consistent data regarding reliability, efficiency and efficacy of the system. Our second prototype has been tested since March 2014, showing high levels of performance and no signs of mechanical failures or breakdowns. One prototype has been tested in Ghana. The outcomes were hugely successful. Several rounds inlet and outlet water analysis have conducted by accredited laboratories. Watly has successfully passed Philips Innovation Risk Assessment. Watly’s team is collaborating with TuV Rheinland to apply for a quality certification by TUV. Watly Factory is ISO 9001 and 14001 Certified.


Is your technology patented?

Indeed we have already obtained two major patents. Moreover Watly R&D department is applying for a patent relative to graphene based technologies as well as patent application relative to a vapor compression distillation unit with unprecedented level of efficiency and reliability.  


For how many years will Watly be fully functional?

Watly's operational lifespan is of +10 years, even in the harshest environmental working conditions.

Watly’s lifespan can be extended beyond this limit with a complete check-up and a thorough maintenance intervention (+15-20 years).


How will you take care of the maintenance?

Anyone with basic technical knowledge and minimum skills can manage Watly. It has been designed to be fully autonomous and to require a minimum level of ordinary maintenance. In any case, should some intervention be needed, end users are always provided with a detailed but intuitive and friendly maintenance manual. Watly has local partners in each country to perform those technical interventions that do require specific training in possible failures, breakdowns, and extraordinary maintenance might be needed. By doing so, Watly also creates jobs locally.


How “green” is Watly?

During its 15 years of service, one Watly can reduce as much as 2000 tons of greenhouse gas emissions (CO2), which is equivalent to 5000 barrels of oil. Watly also aims to reduce as much as possible the carbon footprint “during” the production phase of its devices. Watly is applying for life cycle inventory and impact assessment and plans to recycle up to 88.9% of its components.


How does the wastewater treatment process take place exactly, and how does it compare to existing technologies?

Watly’s purification process works exclusively on solar energy and is based on the physical principle of vapor compression distillation. It is by far the most effective and powerful method of water purification and desalination available. The quality of the water purified by Watly, is outstanding, absolutely pure, low mineralized and with a perfect pH balance (6.8 - 7.2). Watly efficiently desalinates ocean water, eliminates all pathogens and microorganisms from previously polluted water, including: viruses, bacteria, parasites, fungi or cysts. It removes inorganic compounds as well as poisons: arsenic, benzene, heavy metals (such as lead), chlorine, chloramines, and radionuclides. It does not need membranes or filter substitutions. It even purifies radioactive water.

Watly in terms of efficacy, outperforms reverse osmosis, nano-filtration or ultraviolet purification methods. Existing technologies are pure water filtering machines rather than technological HUBs such as Watly. They require periodical maintenance and technical skills from the user point of view due to the use of filters and membranes. In addition, while studying the competition we have often found critical mechanical issues on both the thermal/electrical side. These systems are meant to fail, in harsh environments such as African or Indian landscapes.


Watly does not use Reverse Osmosis, right?

No, it does not and for good cause.

Comparing to reverse osmosis (the method used almost by default):

 •  Watly does not use filters or membranes (which eliminates the need of substitution and risk of fouling and/or breakdowns).

 •  Watly does not needs chemicals such as membrane cleaners, scale inhibitors, antiscalants, corrosion inhibitors, biocides, disinfectants, de-chlorinators and flocculants.

 •  Watly does not waste water or reject untreated water back into the environment. (Watly efficacy is > 99.5%; versus standard methods which are = 30-70%)

 •  Watly does not have a defined limit of water contamination capability processing (provided that we are talking about liquid substances, not mud or solid waste only)

 •  Watly does not destabilize the molecular structure of water; it simply reformats it to its natural pure energetic status.


Does Watly deliver distilled water?

No, it does not. Distilled water is only obtained during one of the intermediate phases of the purification process. Once water is purified, Watly re-mineralizes it and brings it back to ideal levels of pH.


Can you tell us with more detail about the purification method used?

check our webpage for more technical info: http://watly.co/watly


Why don’t you commercialise Watly 2.0?

Many months ago, we were following a different market approach. The idea was to build portable units, ideal for families and small communities. We have not completely abandoned the idea but for the moment, we have steered away from it and opted for building an “infrastructural solution” that can provide services to big communities and big villages.


What's the market reception so far?

During the last months we have been gaining greater and greater momentum. There is a huge interest from potential customers around the world, ranging from the public sector, schools, hospitals, big corporations and NGOs. We have been in contact with some African governments that are budgeting large investments for solving their water and electricity issues. These countries are seriously considering renewable energy as key solutions. We have also been contacted by Indian representatives. The Middle-East will also be an extremely interesting market for us, especially Saudi Arabia, the UAE and Qatar. Surprisingly we have even been contacted by people from California and Australia where water is becoming more and more of a problem. We are also in the radar of big corporations since they understand Watly as a mean of extending their portfolio of services.


Are you a for profit company?

We are a for “ethical” profit company. We do business accordingly to profound ethical values. It is quite clear that we are addressing ones of the greatest challenges of humanity but also ones of the biggest business opportunities of XXIst century. There is a huge market for those entrepreneurs and investors willing to make a step forward.  


What's your business model?

We sell our hardware to the public sector, schools, hospitals as well as big corporations and NGOs (BtoB, BtoG). We can also keep the ownership of the hardware and operate as a service provider. These services are delivered to final users and paid-as-they-go formula (BtoC).


for more questions write us: info@watly.co

story:
(The SeatSnoozer helps keep your head and neck in place when trying to sleep in a seated position. It has a tail that acts as an anchor. You lift your head, you drop the anchor on your back and as you sit back and relax, your own body keeps head and neck in place.)

Why did we start this project? 

We are a father & son team and air travel is a common part of our lives. A lack of quality sleep during our trips was a reoccurring problem. Our goal was to create a product that allowed us to comfortably sleep while sitting on an airplane seat for extended periods of time. 

Like most travelers, we used U-Shaped neck pillows and were mostly disappointed by their inability to provide adequate head and neck support. Frustration always ensued when they fell short. The need for a solution led to regular in-flight experimentation with multiple neck pillows, polyester airline blankets and every pillow we could get our hands on but nothing worked like we had hoped. 

We found ourselves sitting at the bar one night swapping travel horror stories. We always enjoyed tackling problems associated with home projects, so this was quite enjoyable and oddly normal for us. We found some commonality among our stories and it always lead back to our inability to sleep while traveling on airplanes. The beers kept flowing and so did our creative juices and by the end of the night we had scribbled drawings down on a coaster and we believed that we had the beginnings of a solution. I guess you could call it a beer-piphany. 

Over the following weeks, we experimented with duck tape mock ups and fabric scraps. It became a hobby and a great project to casually tackle together. We had fun tinkering and exploring everything from chin supports to literally strapping our heads to the headrest. Every little test served a purpose and some even proved comical. Within time and over 25 prototypes later, a useful and practical solution was born.

(Early Sketch)

(This was quick sketch for our video. It shows all the components including how the neck pillow attaches.)

(Adjustable neck pillow is adjustable up/down and attaches via velcro. The neck pillow really makes this comfortable. It's like lumbar support for your neck.)

(Hear no evil with extra large ear cutouts to accommodate headphones of all sizes. This feature was a result of user feedback.)

(This shot demonstrates use with large headphones. Headphones not included :)

(Hard to tell with this picture but there's soft fleece material on the inside and an easy to clean material on the outside. We had to have this custom laminated to make it comfortable, durable and breathable.)

(Weighs in at just 3.4 ounces and you can squeeze it into your smallest carry-on. We wanted to make it light and compact and we achieved both.)

(Because a lot of the magic happens behind the back, it's difficult to see how it works in one shot. We used this foam head to demonstrate. Everything sits flat and in the right place when in actual use.)

More product pics...

(Clean picture with the neck pillow off and on the side. It velcros to the unit once in use. You only have to set it up once and then it's good to go for all future use.)

(This shows the adjustable velcro head strap. One size fits all. You won't even see it once in use, especially if using headphones.)

(This is a close up of the backpad. This is what holds the SeatSnoozer v2 in place. Your body weight pinches this between your back and the seat. It's super thin, so you wont even feel it and the vents help keep you nice and cool.)


What is the purpose of this product?

The SeatSnoozer prevents head bobbing from taking place, while trying to sleep in a seated position. It also provides adjustable, vertical and lateral head and neck support. This makes the SeatSnoozer ideal for sleeping during prolonged air travel. 

Throughout the design process, we focused on: minimizing weight (3.4 oz), comfort, keeping it highly packable, functional and ready for use right out of your bag with no inflating or complicated setup. In the end it became different from standard travel pillows, in every way. 

The SeatSnoozer looks unique and it is! Let’s face it; U-Shaped neck pillows didn’t look too normal when they first hit the market. Simply put, SeatSnoozer addresses the question of how to sleep on planes.

What is it and how does it work?

While it took quite a bit of work to identify proper angles and functionality, the finished product is actually quite simple. 

The benefit is that it keeps your head and neck in place. It has a tail that acts as an anchor. You lift your head, you drop the anchor on your back and as you sit back and relax, your own body keeps head and neck in place.The "anchor" system makes it infinitely adjustable. After you fit it the first time, you can leave it setup for future use.

If that sounds confusing, I recommend watching our video above which demonstrates this more effectively than I explain via text :) 

Making the SeatSnoozer this simple took a lot of work and our design proved patentable. It was a bonding experience that churned out a really useful solution. We were quite proud and happy we created a product that allowed us to comfortably sleep while sitting upright on planes.

So, where are we at?  

As part of the project, we developed over 25 prototypes, applied stringent functionality tests and design variations. We applied experience gathered with our SeatSnoozer V1 product, which was produced as a short run beta product and proof of concept. We attended the Boston Globe Travel show and received a lot of great input. The feedback gathered from frequent travelers helped us to steer our current design and functionality into the right direction. We have lined up our US-based manufacturer and have identified readily available materials for manufacture. All we need is successful funding from our Indiegogo campaign to help put this plan into action.  

Additional Updates:  

Patent applied for and granted. Check.  
Trademark and Domain acquired. Check 
Manufacturable prototype. Check 
US Based manufacturer partnership setup and ready to produce. Check 
Product engineering packets sent out to manufacturer. Check. 
Logo and advertising material designed. Check. 
Indiegogo campaign initiated. Check.

Production Timeline: 

- Indiegogo Campaign ends 
- Orders sent to manufacturer
- Materials sourced 
- Production run initiated 
- Production completes in under 30 Days of campaign end date
- Product delivered via 1st class mail

Please help us bring this product to market by backing one of our many rewards. Thanks for all your help and let us know if you have any questions. All perks include FREE SHIPPING Worldwide!

Thanks,

- Bernie & Dirk
story_txt:
(The SeatSnoozer helps keep your head and neck in place when trying to sleep in a seated position. It has a tail that acts as an anchor. You lift your head, you drop the anchor on your back and as you sit back and relax, your own body keeps head and neck in place.)Why did we start this project? We are a father & son team and air travel is a common part of our lives. A lack of quality sleep during our trips was a reoccurring problem. Our goal was to create a product that allowed us to comfortably sleep while sitting on an airplane seat for extended periods of time. Like most travelers, we used U-Shaped neck pillows and were mostly disappointed by their inability to provide adequate head and neck support. Frustration always ensued when they fell short. The need for a solution led to regular in-flight experimentation with multiple neck pillows, polyester airline blankets and every pillow we could get our hands on but nothing worked like we had hoped. We found ourselves sitting at the bar one night swapping travel horror stories. We always enjoyed tackling problems associated with home projects, so this was quite enjoyable and oddly normal for us. We found some commonality among our stories and it always lead back to our inability to sleep while traveling on airplanes. The beers kept flowing and so did our creative juices and by the end of the night we had scribbled drawings down on a coaster and we believed that we had the beginnings of a solution. I guess you could call it a beer-piphany. Over the following weeks, we experimented with duck tape mock ups and fabric scraps. It became a hobby and a great project to casually tackle together. We had fun tinkering and exploring everything from chin supports to literally strapping our heads to the headrest. Every little test served a purpose and some even proved comical. Within time and over 25 prototypes later, a useful and practical solution was born.(Early Sketch)(This was quick sketch for our video. It shows all the components including how the neck pillow attaches.)

(Adjustable neck pillow is adjustable up/down and attaches via velcro. The neck pillow really makes this comfortable. It's like lumbar support for your neck.)
(Hear no evil with extra large ear cutouts to accommodate headphones of all sizes. This feature was a result of user feedback.)

(This shot demonstrates use with large headphones. Headphones not included :)

(Hard to tell with this picture but there's soft fleece material on the inside and an easy to clean material on the outside. We had to have this custom laminated to make it comfortable, durable and breathable.)

(Weighs in at just 3.4 ounces and you can squeeze it into your smallest carry-on. We wanted to make it light and compact and we achieved both.)

(Because a lot of the magic happens behind the back, it's difficult to see how it works in one shot. We used this foam head to demonstrate. Everything sits flat and in the right place when in actual use.)More product pics...
(Clean picture with the neck pillow off and on the side. It velcros to the unit once in use. You only have to set it up once and then it's good to go for all future use.)

(This shows the adjustable velcro head strap. One size fits all. You won't even see it once in use, especially if using headphones.)


(This is a close up of the backpad. This is what holds the SeatSnoozer v2 in place. Your body weight pinches this between your back and the seat. It's super thin, so you wont even feel it and the vents help keep you nice and cool.)






What is the purpose of this product?
The SeatSnoozer prevents head bobbing from taking place, while trying to sleep in a seated position. It also provides adjustable, vertical and lateral head and neck support. This makes the SeatSnoozer ideal for sleeping during prolonged air travel. Throughout the design process, we focused on: minimizing weight (3.4 oz), comfort, keeping it highly packable, functional and ready for use right out of your bag with no inflating or complicated setup. In the end it became different from standard travel pillows, in every way. The SeatSnoozer looks unique and it is! Let’s face it; U-Shaped neck pillows didn’t look too normal when they first hit the market. Simply put, SeatSnoozer addresses the question of how to sleep on planes.
What is it and how does it work?
While it took quite a bit of work to identify proper angles and functionality, the finished product is actually quite simple. 
The benefit is that it keeps your head and neck in place. It has a tail that acts as an anchor. You lift your head, you drop the anchor on your back and as you sit back and relax, your own body keeps head and neck in place.The "anchor" system makes it infinitely adjustable. After you fit it the first time, you can leave it setup for future use.
If that sounds confusing, I recommend watching our video above which demonstrates this more effectively than I explain via text :) 
Making the SeatSnoozer this simple took a lot of work and our design proved patentable. It was a bonding experience that churned out a really useful solution. We were quite proud and happy we created a product that allowed us to comfortably sleep while sitting upright on planes.
So, where are we at?  
As part of the project, we developed over 25 prototypes, applied stringent functionality tests and design variations. We applied experience gathered with our SeatSnoozer V1 product, which was produced as a short run beta product and proof of concept. We attended the Boston Globe Travel show and received a lot of great input. The feedback gathered from frequent travelers helped us to steer our current design and functionality into the right direction. We have lined up our US-based manufacturer and have identified readily available materials for manufacture. All we need is successful funding from our Indiegogo campaign to help put this plan into action.  
Additional Updates:  
Patent applied for and granted. Check.  Trademark and Domain acquired. Check Manufacturable prototype. Check US Based manufacturer partnership setup and ready to produce. Check Product engineering packets sent out to manufacturer. Check. Logo and advertising material designed. Check. Indiegogo campaign initiated. Check.
Production Timeline: 
- Indiegogo Campaign ends - Orders sent to manufacturer- Materials sourced -	Production run initiated - Production completes in under 30 Days of campaign end date- Product delivered via 1st class mail
Please help us bring this product to market by backing one of our many rewards. Thanks for all your help and let us know if you have any questions. All perks include FREE SHIPPING Worldwide!
Thanks,
- Bernie & Dirk

story:
28 Dec'16 Update

Thank you everyone for your support!

Great news: we have completed production and are already shipping our amazing IAMRUNBOX backpacks and garment carriers. Moreover, we have updated our website and now you can buy all our products from there - simply visit https://iamrunbox.com/en and choose whatever best suits you and your active lifestyle!

 

 

IAMRUNBOX Clothing Carrier, Backpacks and Accessories are designed to make your life that little bit easier. Perfect for anyone who wants to incorporate exercise into their busy lifestyle, our innovative bags are designed to keep your work clothes and business attire crease-free as you run or cycle to work, commute to your next business meeting, or take short trip that requires a change of clothes.

Modern, ergonomic, and impeccably styled, IAMRUNBOX Backpacks, Garment Carrier and Shoe Bag allow you to Work Hard, Train Hard, and Stay Smart. 

 

Packing IAMRUNBOX is easy. Simply use the Folding Assistant Card to ensure your clothes arrive crease-free every time. Check out our packing video:

 

The first product to feature in the IAMRUNBOX Collection, this premium quality Garment Carrier is made from the finest materials and designed to keep your clothes crease-free no matter where your day takes you. Minimalistic and modern in design, it is suitable for use with all larger backpacks and briefcases.

Designed for work and play, IAMRUNBOX Backpacks are lightweight, ergonomic, and cleverly designed to keep your clothes wrinkle-free as you travel from A to B. 

Available in two versions, IAMRUNBOX Lite and IAMRUNBOX Pro, this modern backpack was made for run commuting, cycling to work, travelling for business and pleasure, and organizing busy lifestyle. 

Simple, stylish and affordable, it is a great investment for every fitness enthusiast.

What is the difference between the Lite and Pro versions?

Backpack Lite is a basic product version with one compartment for clothes and no external shoe bag attachment string. It is smaller and lighter than the Pro version, but provides adequate space for a single outfit and it is perfect for keeping clothes crease-free.

Backpack Pro is the advanced product version with an extra laptop compartment (suitable for a 13.5" laptop) and an external shoe bag attachment string (IAMRUNBOX Shoe Bag is available to order separately in the Add-ons section). This is a professional bag for active commuters who take their office on the move!

  • Easy folding/packing with folding assistant card and packing video
  • 13.5” laptop compartment (not available at Lite version)
  • Clothes compartment 
  • Perfect for low-riding cycling position, running or cycling to work
  • Reflective strips for increased visibility during the night time 
  • Easy to adjust sternum strap with integrated whistle
  • Soft-padded back panels for comfortable performance
  • Ergonomic straps to reduce up and down movement while running 
  • Smart-load distribution technology 
  • Elastic string to keep straps together when backpack is carried by hand or when attached to a suitcase when travelling 
  • Removable String Attachment System for Shoe Bag, Jacket or Accessories (not available at Lite version)
  • Pocket for Water Bottle / Keys 
  • Large water-resistant waist pockets for a wallet, passport & mobile phone 
  • Made from Weather-Resistant Fabrics 
  • Water-resistant YKK zip 
  • Water-resistant EVA body 
  • Exterior – high quality black Nylon fabric with PU coating
  • Interior – high quality mesh and black velvet fabric 

Minimalistic design and high quality materials make the IAMRUNBOX Shoe Bag a must-have accessory. Use it separately or in combination with the IAMRUNBOX Backpack Pro. 

The perfect solution for storing sweaty workout clothes whilst you’re at work, this light and ventilated Wash Bag will keep your training gear out of sight until you empty it into the washing machine.

When the campaign is over, we’ll contact you for your shipping details and confirm we’ve got your order preference exactly right.  

We would like to take this opportunity to say Thank You for your Support!

We look forward to having you onboard, and cannot thank you enough for helping us take our innovative IAMRUNBOX product range to the next level.

Like, Follow and Share with us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter so that we can grow a global brand together. 

Risks and challenges

Getting products delivered on time is a priority for us. We have years of experience in manufacturing, quality control and logistics, and have successfully produced and delivered similar products in the past.

To ensure everything is watertight, we completed a small trial order with our manufacturing company, where we tested all processes to get ready for mass production.

While we do not see any direct risks, we have prepared for any unforeseen circumstances and have planned contingencies to deal with any potential problems.

Whatever challenges we face, our number one goal is to deliver high quality products on time.

story:
Hi! My name is Renzo. I'm a freelance designer from Argentina, and a mountain enthusiast who dreamt my entire life of working and making a living in the woods. But when we grow, we have to choose one path, and at that time, I chose arts.
In 2013, a serious injury left me out of work but gave me the space to rethink my life. Although art is a huge part of who I am, forestry is my true path. So I took advantage of that crucial moment and I left to follow a big dream – to visit the mountains up in the legendary north; land of bears, wolves and many of Jack London's stories - Canada!
I did not have enough money to fly, but with a resilient and traveling spirit, I hit the road. And after 3 years, 14 countries and endless stories, my thumb, my laptop and I arrived to Yukon, Canada.
Canada was all I had dreamed of and more. There I found the forests and courses with which I could start pursuing my dream of a Forestry career: I am going to attend forestry programs in British Columbia and become proficient in the field. That is why this is not a traveling project. The Visa I applied to has a high price, and I have raised a lot of money myself but need help with the remaining funds.
Thank you for considering your support. Please give me a small chance and keep reading a bit more. It's worth it... believe me!!

 

  • Did you know that Argentina has never been included in a Working Holiday in Canada?!? Yet somehow, the sponsor in charge has recently been given a few spaces annually for Argentinians, without a formal agreement between governments. 

 

  • This project, doesn't finance the travel at all; is purely to fund the remaining part (44%) of the Program, because I'm already spending every penny on many requirements like the Inscription, flight tickets, Visa fees, certificates, translations, medical Insurance for 1 year, etc (Detailed breakdown list of costs further down).

 

  • This is the chance to amend my path by following my heart. One of the courses for which I'm getting scholarships is the "Forestry Field Skills Program (FoFS)" near Fort St. Johns, British Columbia.

 

  • Such training, will be priceless field knowledge to continue with a Forestry degree when I go back to Argentina. Eventually this will lead to a solid background to contribute to the sustainability and conservation of all forests, especially the famous Patagonian.

 

Not everyone feels the need of a drastic change in their lives. You feel fear, but also a fervent desire to succeed, to bet, to risk it all to follow your heart. Because you know what will make you happy. And where there's a will, there's a way. And surely, a lot of people willing to support us through that change...

 

 

On the left, the things that with a lot of effort I've been paying (and will keep on paying)... I'm a determined and creative guy, using every skill in my power in order to keep raising money: from freelance graphic design, children’s book drawings, painting surfboards and murals, selling t-shirts with my artwork, pointillism portraits... 
But I am still pretty far away from gathering all the money I need. That's why I am asking for the help from the community to reach my goal.

 

Your contribution is priceless. And in exchange, I offer you perks with value, with work, to show you my appreciation for your support:

If none of them satisfies you, come to my shop on TeeSpring (or in Facebook) Maybe you find something of your like. I'll keep creating and uploading new ones!

 

If you can't afford a contribution, you can still help by spreading the word! Maybe in your circle of friends and relatives, there's somebody that can contribute!

 

I only have 2 risks... But small and worth taking:

  1. Not reaching my goal: I'd have to find other way to earn the money because what I've paid so far is nonrefundable... But still, with a decent percentage I would be closer to my goal.
     
  2. My Working Visa was approved!!! 
    Rejection on my visa: a very slim chance of  being the outcome. Every country I have visited, I've never exceeded a visa nor had any border rejection; I have all the required documents and proof of payment; I have strong links to my country; and, the company through which I'm applying has zero record of rejection in the past. 
    Still, if it happens it wouldn't be the end. I would honor my perks and I apply again next year after fixing whatever the reason caused the result.

 

 



 

Hola! Mi nombre es Renzo. Soy un diseñador freelance de Argentina, y un entusiasta de la montaña que siempre soñó con trabajar y vivir en el bosque. Pero al crecer debemos elegir un camino, y en aquél entonces, el arte fue el ganador.
En 2013 una seria lesión me dejó sin trabajo pero me dió el espacio para replantearme mi vida: no fue una apuesta fácil pero aunque el arte era parte de mí, en el bosque estaba mi verdadero camino. Así es que aproveche ese momento crucial para despegarme y salir a buscar un gran sueño – el legendario norte; tierra de osos, lobos y muchas historias de Jack London – Canadá!
No disponía los fondos para volar allí, pero con espíritu resiliente y viajero salí a la ruta. Y al cabo de 3 años, 14 países e incontables historias, mi pulgar, mi computadora y yo llegamos a mi soñado lugar: "Yukón".
Canadá fué todo lo que soñé y más; pero también encontré los bosques y los cursos con los que comenzar mi sueño de una carrera forestal: decidí asistir a programas forestales en la Columbia Británica y volverme calificado en el campo. Por ello, éste proyecto no financia un viaje. El costo del programa de trabajo al que apliqué para sostenerme mientras los realizo tiene un alto, y necesito sólo completar los fondos.
Gracias por considerar tu apoyo a mi campaña. Por favor dame una pequeña chance y sigue leyendo un poco. Valdrá la pena… Créeme!

 

  • Sabías que Argentina nunca fue incluída en un Working Holiday en Canada?!? Pero, por alguna razón, el sponsor del programa recientemente comenzó a dar algunos espacios anuales para argentinos, aún sin un acuerdo entre gobiernos. La chance que siempre he esperado!

 

  • El proyecto no financia en absoluto mi viaje, es puramente para costear el saldo restante (44%) del programa, ya que actualmente me encuentro gastando cada centavo en requerimientos como Inscripción, tickets aéreos, Visado de Trabajo, seguro médico anual, etc (Abajo, un listado de los costos).

 

  • Es mi chance de enmendar mi camino siguiendo mi corazón. Uno de los cursos para los que ya estoy consiguiendo becas es el programa "Forestry Field Skills Program (FoFS)" cerca de Fort St. Johns en la Columbia Británica.

  • Éstas capacitaciones, serán un conocimiento de campo invaluable para luego continuar con el diploma Forestal al volver a Argentina: una formación sólida para contribuir a la sustentabilidad y conservación de todos los bosques, especialmente de los famosos patagónicos.

No todos sienten la necesidad de un cambio trascendental en su vida. Se siente miedo, desazón y soledad; pero también un ferviente deseo de triunfar, de apostar, de arriesgarlo todo para seguir nuestro corazón. Porque él sabe adónde es feliz.
Cuando hay un deseo, hay una manera. Y seguramente, mucha gente dispuesta a acompañarnos durante ese cambio….

 

A izquierda, todo lo que con mucho esfuerzo estoy y seguiré pagando... Soy un tipo decidido y creativo, y estoy usando todas mis habilidades artísticas para recaudar fondos: desde diseño freelance, ilustraciones para libros infantiles, cuadros en madera, pintando murales y tablas de surf, vendiendo playeras con mi arte, retratos con puntillismo...
Pero aún así, me encuentro lejos de juntar todos los fondos. Por eso pido la ayuda de la comunidad para llegar a mi meta.

 

Tu contribución es invaluable. Y a cambio, te ofrezco recompensas con valor, con trabajo, que sientas mi aprecio por acompañarme en éste camino. Por espacio, no me permiten listarlas arriba en inglés y español. Asíque tan sólo escoge, y encuéntralas por su precio.

Si ninguna te satisface, pásate por mi tienda en TeeSpring! Quizás algo de allí te agrade. Seguiré subiendo más artículos con el correr de los días...

 

Si no puedes apoyar mi proyecto, puedes ayudarme compartiéndolo! En tu círculo de amigos o familiares quizás haya alguien que sí pueda contribuir!

 

Sólo hay 2 riesgos, son pequeños y valen la pena:

  1. No alcanzar mi meta: Deberé encontrar otra manera de juntar el dinero, ya que lo que he pagué hasta ahora no es reembolsable. Pero aún juntando un buen porcentaje, ya estaría cerca de mi objetivo.
  2. Mi Visa fue aprobada!!!
    Rechazo del visado    : la chance es muy pequeña. En cada país visitado, nunca he excedido mi visa ni fui rechazado; tengo todos los documentos y pruebas de pago solicitadas; tengo fuertes lazos con mi país; y la compañía a con la cual aplico tiene cero rechazos en todo su historial.
    Aún si sucediera, no sería el fin. Honraría mis recompensas y aplicaría nuevamente el año entrante luego de reparadas las causas que llevaran a tal resultado.

Por favor dame una pequeña chance y sigue leyendo un poco. Valdrá la pena… Créeme!
 

Sabías que Argentina nunca fue incluída en un Working Holiday en Canada?!? Pero, por alguna razón, el sponsor del programa recientemente comenzó a dar algunos espacios anuales para argentinos, aún sin un acuerdo entre gobiernos. La chance que siempre he esperado!
 

El proyecto no financia en absoluto mi viaje, es puramente para costear el saldo restante (44%) del programa, ya que actualmente me encuentro gastando cada centavo en requerimientos como Inscripción, tickets aéreos, Visado de Trabajo, seguro médico anual, etc (Abajo, un listado de los costos).

 
Es mi chance de enmendar mi camino siguiendo mi corazón. Uno de los cursos para los que ya estoy consiguiendo becas es el programa "Forestry Field Skills Program (FoFS)" cerca de Fort St. Johns en la Columbia Británica.

Éstas capacitaciones, serán un conocimiento de campo invaluable para luego continuar con el diploma Forestal al volver a Argentina: una formación sólida para contribuir a la sustentabilidad y conservación de todos los bosques, especialmente de los famosos patagónicos.
No todos sienten la necesidad de un cambio trascendental en su vida. Se siente miedo, desazón y soledad; pero también un ferviente deseo de triunfar, de apostar, de arriesgarlo todo para seguir nuestro corazón. Porque él sabe adónde es feliz.Cuando hay un deseo, hay una manera. Y seguramente, mucha gente dispuesta a acompañarnos durante ese cambio…. 


A izquierda, todo lo que con mucho esfuerzo estoy y seguiré pagando... Soy un tipo decidido y creativo, y estoy usando todas mis habilidades artísticas para recaudar fondos: desde diseño freelance, ilustraciones para libros infantiles, cuadros en madera, pintando murales y tablas de surf, vendiendo playeras con mi arte, retratos con puntillismo...Pero aún así, me encuentro lejos de juntar todos los fondos. Por eso pido la ayuda de la comunidad para llegar a mi meta.
 


Tu contribución es invaluable. Y a cambio, te ofrezco recompensas con valor, con trabajo, que sientas mi aprecio por acompañarme en éste camino. Por espacio, no me permiten listarlas arriba en inglés y español. Asíque tan sólo escoge, y encuéntralas por su precio.

Si ninguna te satisface, pásate por mi tienda en TeeSpring! Quizás algo de allí te agrade. Seguiré subiendo más artículos con el correr de los días...

 

Si no puedes apoyar mi proyecto, puedes ayudarme compartiéndolo! En tu círculo de amigos o familiares quizás haya alguien que sí pueda contribuir!
 

Sólo hay 2 riesgos, son pequeños y valen la pena:


No alcanzar mi meta: Deberé encontrar otra manera de juntar el dinero, ya que lo que he pagué hasta ahora no es reembolsable. Pero aún juntando un buen porcentaje, ya estaría cerca de mi objetivo.

Mi Visa fue aprobada!!!Rechazo del visado: la chance es muy pequeña. En cada país visitado, nunca he excedido mi visa ni fui rechazado; tengo todos los documentos y pruebas de pago solicitadas; tengo fuertes lazos con mi país; y la compañía a con la cual aplico tiene cero rechazos en todo su historial.Aún si sucediera, no sería el fin. Honraría mis recompensas y aplicaría nuevamente el año entrante luego de reparadas las causas que llevaran a tal resultado.

story:
The Campaign
 
Venezuela has always been an ultimate playing country. The sport has interested thousand of young and old players of both genders, and most of them have dove head first into the game. Our heart is all about ultimate. Throughout our history, Venezuelan teams have not failed to deliver. Venezuelan teams have reached finals at the Panamerican Ultimate Championships two times in a row. The under23 squad has also made a great role at Worlds U23 in Canada, after struggling to come up with the necessary requirements to obtain visas and money exchanged. They had to struggle with all the politics, and all the economic obstacles, and then went on to beat Japan in pool play. I think that says a lot about the quality of players we have.
 
Last few years were enveloped with failure. The sociopolitical crisis in our country have made it almost impossible for athletes of second hand sports to travel and compete at the highest level. A lot of attempts were made to reach world championships, and they all met the same fate, they all had to drop out of the competition.
 
This time a team of players have been put together with players already living abroad, and some players that will still make the trip from our homeland. All of these players, although living abroad, still need a bit of support to make the trips, specially the ones still living in South America. This time we could really use your help and support to meet the goal of 15 venezuelan players standing on a beautiful french beach and raising a hand to call for a pull and start the first game of the squad in years.
 
All these players want is to play their hearts out and share Venezuelan ultimate culture with the rest of the world. We promise to bring the drums and congas, and give you a bit of Caribbean rhythm that our country is famous for.
 
The Team
 
Vannesa Tejero, who has 15 years of competitive ultimate under her belt. She recently plays in Rotterdam, where she can be seen throwing full field hucks. She also was one of the main female handlers on the venezuelan team that competed in Hawaii 2002.
 
Jose Cruces was a big part of the venezuelan squad that played in Italy 2011. Since then, he states that ultimate has changed his life and plays ultimate regularly in Germany. He is a fast and dangerous cutter who loves to streak deep and leave defenders looking at his number while the desperately try to catch up.
 
Orianna Abreu, she has ran for plastic for 10 years now. After moving to Colombia, she started playing with Revolution, one of the best colombian women squads. She recently won Nationals with the team, and took down the MVP award while doing it.
 
Gus Estrano, one of the seasoned veterans that make up the core of the squad. A real team player, who is always looking for the easy options to float the disc into the endzone. Gus has been playing in the United States for the last years. He has played Nationals there 3 times in a row, and also participated in two world championships wearing the Venezuelan colors.
 
Fred Burke started playing 12 years ago. Since then, he has been all over the world playing Ultimate. Recently, he has lived in India, where his lefty handler skills grabbed the attention of the selection committee of the  Open Master Squad for The World Championships of Ultimate and Guts in London.
 
Aulio Vasquez has been playing in Chile for three years. Since then he has helped his team to two national championships. He has also won the DV2600 colombian tournament, a very known competitive tournament in Bogota, with the Wisconsin Arepas.
 
Moises Diaz is an ultimate encyclopedia. He loves to learn the strategic side of ultimate, and has helped spread this knowledge in Chile for the last years. He is known for being one the pioneers of Ultimate in Chile and has founded several teams in both his home country and his new one. 
 
Darly Kittle has been playing in the United States since 2009. She started playing Mixed with K.O.D. and Glazed. She is a force to reckon with while she has the disc and prides herself in being a defensive handler. 16 years in the game give her the experience necessary to face any competition.
 
David Picon has been playing mixed spanish ultimate for the last five years. During that time he has won Mixed Nationals with Bravas in 2015, and then taken uncountable 2nd places with the Open Squad. He has also been regularly involved in video coverage for the sport with Skyd Magazine and Get Horizontal.
 
Marcos Batista has been playing in Argentina for the last years. Where his team has been unbeatable on any surface or condition. Marcos has grasped the Defensive MVP award several years in a row at the highest level of competition in Argentinian ultimate.
 
Mariana Otero is the soul of any team. She has played the most international major events in the history of any venezuelan. She has played all WCBU events since Portugal 2004 and is ready to add one more to her belt. Living in France, she has also helped YAKA to take down 7 championships titles during her career with the team.
 
Jose Caceres has been playing and developing ultimate in Greece for the last years. He is an avid rules scholar, and will be the backbone of the team in the spirit department. He is now playing with UCFA and has won several spirit of the game awards throughout his career.
 
 
 
The Funding
 
We need around ten thousand euros to help pay for the fees and flights of our less fortunate team members.
 

A world championship can be a very expensive event, and a country that is struggling with economics like Venezuela won´t spend a cent in helping a national team reach these goals. That is why we seek help from the outside community.

Any and all funds made during the campaign will only be directed to help the players that cannot make the journey without assistance. If by any chance, these players were to drop out, then the funds will be redirected into helping promote south american ultimate youth.

If you cannot help us with some gold bricks, then perhaps you can throw some shares our way! Help the world know that Venezuela is seeking help to play competitive ultimate! We will thank you until the end of time!

story:
E-CASE is the only smart check-in bag with real GPS and a no lift built-in scale. With airlines now charging for carry-on, check your bag and rest easy with E-CASE!

 

 

Featured on:

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

Never worry about overweight baggage fees again. E-CASE includes an innovative scale built into the wheels. No need to lift the bag. Just open the app, check your bag's weight in pounds or kilograms, and go!

 

Did someone mistake your luggage for theirs? Or perhaps a thief ran off with it. Not to worry! E-CASE will send you an alert when it has strayed outside the range of your Bluetooth signal. Then use the real-time GPS signal to track down.

E-CASE also has an automatic re-lock feature that can be used for security checkpoints. Leave your E-CASE temporarily unlocked. When the latches are opened and re-inserted, your E-CASE will automatically re-lock. You can also set it to auto-lock after a certain amount of time.

 

SMART LUGGAGE JUST GOT SMARTER

Tough, durable, and surprisingly lightweight, E-CASE is the ONLY check-in bag with real-time GPS tracking and a built-in scale.

E-CASE was globally patented in 2012 for its innovation in GPS and digital scale technology (Patent #US2015/0160069A1). It's taken many years to finalize product development and manufacturing. But now it's ready!

Almost all other smart luggage on the market is carry-on, but lets get real. If you stow your bag in the overhead bin, chances are you probably won’t lose it. E-CASE takes smart luggage from a novelty to a necessity by offering two larger check-in sizes, as well as a carry-on case.

All E-CASE's feature the same high-quality GPS, scale, and locking technology.

 

BUILT BY A WORLD-CLASS TEAM

E-CASE is a USA company with a global team from Japan, Australia and Hong Kong. Lawrence, the CEO and co-founder, has over 20 years experience manufacturing and shipping luggage for these top brands and many more:

The electronic engineering team joined E-CASE from three of the world's leading mobile technology companies:

 E-CASE was designed in Japan by the talented industrial designer, Sonoda Hiroshi.

 

Most of the smart luggage on the market today use a separate tracking device – a cell tower based positioning method. This means positioning occurs once, when the luggage arrives at the airport. You can tell your bag has landed at a specific airport, but if it gets sent to the wrong carousel, you’re out of luck.

 

HAVE YOU EVER WONDERED...

What would it feel like to know exactly where your luggage is BEFORE you even get off the plane? 

E-CASE is the only smart luggage that uses a unique combination of real GPS, GSM, WiFi, and Bluetooth signals, allowing you to...

 

WHY REAL GPS MATTERS

With the exception of Bluesmart (which only offers a carry-on) all other smart luggage uses GSM-GPRS. In order to comply with airline regulations, the GSM signal is disabled before takeoff and resumed after landing to get a one-time location update.

But, what happens WITHOUT real GPS...

  • If the baggage did not get onto a plane? The "resume on landing" feature does not trigger and the baggage disappears forever with the tracker.
  • If the bag is lost at the destination airport? The one-time positioning update only tells the user that the baggage arrived at the airport, but no further information is available as to the exact location.

That means if you cannot find your baggage on the carousel where it should be, then it disappears again and you're helpless even though you know the baggage arrived at the airport... somewhere.

 

E-CASE USES REAL GPS

E-CASE is the only smart check-in luggage that offers real-time mapping with pinpoint accuracy both indoors and outside.

 

Follow the movement of your luggage similar to following a breadcrumb trail. Whether on the road or in the air, you’ll be able to track the movements of your E-CASE in real time.

 

The location is constantly monitored via the GPS module. The tracking data is sent to the E-CASE app via global GSM signal when not in flight, making it fully compliant with airline regulations.

With E-CASE, you know exactly where your luggage is within the airport or anywhere on the planet. Just tell airline staff where to find it.... like a boss!

We've got you covered. E-CASE is TSA compliant and compatible with airline regulations around the world.

But you don't need to take our word for it...

If airport security or the airlines confiscate or disable your E-CASE, we'll repair or replace your bag at no charge.

 

E-CASE uses cutting edge algorithms to make your user experience as effortless as possible. It will automatically adjust positioning frequency to conserve battery. 

A light and vibration sensor lets the bag know when it is in the air, suspending the GSM signal automatically to comply with airline rules. This means that your E-CASE switches to sleep mode while in-flight to conserve power and awakens automatically when you need it.

 

 

Every element of E-CASE has been designed to be fully compliant with the TSA and regulatory organizations worldwide. Whether you’re checking in your E-CASE or taking it through security, you won’t have any problems. We have tested E-CASE at check in and security on both local and international flights.

 

TSA standard locks have a major security issue, as anyone can download plans for a 3D printed master key from the internet. The E-CASE lock is the most secure on the market, and can be opened in three ways; via the mobile app, with your fingerprint, or from anywhere in the world via SMS. It will alert you if anyone attempts to tamper with it.

 

The E-CASE carry-on model has the largest (12,000mAh) power-bank of any smart luggage on the market.

 

Brilliantly designed to be removable, eliminating possible issues with airline restrictions and offering the added convenience of charging your devices in your seat while your bag is in the overhead bin.

Keep your devices charged and ready to go.

 

 

 

 

 

WARRANTY

E-CASE is premium luggage made with durable components and materials.

The team behind E-CASE has over 20 years experience manufacturing luggage for top brands like Samsonite. E-CASE is built to last.

We provide a five (5) year warranty for the E-CASE suitcase, and one (1) year warranty for the E-CASE electronic modules. Simply send your E-CASE or just the defective part back to us and we will provide a free replacement. Components are designed to be easily replaced by you or a local repair shop if you do not want to send the whole bag back to us.

 

WHY E-CASE?

Frequent flyers face frequent hassles, many of them luggage related:

  • Excess baggage fees cost travelers billions of dollars each year
  • 24 million pieces of luggage are lost or mishandled annually

Here at E-CASE, most of us have personally experienced these problems. We have channeled our frustration and inconvenience into action, creating the best smart bag on the planet.

Team experience:

  • 20+ years manufacturing luggage for Samsonite, Titan, Delsey, Swiss Gear, etc.
  • Engineering for Motorola, Qualcomm and Huawei
  • Designing, manufacturing, and shipping product worldwide
E-CASE is manufactured in a factory that Lawrence, CEO and E-CASE co-founder, has owned and operated for over a decade.
 
We have all personally experienced the nightmares of bad travel experiences, lost luggage, overage fees, etc. Now we're on a mission to restore some of the fun back into travel... one smart bag at a time.
 

Our goal for E-CASE was to build the best smart luggage on the planet. We wanted our smart cases to be easy to use, affordable, and impossible to lose. We have been working on E-CASE since 2012. Now, with your help, E-CASE is finally ready for manufacturing.

[Not pictured] Sonoda, the designer, and our engineering team: Mathew, Eric, and Alan.

 

 

                     

Is E-CASE patented?

Yes, the luggage weighing and tracking system was patented early in 2012 in the US, Europe, and Australia. The publication number in the US is US2015/0160069A1.

 

 

I’m traveling overseas with E-CASE, is there anything special I need to do to it?

No, E-CASE includes a global GSM SIM card that features automatic roaming and auto-connect to any local network provider when it is traveling overseas.

 

 

I’m traveling a road trip with E-CASE, not an air travel, can I track it?

Yes, unlike many other smart luggage that can only tell the bag location as a name of the airport, E-CASE has real GPS that can pinpoint your bag anywhere on a map.

 

 

Does E-CASE use rechargeable batteries?

There is a battery level indicator visible on your E-CASE mobile app. It is recommended that the batteries should be fully recharged before you start the trip.

 

 

Does E-CASE comply with TSA, FAA, UN and IATA requirements?

Yes, all sizes of E-CASE luggage are designed fully compliant with Transportation Security Administration (TSA), Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), United Nations (UN), and International Air Transportation Association (IATA) guidelines. 

Power Bank: Only the E-CASE Carry-on comes with a power bank which both its design and size comply with IATA’s Regulations and it is removable.

Built-in-case Battery: E-CASE adopts a built-in-case lithium polymer battery with well protected against short circuits that is compliant with UN 3481, Packing Instruction 966 and 967.

Electronic Module: We use algorithms to suspend GSM signal during the flight by analyzing vibration and light intensity in order to comply with certain safety requirements. Therefore E-CASE knows itself is checked in and going to fly, it suspends the telecom signal automatically and turns back on while it realizes itself landed.

 

 

Can E-CASE go through the security check at the airport?

Yes, no matter you are checking in your E-CASE to the airline or going through the security check with E-CASE at the airport, you should not have any problem with security issue relative to E-CASE. Because we optimized the electronic module and the built-in battery with well protected against short circuits, they are absolutely compliant with IATA’s UN 3481, Packing Instruction 966 and 967.

We have tested E-CASE by checking in on airlines and carrying through the security check during trips with local and international flights to destinations include San Francisco, Los Angeles, Sweden, Hong Kong, Taiwan and Shanghai. We did not get rejected and even a single question asked by any airline and Customs officers. But we did get pinpoint and footprint accuracy in every destination to complete the round-world test for E-CASE.

 

 

Does E-CASE come with a built-in TSA accepted lock?

Yes, it does.

 

 

Is there any activation or annual service fee?

E-CASE includes two (2) years FREE annual service fee comes with every E-CASE purchased on IndieGoGo.

After two years, the annual service fee is only $9.99 USD for IndieGoGo backers.

 

 

What is the Warranty?

E-CASE is made with durable technologies and durable materials. We provide a five (5) year warranty for the E-CASE suitcase, and one (1) year warranty for the E-CASE electronic modules. Simply send your E-CASE or just the defective part back to us and we will provide a free replacement.
