story:
Alternative Spring Break 2014

My name is Ashley and I'm a senior at the University of Oregon studying Cultural Anthropology and Philosophy. On campus I'm involved with a few organizations one of them being the Alternative Break Program through the Holden Center. Last year I went on a trip to San Diego, California where we worked with local organizations on issues involving immigration in an effort to make immigration safer and our communities stronger. We worked with groups like Water Stations, Border Angels, that seek to help migrants survive crossing the borderlands into a potentially deathly situation. 

This year I am one of three leaders taking a group of 16 students to Los Angeles, California where we will work on issues surrounding urban poverty from a food justice standpoint. I got inspired to create this trip through the Ted Talk Ron Finley gave last year on his organization LA Green Grounds and the concept of guerrilla gardening. We will be working with local organizations to examine the issue of how food can affect urban poverty and how lack of access to healthy foods crosses racial, ethnic, and socioeconomic boundaries. The goal of this trip is to deepen our understanding of how lack of access to healthy foods impacts entire communities and has an effect on crime rates, economic status, and obesity rates. We will be working in LA for three days with Los Angeles Green Grounds and Homeboy Industries. Then we will travel up to Oakland and spend the last two days working with People's Grocery and Jessica Wilson's My Kitchen Dietician. We will get to experience food justice from several different standpoints in several different communities and through this build a comprehensive view of what communities our institutions in the United States have effected. 

Alternative Breaks is an organization that gives students the opportunity to complete real, hands on service that effects marginalized communities as an alternative to spending their break elsewhere. It is essentially student run with help from our Alternative Break director and our Educational Partner. 

What We Need 

The cost for one student to participate in the program is $500. I have enough money to make the trip on my own but many of my participants are worried about finances. I want to be able to give a scholarship to the student in most need. The biggest barrier to these trips is the cost. We have the students that want to go but we don't necessarily have the money. 100% of the money would go directly to the students who are in the most financial hardship with the trip. None of the money will go to my expenses on the trip because I am fortunate enough not to need the money.

The Impact

As will all service work the impact is like the butterfly effect, one small initial difference can make a huge effect. While we will only be spending one week on this service trip, the self knowledge and personal growth we will have will be, for lack of a better term, life-changing. Service-learning work in this way is about building bridges between communities, gaining real experience and knowledge on a social issue that is effecting the daily lives of our citizens, and learning about our own power and privilege, or lack thereof, in our own lives. The work we will be doing in California will be transplanted back into our own communities as we start to see a paradigm shift in the equability of access to nutritional foods in lower income and marginalized communities. By donating, you will be directly helping both the lives of community members living in LA and Oakland who have been effected by food deserts, as well as, helping a college student get to participate in this experience.  

Ways You Can Help

Please donate!! If you can't afford a lot, a few dollars will help. I promise. If not, share this with your friends, families, and colleagues! 

Thank you so much for reading my page and for giving me the opportunity to help my participants afford the cost of the trip. It is much appreciated.

story:
My name is Bruce Lindstrom and after 14 years of dedicated work I have recently restored the Plymouth Factory Sponsored Drag Team the Golden Commandos 1965 Barracuda the "GOLDFISH" to it's original condition. I made an appearance at the ECDT hall of fame reunion and car show (SEE VIDEO) the segment begins at 6:40. I won Best in Show out of over 1,250 cars. I have also been inducted into the MOPAR Hall of Fame for my efforts with this car. This car won the 1965 U.S. Nat.'s F/S class at Indy and set an F/S E.T. record. The "GOLDFISH" was also featured in several car mags. including the cover of HOTROD mag. in Feb. '66. My dream is return this one of a kind car to the drag strip where it has not been seen for over 45 yrs. I am disabled and live on fixed income (which is why it took me 14 yrs.to restore) and am unable to afford the trip to Mopars at the Strip,which is a nostalgic drag race and car show from April 12-14,2014 that would be great national exposure for my car. I would use donations to fund my travel expenses including renting a truck and trailer to haul my car and to from MATS. They will pay for my entry fees and all costs assoc. with the car show and race. After dedicating 14 yrs. of my life to this project I believe this car deserves to shown and raced again on a national level so people can see and relive what a great contribution the Golden Commandos made to the drag racing world back in the day, Thank you for your time,

Bruce Lindstrom

story:
The Vbag 5-in-1 Convertible Backpack System is the Ultimate Do All, Hold All Bag. 

V is for Versatile and also 5 bags that it replaces.  Choose from Blue or Black.

 

 

Vbag is designed in New York, but it works for people anywhere on Earth.  It can keep up with busy lifestyles and actually saves you space, money, and time.  One Vbag can replace all the bags in your closet for: Work, play, travel, photography, cycling, school, sports, and Parenting. 

 

Available in Blue or Black - Just leave a comment with your Choice.

Vbag compartments open all the way for fast packing and retrieval to save you time.

 

It expands from Flat 1.8 inches to Fat 8.0 inches to hold everything you need and use every day.

 

 

We all love privacy so the Vbag has 7 pockets inside for important stuff.   The smooth front panel also has 2 INDIVIDUAL pockets with hidden zippers, and 1 large zippered pocket for fast access. 

Vbag is strong: most bags use 600D nylon, but we use 840D with waterproof linings in the compartments. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

BACKPACK

"Vbag is BIG and yet not like strapping a big sack on my back" - Bobby

 

Flat profile Briefcase  - more professional than a backpack for work

"My gym stuff fit into the big compartment and it still stayed flat!" - Mali

 

Detachable padded long strap for Messenger bag stows away

"Vbag in blue is so different than the usual black blandness" - Walter

 

Sling bag can be configured with one of the stow away shoulder straps or detachable long strap for fast access

"The short or long straps let me pull out my camera whenever I need" - Laurel

 

Carry on with expansion zipper opens for extra 2 inches of space

"The extra 2 inches allowed me to replace my luggage for plane rides" - KK

 

 

 

  • 19 inches x 13 inches, 1 pound 12 ounces
  • Flat - 1.8 inches or less (measured on sides) 
  • Fat - 8.0 inches (6 inches + 2 inches unzipped expansion) 
  • Cool mesh covered cushions for back support 

Top flat handle / clips secure to luggage or stroller

Perks Ship 11/2016 

Vbag ($118 Retail) available in:

  • Single Bag

 

 

Corporate or Private Label Vbags Available

You can get 250 Vbags with your logo, in blue or black @ $40 each. Also available in any standard color + $2 each.  Deposit $4,800 required.

For more details, please email sales@wallgers.com.

International Shipping Fees

Most other campaigns add it onto the Reward pledge and say it's Free Shipping but we chose to be transparent about it.

Vbag Design

 

Living in any city, we are always short on space and time.  And like you, we had a bunch of different bags that are collecting dust in the closet for months until needed. 

So we decided to design one bag that could:

  • have a flat profile
  • have hidden pockets on the front
  • open on 3 sides like luggage
  • expand to hold as much as we need
  • be tough and light
  • easily convert into different styles to go from work to play...

and not look like every other drooping bland black sack.

The Vbag is the first bag design to be offered under the Wallgers brand.  Instead of leather, it will be made with 840D nylon - a much denser material than the usual 600D nylon.  It was actually first conceived in 2013 but went through several design changes, and we also waited to secure the right factory, and for material costs to lower before we can complete the production plans.

We changed the top handle and took out the 2 front pockets for a sleek look.

Fat - 8.0 inches (6 inches + 2 inches unzipped expansion) 
Cool mesh covered cushions for back support 
Top flat handle / clips secure to luggage or strollerPerks Ship 11/2016 Vbag ($118 Retail) available in:Single Bag  Corporate or Private Label Vbags AvailableYou can get 250 Vbags with your logo, in blue or black @ $40 each. Also available in any standard color + $2 each.  Deposit $4,800 required.For more details, please email sales@wallgers.com.International Shipping FeesMost other campaigns add it onto the Reward pledge and say it's Free Shipping but we chose to be transparent about it.Vbag Design Living in any city, we are always short on space and time.  And like you, we had a bunch of different bags that are collecting dust in the closet for months until needed. So we decided to design one bag that could:
have a flat profile
have hidden pockets on the front
open on 3 sides like luggage
expand to hold as much as we need
be tough and light
easily convert into different styles to go from work to play...
and not look like every other drooping bland black sack.The Vbag is the first bag design to be offered under the Wallgers brand.  Instead of leather, it will be made with 840D nylon - a much denser material than the usual 600D nylon.  It was actually first conceived in 2013 but went through several design changes, and we also waited to secure the right factory, and for material costs to lower before we can complete the production plans.We changed the top handle and took out the 2 front pockets for a sleek look. The factory that we will be working with is one of the biggest subcontractors for several top American designers.  They allowed us to take a photo of this corner because the other production lines are already assigned to private labels.

story:
We are a Mother & Daughter team who invented an easy-to-use twist off bottle opener and are here for ONE reason. We need your help! Your support will allow us to move from the temporary mold to the final mold, and pursue retail partnerships. 
 
We ask you to share our campaign with your friends and family, share it and like us on facebook.com/CapTwist and join the CapTwist cause. You can also share it by using the Indiegogo share tool. Lastly, indiegogo will help us gauge how popular our product can be on a large scale. 

Here are some key benefits and market knowledge of CapTwist:

• CapTwist can be used by adults on the go, kids, anyone with sensitive hands, people with arthritis and the elderly.
 
• CapTwist opens bottles so easy, no need to ask for help. 
 
• Opens water bottles, soda bottles, 2 liters, 1 liters, twist-off beer bottles and all bottles with a standard size bottle cap. Our patent pending larger size will launch soon.
 
• Accessories like key chains can be added to CapTwist.
 
• CapTwist can be made in different colors. 
 
• Company logos will soon be available on CapTwist product - THINK BIG! 
 
• 50 Billion water bottles are sold each year - HUGE MARKET POTENTIAL

CapTwist opens water, soda & twist off beer bottle caps. We created CapTwist out of pure necessity. With the water bottle industries release of their environmentally friendly water bottle designs, it was putting a strain on our fingers. While we are all pro the environment, we needed to come up with a solution for opening these new bottles. We both had trouble with opening water bottles and figured if we were having trouble then so were other people. After numerous design ideas, we have been able to turn what was a simple idea into the final CapTwist design which is a fun, safe, handy device that helps in the opening of water bottles. During testing we also found out that it not only opened water bottles, it also opened:

  • Soda bottles
  • Twist-off beer bottles
  • Sauce bottles
  • Nail polish bottles
  • Plus many other types of bottles

  

There are two sides to the CapTwist depending on the circumference of the item you are opening. CapTwist also has a small hole that aids in the attaching to a key chain. It is small enough to keep in your:

  • Purse
  • Backpack
  • Kitchen drawer
  • Or attached to your cooler

We have CapTwists ready to go in two colors Blue and Pink in two different shapes our oval and water drop. We are thankful to be able to share CapTwist with you and hope you see the benefits to this simple, yet very helpful product. If you have any questions, feel free to email the founders directly at:

linda@captwist.com

emma@captwist.com

CapTwist was invented by a mother/daughter team and is manufactured in the United States. Linda Appleby is a Florida resident and the mother of four. Along with her daughter, Emma Faasse, mother and Code Consultant in NYC they created CapTwist, a helpful invention that makes opening the toughest bottle caps a breeze. CapTwist was invented out of necessity after both Linda and Emma were having difficulties opening water bottles at a family gathering. After many trials, CapTwist was born and has been helping people open bottle caps ever since. 

"I was over the moon when we got our first batch of CapTwist to test. It was finally a real product not just a drawing. I love the colors and can't wait to expand into the other color pallets. Now every time I use my CapTwist I fall in love with it all over again. I am always finding new things to open that it was not intended for. It is a great feeling to know that you are helping people who struggle with opening bottles. It is something that most of us take for granted." - CapTwist Co-Founder Emma Faasse

story:
Meet STAKI

STAKI Controls are a new generation of compact-size skis providing performance enhancement and safety. The special stabilising tail with metal edges ensure that the skis will not slip, unlike with standard skis. It slows down and returns the skier back to a stable position. The skis’ geometric structure combined with a patented innovative tail gives you the ability to maintain a balanced position and prevents you from flinging back while skiing on an uneven surface. With this feature, the skis are suitable for both beginners and experienced skiers who enjoy leaving the groomed slopes behind in favour of off-piste, backcountry skiing. STAKIs come with adjustable binding, which is incredibly comfortable compared to common binding used on any other type of skis, including snowblades.

Match your design:

 

Reliable in snow, whatever its condition  

Skis, along with terrain characteristics, are very important factors to pay attention to when choosing the right equipment for your activities. With STAKI Controls, you don´t have to always look for the optimal surface to ski on anymore. You’ll always be ready to hit the snow, no matter the condition.

Take it where you need it

With every inch of them utilitized, STAKI skis are very easy to carry and fit almost anywhere. You can even store them into a mini car trunk. That´s right: great things come in small packages.

No specials skills required

With every inch of them utilitized, STAKI skis are very easy to carry and fit almost anywhere. You can even store them into a mini car trunk. That's right: great things come in small packages.

From passion to a product

The spiritual father of STAKI skis is the athlete and P.E. teacher Dušan Peterka. Thanks to his inventiveness and perseverance, he managed to develop his original idea for more stable skis with a special heel and subsequently build the first prototype. Dušan’s efforts caught the attention of the ski producer Sporten, and the supplier of safety bindings Tyrolia – and they sure were excited about what they saw! In cooperation with them, he further improved the shape and design of the skis. Unfortunately, Dušan Petrka died in a tragic car accident in 2014. His ideas, however, live on as an endless source of inspiration for all members of the Staki team. Working with Dušan’s wife Eva, we developed a new and improved model of these safe and stable skis – Staki Controls.

Risks & Challenges

We have been testing STAKI Controls nonstop. We’ve come a long way in that time, pushing ahead our craftsmanship, performance improvement and design expansion, and most importantly, implementing a quality control upgrade. Each ski is fully inspected before and after testing and this method will also be applied to the final products. All manufacturing of Staki Controls will be completed here at our facility in the Czech Republic and we will not be outsourcing production labour to another location. This way, we can assure 100% supervision throughout the entire process so that we will be able to deliver the high quality that we have promised.

story:
The Toughest Race on Earth - The Story is an exciting project for the fans and followers of this race world wide.


We are raising funds for the coverage of this race and acquiring footage and photographs for a full documentary film and coffee table art book, which will be funded separately.


We will bring more immediacy and high quality video features, interviews and daily uploads of images to the  social media sites of the organization.


Our images and media show the race in all its glory, the beautiful relationship between man and dog, the sheer toughness of this unforgiving climate, the emotions felt by mushers, handlers, followers and the dogs too...


Most importantly, we tell the stories from along the trail, not just take pictures...We will bring the stories in the race to life.


The best of the images will be selected and published in the 100 + page coffee table souvenir book.


The funds we raise will cover the expedition expenses and the team's ability to travel the trail, upload and produce for you.


This project has no financial affiliation with the Yukon Quest, and no money raised here will go to the organization.

Below are some of our images from 2012.



The biggest challenge will be selecting the images that will make up the book - in 2012, the team shot more than 10,000 still images, and countless hours of video. People all have different tastes and preferences, but throughout the process of covering an event, we strive to tell a consistent, coherent story.
story_txt:
The Toughest Race on Earth - The Story is an exciting project for the fans and followers of this race world wide.
We are raising funds for the coverage of this race and acquiring footage and photographs for a full documentary film and coffee table art book, which will be funded separately.
We will bring more immediacy and high quality video features, interviews and daily uploads of images to the  social media sites of the organization.
Our images and media show the race in all its glory, the beautiful relationship between man and dog, the sheer toughness of this unforgiving climate, the emotions felt by mushers, handlers, followers and the dogs too...
Most importantly, we tell the stories from along the trail, not just take pictures...We will bring the stories in the race to life.
The best of the images will be selected and published in the 100 + page coffee table souvenir book.
The funds we raise will cover the expedition expenses and the team's ability to travel the trail, upload and produce for you.
This project has no financial affiliation with the Yukon Quest, and no money raised here will go to the organization.
Below are some of our images from 2012.







The biggest challenge will be selecting the images that will make up the book - in 2012, the team shot more than 10,000 still images, and countless hours of video. People all have different tastes and preferences, but throughout the process of covering an event, we strive to tell a consistent, coherent story.

story:
WAYB is a new company founded by the makers of the world’s best outdoor gear and the former CEO of Patagonia. Our team is full of parents who loved to travel before we had kids, but now that we have wee ones… we still love to travel! Travel is just part of who we are and we aren’t going to park it at home just because we have junior humans.

What we don’t love is schlepping bulky, heavy gear. And we really hate having to choose between lugging a giant car seat or skipping it. That’s why we made Pico™ (patent pending) , a travel car seat that’s light and compact.

 

 

 

Cleared for takeoff! Meet Pico, the travel car seat for family adventures

The WAYB Pico is a breeze to carry and use. It installs with an airplane belt, car seat belt, or Lower Anchors and Tether (LATCH) system. See our FAQ for more details, or email help@wayb.com.

Our final product and materials may vary slightly from the prototypes pictured in these photos and videos.

 

What makes Pico way better

You know what airplanes and space shuttles are made of? Aluminum! Aluminum is ultralight while still being incredibly strong. And it’s the secret to Pico. Instead of a bulky, plastic shell, our Pico travel car seat has an aerospace-grade aluminum frame and a breathable, technical mesh so it’s easy to carry, use, and clean.  

The foams in other car seats can be full of toxins, so we made the Pico with energy-absorbing 6000 and 7000-series aluminum, a comfortable mesh fabric, and minimal foam or plastic. Pico meets and exceeds the same U.S. car and plane safety regulations as those big, heavy car seats. It's not just lightweight, we also look at every material and process to make a product that's way better for people and the planet.

 

Travel safer

Pico was created so families with kids 22-50 pounds don't have to choose between lugging a giant carseat, or skipping it and risking safety.
Pico is a forward-facing only, 5-point-harness car seat that can also be used on planes. It's light and folds up small so you never have to check, rent, or skip the seat. We've heard too many horror stories about rental car companies running out of seats, or checked seats not showing up. Pico stays with you, or easily stows away. Bring it when you taxi, Uber, Lyft, fly, or drive. Great also for caregivers, grandmas and grandpas, and for squeezing three-in-a-row in the backseat. 

 

Sad Dad sent us this picture after the airline said to gate check his seat, and then TSA told him he couldn't bring it through security. After a few trips back and forth from ticket counter to security, he was over it. Check out Rad Dad breezing into the airport. Ok, to be real, that's Jeff, our Head of Product, and his only baby is the Pico. But that's a real Pico in that tiny carry bag! 
 

Support WAYB and be in the front of the Pico line 

Now boarding: families who love to travel and hate schlepping giant car seats! 

As a thank you to our campaign backers, we're offering Pico at a discount (and free shipping in the contiguous U.S.). Our Pico travel bag (sold on its own) can be carried as a backpack or on your rolling luggage, and Indiegogo supporters get a deep discount. Our final product and materials may vary slightly from the prototypes pictured in these photos and videos.

 

Pico is available in four aluminum frame colors: Jet, Ocean, Earth, and Turquoise.

Ready for road trips and cleared for takeoff!

Our Pico prototypes have been reviewed by consumers and experts, and have passed U.S. safety tests for planes and cars. We're ready to go into production! Check out our timeline:

 

The WAYB family

WAYB's co-founders come from the outdoor gear industry. Our expertise is in making high-quality, durable products that are also portable and lightweight. Our CEO, Tio Jung (top left), wanted better baby gear for his own kids, so he founded WAYB with his father, manufacturing guru I.S. Jung (top, 2nd from left), and with Michael Crooke, former CEO of Patagonia (top, 3rd from left). Pico was born when Tio and his dad noticed parents lugging heavy car seats in the airport, and set out to find a better way. The rest of our team comes from companies like Disney, The Honest Company, GOOD, and Adidas. We're a values-led company that puts families first - ours and yours. 

     

    Born in California 

    WAYB's headquarters is in South Pasadena, California, just outside Los Angeles. And outside Los Angeles is where you'll find most of us, SUPing in Redondo, beach camping in Carpinteria, or hiking and cycling near Santa Barbara. If you've noticed that we like to say "Oh hi!" a lot, it's both a friendly hello, and a wink to Ojai, a mountainous retreat just a couple hours from L.A. Our co-founder and chairman, Michael, settled in Ojai when he was at Patagonia, and many pink sunsets later, it's still home. We're not sure if any other executives park a tractor outside their office, but this Kubota is a pretty sweet ride. 

    In early 2018, our team spent a weekend in Ojai, deciding what kind of company we were going to be. We knew that by aiming to make products with non-toxic, eco-friendly materials, we'd be looking at higher costs. The team had to consider if we would sell two tiers of products: one made the typical way, at a lower price point, and a more expensive version, made healthier and more sustainable. We knew the competition did this, charging more for the version that's not full of toxins or trash. And we knew we could probably sell more products that way. But that's not the kind of mission we wanted to be on. We held hands* and decided that every product carrying the WAYB name would be the best version - the one we'd want for our own kids.

    The truth is, this really only works if our hunch is right: that people will pay a little more for something that's way better for parents, kids, and the planet. Thank you for supporting us, and for being on this journey. We'd be honored to be part of your family's journey too.  

    *Ok, so we didn't literally hold hands, we, er... clapped hands. Which is like this weird ritual we do. Come by the office sometime for a cup of coffee and we'll explain it. 

     

    Tell your friends!

    Share our campaign page: www.igg.me/at/WAYB 

    Follow us on Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter.

    Spread the word to all the parents, grandparents, caregivers, PANKs & PUNKs (Professional Aunt / Uncle, No Kids) in your life. If you know families who fly, drive, Lyft, Uber, taxi, or carpool, let them know about Pico.

    Questions / Help? Email us at help@wayb.com

    Tags: travel car seat, flying with a 2-year-old, flying with a 3-year-old, flying with a 4-year-old, family travel, travel with preschooler, travel with toddler, road trip, first flight, travel gear, outdoor gear.

story:
Short Summary

In days gone by, a shooting range was a hillside and a picnic table.  I want to change that.  The Range,LLC. is going to be a range and outdoor recreation center like no other.  

The mission of The Range is to be a safe, affordable, fun, family-oriented,
world-class, recreational shooting and family outing facility.


  • SAFE: Safety is our number one management priority. Safety is everyone’s responsibility and is provided by a positive attitude towards the handling and responsible use of firearms and archery equipment, as well as environment safety.

  • AFFORDABLE: We are going to be providing a public service not only by providing a safe place to shoot, but also by providing an alternative to “farm shooting”. To allow maximum use, barriers to participation must be lowered. Keeping the shooting experience affordable will increase use and enable all social levels.

  • FUN: The experience of recreational shooting is fun. Barriers to allowing the members to enjoy the shooting range and to have a memorable experience will be eliminated.

  • FAMILY-ORIENTED: Programs, products and services will be designed to offer family experiences.

  • WORLD CLASS:  World Class implies “top of the line, top drawer, first rate, none better.” We will meet and exceed the industry “five star” standards whenever possible.

  • RECREATIONAL SHOOTING FACILITY:  Our line of business is shooting recreation, training, education, and programs to support the shooting sports. We will focus on being the best (safe, affordable, fun, family oriented, public, world class) shooting facility.

  • FAMILY OUTING FACILITY: To more fully utilize the space available, family oriented services such as sand volleyball, hiking trails,horse shoes and fishing will be available. Classes will be taught in Outdoor Photography, Portrait Photography, Painting, Sketching and more. A catalog of available courses will be published.

Motivation


There are several things that are motivating me to pursue this project. These are my love of the sport of target shooting and my love for the community where my wife, our children and I have chosen to make our home.

In the 12 years that we have lived in Norfolk Nebraska, I have located a few places that are legal to shoot, but I don’t consider them safe. I have located a place that is legal and safe but is a long drive (and expensive).

I also want to see this project succeed to be an asset to the community. I want this to be a destination facility - a place where the family can get in the car and spend the day enjoying nature. This is eco-tourism at it's  finest.

This facility will be large enough to host national level competitions, each of which will bring lodging, food and gas purchases and traffic to downtown.

I will be offering free use of the facility to local law enforcement officers for practice and qualification, and will be inviting them to do community outreach programs at the facility.

I will be seeking out those who are Active Duty or Retired from the Armed Forces to serve as paid instructors.  I will also be hosting events to honor those who have served, or are serving.

I will be in touch with area shelters that serve those with disabilities.  I will be inviting them for picnics and if their level allows, will put them to work.

I will be in touch with agencies and facilities that serve the aged, and they will be invited to picnics and maybe art classes on the property.

Residents of the Rescue Mission will be invited to the facility for a day out in the sunshine. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $200,000 from this campaign.  These funds will be used for:

  • Down payment on property (I am searching for 300-500 acres)
  • Payment of loan payments until the facility opens
  • Purchase of 100 concrete shooting benches
  • Purchase of a used payloader and fuel
  • Purchase of materials to build pavilions 
  • Purchase of equipment for Trap and Skeet
  • Insurance
  • and other start-up costs.


    The Impact

    This facility will provide a safe facility for both target shooting and taking classes.  In addition, we (you and I) will be hiring Veterans whenever possible.  

    The facility will be drawing people to the community, resulting in income for area stores, restaurants, gas stations and lodging.  

    But more than that, we will be providing a safe place where the entire family can go for a day of recreation in the sun and fresh air.  

    Law enforcement and game wardens will be able to get to know the public.

    The elderly and those with disabilities will be able to get out and enjoy the beauty of natural Nebraska.

      Risks & Challenges

      I identified property for this facility, spent 56 weeks negotiating, completed the Business Plan, Marketing Plan, Environmental Plan and plans for each planned activities (sand volleyball, horseshoe pits, concerts, etc.)  After 56 weeks, the deal fell through... The land would have been VERY low cost, and I would not have needed this help.  

      Now, once this campaign closes, I will have the funds to negotiate a new piece of property.  The risk/challenge is going to be in locating suitable property.  

      I will be advertising for "the worst piece of property in the county" - using the techniques Disney used to buy his property in Florida.  I will take land that is of very little value for agriculture and (with a lot of work), build a facility that we can all be proud of.  Digging a four acre pond will require moving over 1,200,000 cubic feet of dirt.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are unable to contribute, I certainly understand.  However, could you please tell your friends and relatives about this campaign?   Thank you in advance.

story:
The DUO team are a group of passionate travelers that together have visited over 60 countries and way too many red eye flights to remember. We decided that we have had enough of trying to get a few moments of bad sleep before it was time to get off a plane and straight into a meeting or exploring a new culture. We knew there had to be a better way to sleep while traveling. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 We have Designed the Duo pillow to have endless uses while your on the road. With 4 main ways to find a comfortable sleep no matter where or how your traveling. 

 The Beard is what really sets this pillow apart from the rest. This position provides an area to sit your chin snugly to provide support to your neck. This means you can say goodbye to your head bobbing up and down and side to side when you are sitting straight up. 

 

The Bear hug is a comfy way to support your head while leaning forward on your lap or tray table. If your the type of person who would rather sleep leaning as forward as possible while seated, this is the perfect way to find comfort while sleeping.

 

The Field goal is similar to the traditional u shaped neck pillows... but with a whole lot more support. with the top flanks pointed upward it supports your head from bobbing back and forth and unlike a traditional neck pillow this position allows your head to lean against the flanks instead of all the way back to the seat headrest.

 

 The Shoulder Pads is worn similarly to the field goal, but with the flanks pointed downward. This position allows for the person's head to lean all the way back if desired. Additionally, this position provides support to your shoulders.

 

Here's what sleep doctor Dr. Jeffrey Ellenbogen, chief of sleep medicine at Massachusetts General Hospital, had to say about sleeping on a plane.

“Don’t be too jealous,” they’re not sleeping well. More likely, they’re chugging along in shallow states of drowsiness and frequently disrupted light stages of sleep.” 

 As we get deeper and deeper into sleep, he said, our muscles become more and more relaxed. That means it’s impossible to sleep well while sitting up because our neck muscles have to keep working. 

What about a neck pillow? 

“It’s the right idea, but most are poorly constructed,” he said. 

That's where the Duo is different, instead of forcing a person to use neck muscles to keep their head upright, the Duo allows the you to completely relax and let the pillow worry about keeping your head up.

 

 This has been a year in the making, we have our final samples finished and the manufacture is ready to move forward with our first order. We will be placing the order right after the indiegogo or during if it goes as well as we hope. All orders will ship in June/July.

story:
High tech - low cost 

These life changing solar lights are new to the market and have the power to transform lives with the click of a switch.

Recent developments in solar technology have resulted in sleek, compact, portable solar lights. Lights that are affordable. Lights that give up to five hours of bright light per evening. Lights that cost only a few dollars yet last for years. Lights that save money, protect the environment and reduce indoor air pollution.  

                    

They are at the cutting edge of technology. They don't just allow children to study at night, or families to feel safe after dark: the very latest solar technology charges mobile phones. They narrow the channels of communication between communities - catalysing business and entrepreneurs in the process. 

They allow rural Africans to enter the 21st century. No longer reliant on kerosene and no longer having to walk 6 hours to charge a phone. They provide opportunity. They provide choice. They provide a platform for people to lift themselves out of poverty. To develop. To prosper. 

Help us share this technology  

           

We need you. We need you to help us get these lights in to rural Africa. 

Every single donation counts. Every single donation will share one of these life-changing lights with a family this harvest time. You will help improve safety. You will help provide a better education. You will help prevent serious burns and accidents. You will help provide a brighter future.  

And in return? You will get your name on our Lighting up Africa Wall. So everyone can see you helped create a sustainable energy legacy in Africa. 

You will get one of these sleek, sexy lights for yourself. To take camping, to save on electricity, to occupy your pet cat. 

         


You may think your contribution is just a mere drop in the ocean when it comes to lighting a whole continent. But what is an ocean if not a collection of millions of little drops?

 

Get involved. 

Create a brighter future 

Almost a million people live in the Rift Valley, Kenya - but with no electricity to light their homes, 70% are simply left in the dark. That's more than the population of Boston. 

We’ll be using your valuable contribution to send our teams into the Rift Valley to distribute an amazing 6000 solar lights. Timing is everything. 

It's vital to get these life-changing, money-saving, high-performing solar lights to this farming region at the most crucial time of the year: harvest time. 

Why? Because solar lights haven’t yet reached remote regions of Africa such as the Rift Valley. With your help, we can get lights into communities at harvest time - giving hundreds of families a chance to buy their first solar light while they have spare harvest cash.

With your donation, thousands can take a first step out of poverty and save hundreds of precious dollars in the years ahead.

Better still, as a charity, we re-invest all income from light sales back into our work. So we match every $ you give with a $ from sales, doubling your donation. 

So that's double the reason to get donating ... right now!

A small ask with a BIG impact 

With an average family size of five, distributing 6000 solar lights will bring the gift of clean light to around 30,000 people in Kenya's Rift Valley. Families will be better able to endure the dry season and children will able to study safely on long dark nights. 

That's not all. You’ll also be contributing to something much, much bigger. 

You'll be helping SolarAid build a sustainable solar market that will change the lives of hundreds of millions of people living without energy - creating jobs, providing a springboard for other forms of technology and giving Africa's next generation a brighter future. 

By helping to get these solar lights into rural Kenya in time for harvest you will be joining a movement that is set to change the fortunes of an entire continent. 

Eradicating the kerosene lamp from Africa 

Believe it or not, in Africa today, 600 million people live without access to electricity. 600 million people! When the sun goes down in early evening most have no choice but to use expensive, noxious kerosene to light their homes.

In Kenya kerosene eats up to as much as 30% of a family’s income - starving them of life’s essentials such as food, schooling and medicine. 

Many families can’t even afford kerosene for children to study at night. If they can, the children huddle around a dull, dangerous flame – eyes streaming, chest scratching, inhaling fumes equivalent to smoking 40 cigarettes a day.

We’ve made it our goal to eradicate the kerosene lamp from Africa by 2020. 

But instead of giving out aid, we sell solar lights. Because as well as retaining peoples' dignity, SolarAid wants to build a sustainable market for solar lights. With your help, thousands of families in the Rift Valley will have a chance to invest in a solar light for the first time ever - giving themselves a chance of a brighter future. 

You'll be helping leave an energy legacy that will transform rural Africa for years to come and banish the deadly kerosene lamp forever. 

Clean, safe solar lights - technology at its best

The modern solar lights we sell are rugged, tough and made for the rigours of rural Africa. They cost as little as $10 and last up to five years. That's around 3% of the cost of kerosene over the same period. 

A family investing in their own solar light can enjoy a plentiful supply of good quality, clean light – safe for children to study. And with no kerosene to buy they free up valuable income for food, education and life's other essentials. 

As The Economist stated: 

“Which plastic gadget, fitting neatly in one hand, can most quickly improve the lives of the world’s poorest people?... the solar-powered lamp.”

Once a family has their first own light, everything changes. 

However, getting lights into remote African villages with few shops and poor transport links - the places they are needed most - is difficult and expensive. 

With no UPS or mail service, no Internet, newspapers or billboards, SolarAid has had to find creative ways of getting lights into communities. 

But we can’t do it without you.... 


Be part of a movement...transform a continent 

How did the mobile phone get in to the pockets of 644 million Africans – including some of the very poorest? Not because they were given away but because the mobile companies created a market by building demand. 

Everyone wanted to own a phone as soon as they saw it would revolutionise their lives. As demand grew, entrepreneurs set-up shops, distribution evolved - and soon mobile phones were bigger than Coca-Cola. 

SolarAid is doing the same with the solar light. Our teams travel deep into rural areas to demonstrate solar lights to groups of teachers. Soon, the message trickles down to even the smallest village and once people see the massive difference solar lamps can make, they save up to buy them.

But because we're a charity, we need your help. To help us pay for the transport, the training, the offices, the people, the phones, the stock ... everything that goes in to building a sustainable market that will literally transform millions of lives. 



A simple idea can change the world 

Our novel approach is making a BIG impact and has turned the heads of industry specialists with awards from Google, Ashden and The Guardian UK. 


In fact, we have already sold and distributed over 600,000 solar lights in remote regions of Africa – lighting the way to a brighter future for more than 3 million people. But that is just the beginning. We need more help. 

You too can be a part of this amazing movement. Every donation you give will go towards building a sustainable future for millions of Africans – not just those in the Rift Valley but right across the continent.  

Even if you can't donate now, you can still add your passion to this amazing mission. Share this message of hope with your friends, colleagues and family by clicking the buttons below. It's as easy as flicking on a light switch! Which is just what you'll be helping millions of families in rural Africa do - switch on to fantastic safe solar, and say goodbye to kerosene forever. 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Earn a place on the SolarAid wall of fame

Our fantastic team have painted the "Lighting Up Africa" wall in our London office, ready and waiting for your name - or that of a loved one, if you want to give your donation as a gift. Once you lovely folks get donating, we'll be filling that white space and shouting out "thank you" to you all. So watch this space for your name to appear! 

Follow us on Twitter and Facebook to keep up to date with our wall.


Don't forget all donations over $30 earn you a super photograph – a fantastic gift for Thanksgiving, Christmas, Birthdays or just to say 'You Light up My World'. 


The Lighting Up Africa wall as it currently stands. Want your name on it? Then you best get contributing. We'll even let you choose the country. 

         

Check out our awesome 'Right to Light' wall for Ecobuild 2013: Over 3 days, this enormous map was emblazoned with the names of our fabulous supporters and their messages of hope.           

 

The team seen here with Greg Barker MP modelling the brilliant 'Sunshine is Free' T-shirts you will get free with your donation. 


Check out our gallery for a behind the scenes look at our team and the impact of our work in rural Africa.  


Busy day ahead!

Follow us on Twitter and Facebook to keep up to date with our wall.

Don't forget all donations over $30 earn you a super photograph – a fantastic gift for Thanksgiving, Christmas, Birthdays or just to say 'You Light up My World'. 



The Lighting Up Africa wall as it currently stands. Want your name on it? Then you best get contributing. We'll even let you choose the country. 
         


Check out our awesome 'Right to Light' wall for Ecobuild 2013: Over 3 days, this enormous map was emblazoned with the names of our fabulous supporters and their messages of hope.            The team seen here with Greg Barker MP modelling the brilliant 'Sunshine is Free' T-shirts you will get free with your donation. Check out our gallery for a behind the scenes look at our team and the impact of our work in rural Africa.  Busy day ahead!

story:
IDO 2.0 is now available.

You could visit our online shop http://mylittlefactory.co/shop or discover it below.
2-5 business days is necessary to prepare your order for shipping.
We delivery everywhere the postal service is available.

Below, processing for shipping.

What's new? 

- The same universal smartphone slider with a better quality aluminum rod and a new bearing designed and tested to cater the linear motion.

- A regular diameter for the two lines and the choice to use a closed linear ball bearing make IDO smoother.

 

 

IDŌ short presentation : 

 

IDŌ is an ultra-portable camera slider suitable with all smartphones and tablets.

It is compatible with almost DSLR cameras like SONY Nex 5 or PANASONIC LUMIX GX1, LUMIX DMC series, action cam like GoPro, Compact camcorders like SONY Handycam, and so on.

During the development, IDŌ went on to pass the acceptance trials with flying colors.

Today, IDŌ is ready for manufacturing...

IDŌ story : 

I wanted a slider to film panning shots with different models of smartphones.  

I didn't want to discard it if I would change for a new model and I also wanted to film with my DSLR camera, SONY NEX-5. 

The most important : not so heavy and too big to carry on my bag during hiking, not too expensive... The project had to meet this requirements but above all being a beautiful and “ready to use” slider.

This is the start of the IDŌ.

In Japanese, IDŌ means "move".

 

Sample of use for IDŌ with some smartphones: 

 

IDŌ with Iphone 4

 

IDŌ with Iphone 6

 

IDŌ with Ipad Mini

 

IDŌ 250 with tripod mounting system and Iphone 6

Two major points were present along the conception:

- Built a unique system for mounting smartphones, tablets and the adapter to use all video camera devices as DSLR cameras, action cam like GoPro, …

- Develop a mounted unit with smooth and silent operation capacities. 

IDŌ filming R2-D2

 

IDŌ grins

 

 

Touch and move IDŌ

The only limit to realize great videos is your imagination!

 

  • IDŌ is sturdy, compact and lightweight. 
  • It gives you the best value for its price. 
  • Capture stunning live motion and studio shot video to highlight your creations!
  • Easy to use and set up in minutes. 

 

 

 

 

 

Smartphone mount plate with screw

Two dimensions are available:

Ten inches length (265 mm precisely) are enough to capture great smooth instant videos and to take with you everywhere. 

Twenty inches length (515 mm precisely) is perfect to frame the subject. 

All IDŌ series are tool-free disassembled for a simplified transport.

 

 

 

One adapter to fit all your cameras

IDŌ Adapter for camera

 

For use with DSLR cameras, action cam like GoPro , compact camcorder like SONY handycam, etc using the adapter.

How to create smoothly zoom shot?

Using IDŌ with camera and screw adapter by rotating it 90 degrees and create « track in » and « track back » shots to simulate DOLLY/zoom shot.

 

 

IDŌ  with SONY Handycam

IDŌ  with PANASONIC Lumix

IDŌ  with NEX 5

Technical specifications :

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have finished studying and designing IDŌ, so we don't require a larger amount to set up the manufacturing. 

All investment like machines are already done! 

This is the reason why we don't need an important financial level. 

We have managed a first campaign on other crowdfunding platform and it was a success (203 initial backers are looking for IDŌ). 

Now, we are collecting informations from backers to deliver on time. 

We continuously receive a number of email queries and we would like to give a second chance to get IDŌ with special launch price available throughout the duration of the campaign.

In the same time, we hope to meet our goal and starting to sell in "InDemand" category to offer the possibility to spread IDŌ to the world thanks to the popularity of this platform. 

On our side, the most important is to support the way of manufacturing, packaging and deliver it on time.

When we'll reach the goal, we'll start to produce in our factory based in France and if we need, we'll use more machines to meet the deadlines. 

We are builder and this is the best way to control each step of the production.

We've just succeeded a project on Indiegogo in december for X'TREMFISHROD™.

Many thanks to take time to read and discover IDŌ...

story:
Our newest perk, the 8hz Hutch Backpack. Still made with 100% recycled plastic bottles. A simple, functional and sustainable backpack for everyday use, including a yoga mat or tripod.

THE BACKPACK AND TRAVEL BAGS

 

REVERSE IT INTO A MESSENGER BAG

The backpack reverses into a messenger bag within seconds, so now you can display the awesome Saber art print and use on a daily basis.

The minimalistic design works like luggage, but acts like a backpack.You should not have to compromise quality and craftsmanship for doing something good for the planet. A handcrafted bag in California that is sustainable yet stylish and very functional. See the demo below.

 

Saber is a world renowned artist from LA. More than that he is an extremely passionate individual. When he believes in something, he fights for it whole heartedly and he is ready to fight for sustainability. As he puts it "We are at the tipping point. Why are we creating more shit and more waste with oil based materials, why not make great products that benefit people and the environment?"

Our fabric is made from 100% recycled plastic bottles and custom made from our fabric manufacturer partner Waste2Wear, which is founded by an amazing dutch entrepreneur Monique Maissan.

The fabric is:

  • Official certification to verify every step of the recycling process (SCS).
  • Garment Quality Guaranteed by international test reports (ITS) and BSCI approved production facilities.
  • Only eco-friendly dyes and treatments used.
  • Great comfort: Highly suitable for combinations with eco-friendly cotton and other sustainable materials.

From bottle to Backpack, the process.

 
 

8hz is partnered with the 5 Gyre Institute in Los Angeles. We contribute 8% of the net profits to our non-profit partners, including 5 Gyre which is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization in special consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council since 2017. Their mission is to empower action against the global health crisis of plastic pollution through science, education, and adventure.

Roughly seven out of every 10 bottles are trashed. And from the landfill, many plastic water bottles end up in the ocean. 5 Gyres has historically supported bills to help change this reality: In 2017, we endorsed AB 319, which requires that all plastic beverage container caps in California are either attached to the bottle or designed so that the beverage can be consumed without removing the cap. Just like changing aluminum cans from pull to pop tops in the 1970s solved a health and safety problem, tethering the cap to the bottle will decrease the bottle cap and lid litter that pollutes our environment. We also supported a 2011 bill to ban plastic water bottles on federal lands, which was reversed by the National Park Service in 2017. 

 

Do you know who makes your products? Meet Rafa and Alba, they are our manufacturing partners, who own and run the the facility in Ventura, California. You can be proud in knowing the names of the people making your backpack. 

Frankie and Alba working on the final details of the backpack and a shot of the facility with Mateo and Alba in the background. 

 

GUARANTEE

 

At 8hz, we are making the best products, handcrafted in California and we stand behind our products, being sustainable, being transparent and creating quality. We want to keep customers happy because this is what makes us happy, this is why we offer a lifetime warranty.

 

Our mission. To make beautiful products from recycled materials and work with organization to help prevent plastics from getting into the oceans. Our ethos is simple, leave the earth in a better place for our future.

How did it start? The vision started when Mateo's previous company was developing a large research project on climate change with scientist and health experts around the world and after being exposed on many levels for the last 4 years, this struck a cord, so after exiting URB-E, he decided to focus on sustainability and plastics in the oceans. The core as a designer was to make beautiful products from waste and not virgin plastic derived from petroleum, which is the easy way to manufacture products but is also extremely detrimental to the environment. This is why we chose to make our products out of waste and help this way of manufacturing become the new norm. Also, making products here in the U.S. was an important factor too, since his last venture made products in Los Angeles. The goal was to start and take action, knowing it was not going to be perfect but getting to a larger scale of a closed loop system in LA, where everything is made sustainable from fabric, bags, apparel to household goods.

Mateo then met Frankie who had designed an awesome bag and snowboard line and after awhile, they decided to form a partnership on putting the two ideas together for the greater good. There was also a nice mix of a Millennial and a Baby Boomer (on the line) that created a balance of experience and youth. Mateo then met Saber, the legendary artist and started discussing how to collaborate using his art for doing good. After many ideas and exploring, the Saber Collaboration is now happening. 

After finding a local manufacturer and building many prototypes and designs with Frankie over a year, they connected to Jason who worked with Mateo at URB-E and a few other ventures heading up Marketing, among other things and now the team has officially launched 8hz.

What does 8hz mean? 8hz comes from the Schumann resonance, the “beat” of the planet, an electromagnetic field surrounding the earth that connects all humans. Why not do something with deeper meaning that is related to the earth, animals and people, so we love the meaning and the number.

 

Mateo Neri | Co-Founder, CEO

Mateo is a serial design entrepreneur having co-founded a pioneering interactive agency in the early 90's to his last venture URB-E, which is focused on making electric vehicles in Los Angeles for urban cities around the world.  Art Center College of Design Alumni. Hybrid driver, anti-plastic bottle freak, recycler, and nature hippie in a past life.

Frankie Carone | Co-Founder, Design Director

Frankie has a long history of farming in his family. Growing up on the farm taught him the value of stewardship to the environment. His other passion is hands-on design, whether it be bag design or creating art with reclaimed wood from fallen farm structures. ArtCenter College of Design Alumni, Designer, Farmer, Outdoor Enthusiast, Artist, and known to occasionally yell at litter bugs.

Jason Chuan | Co-Founder, Marketing Director

An innovator who recognizes needs before people realize they need them. Jason founded MetaTaggers, a pioneer online marketing and SEO company founded a decade before Google was born.  The company grew to create and run campaigns and technology platforms for clients around the globe, blending the human side of business interactions with digital marketing and statistics. He has led international speakerships on web strategy for B2B and B2C, authored monthly print/web columns on market strategy and data leveraging, founded/co-founded numerous webcentric entities as well as application development and analysis for tracking interactions ranging from eCommerce to Medical Surgeries. Art Center College of Design Alumni, electric car household, solar owner, nature psycho and the token Polynesian in nearly every group. 

Saber, aka Ryan Weston Shook, Artist in Residence

Described as one of “the best and most respected artists in his field” by the Washington Post, Saber, also known as Ryan Weston Shook, is an American fine artist who originated as graffiti artist. Rising to international fame at the age 21, Saber created the world’s largest graffiti piece on the bank of the LA River, which was visible and documented by satellites in space. His work has influenced a generation of artists and graphic designers, and has become an influential part of modern entertainment, social media, and art for and involved in social reform. He continues to make his vibrant, mesmerizing and often political paintings from his home in Los Angeles with his wife and two young children. His art can be found in galleries and private collections around the world. 

TC Graphic and Animation Design

Will and Yves (Black Sock Studio) Our the film and photography team who made our videos and photos. These guys are beyond good. 

Will Evans Branding master

Bryce Photographer

story:
THE TRAVEL BACKPACK THAT MAKES YOUR LIFE SO MUCH EASIER

 

 

 

 

IT COMES IN 2 SIZES

TRAVEL WITH MORE EASE

2 Sizes Fits All

HOW TO UNPACK ARTICHOKE

 

 
 
 
 

At Artichoke we believe travelling is, by far, the best way to invest your money. We’ve done that for many years and yet could not find the perfect bag to carry our belongings around easily and efficiently.

So, we decided to make our own travel bag! Something easy to carry around, fast to pack and unpack. Something that keeps everything tidy and wrinkle free, even if the bag is half full. Something that makes it easy to reach for anything, anytime.

After many design changes and prototypes, we eventually got a great product and everybody said it really helped them when travelling, but we did not know how and where to produce it on a bigger scale. After long discussions, we chose to go for the greatest quality and stay with our local artisans. We understand the final price will be a bit higher, but we like to give work and opportunities to small Italian laboratories and pay workers fairly.

We have a great product. Now, we need your support as customers to help us make our project a reality.

 

 
 

All our Artichokes are handmade with care and great attention to details. The small studio where our backpacks are made, here in the  North East of Italy, is trustworthy; they have been producing high quality for decades, after learning from generations who have done it for centuries.

 

 
 
 
 

Every time we find a used sail, we manage to produce around 25 backpacks with it. Out of those 25, only 3 or 4 come out with numbers or different prints. Every single one of those backpacks is going to be different!

Here below you can find some examples of the sails we are going to use to produce our custom backpacks.

These perks will be activated during the campaign, so follow our social pages to see when your favorite perk is going to be available!



 

 

 

"Putting your closet on your back, Artichoke's innovative backpack is here to revolutionise the way you travel..."
      - - We Heart

"Una grande opportunità per chi è alla ricerca dello zaino definitivo per i suoi spostamenti."
      - - Mangia Vivi Viaggia

"Ecco Artichoke, lo zaino che sostituisce il trolley"
      - - Viaggio Ergo Sum

 

 

 

ARE YOU A RETAILER?

 

Contact us to gain access to the Secret Perks and get more Artichokes at a time!

story:
Hello!

My name is Gabriel and I am a recent college graduate preparing to leave for Madrid, Spain. I will be living in Madrid for one year. I'm teaching abroad to give my students the opportunity of a lifetime. For children abroad, learning English as a second language can provide them with the training they need to start a career abroad.

Your contribution will help me get settled in Spain, and purchase supplies for my students when I arrive. I will be teaching at a middle school just outside of the center of Madrid.

  • I began this program with the help of CIEE, the Council on International Educational Exchange, and the organization is very detailed and thorough. They answer almost any questions you may have about leaving home, and getting ready for your new life abroad.  They offer practical advice that is very comforting. CIEE has provided us with a budget sheet that explains where our expenses will go. School starts in October, so teachers won't be paid until November. When school starts I will be responsible for providing my students with the supplies they need to excel in learning English. Whether I reach my goal, or meet the minimum is not the concern. Any amount can help. I've never lived anywhere outside of the US, or away from my family, but I truly believe that I can make a difference in the lives of the students and I'm excited to make the change in order to help them.
story_txt:
Hello!
My name is Gabriel and I am a recent college graduate preparing to leave for Madrid, Spain. I will be living in Madrid for one year. I'm teaching abroad to give my students the opportunity of a lifetime. For children abroad, learning English as a second language can provide them with the training they need to start a career abroad.
Your contribution will help me get settled in Spain, and purchase supplies for my students when I arrive. I will be teaching at a middle school just outside of the center of Madrid.
I began this program with the help of CIEE, the Council on International Educational Exchange, and the organization is very detailed and thorough. They answer almost any questions you may have about leaving home, and getting ready for your new life abroad.  They offer practical advice that is very comforting. CIEE has provided us with a budget sheet that explains where our expenses will go. School starts in October, so teachers won't be paid until November. When school starts I will be responsible for providing my students with the supplies they need to excel in learning English. Whether I reach my goal, or meet the minimum is not the concern. Any amount can help. I've never lived anywhere outside of the US, or away from my family, but I truly believe that I can make a difference in the lives of the students and I'm excited to make the change in order to help them.

story:
We want to help you get outside

Climbing is a risky sport, especially if you don't feel safe or welcomed where you go.
Unreliable data, information gate-keeping, climbing jargon, violent language, harassment, discriminatory behavior— these are all too common experiences people have dealt with in our current landscape of online guidebooks.

 

Re-imagining climbing culture

We believe it's possible to change the community culture through intentional online experiences. Whether you're a new climber feeling anxious about your first outdoor route or a seasoned adventurer needing accurate and reliable information fast, we want to build a guidebook app that liberates information and invests in our community rather than marginalizes it. 


This is our effort in evolving climbing culture.

 

How we can make an impact

We’re creating an alternative climbing guide

We are overdue for a climbing guidebook app that, at its core, prioritizes the safety of its community members. Safety looks like:

  • Being able to self-serve accurate information as a new climber with limited access to mentors on how to get started, where to go, and how to get there.
  • Access to trail accessibility data as an adaptive climber.
  • Knowing how to navigate private property and ways to be respectful to the land and the locals there.

 

If you’re looking for a climbing guide with this kind of information, this is for you.

 

What we’re fundraising for

The purpose of this fundraiser is to pay our team members an ethical rate for the research phase as we create an official proprietary design document for a different/new climbing guidebook app.


We can't pursue a fully built out app without this first stepping stone. This document will contain our statement of intent, design prototypes, a prioritized feature list, estimated level of effort, and budget. When we are ready and backed to implement, we’ll hit the ground running with this as our guide. We'll keep the community updated through the Discovery phase on a monthly basis.

Any additional funds that come out of this fundraiser will go into paying for our online collaboration tool Miro, which has a $44.66/month fee, along with a savings that will go towards our implementation phase.

 

Free labor is not our norm

Too often companies expect free labor when it comes to pushing Inclusion and Diversity work into their brand. But the product is also the process. Sustainable and ethical practices will be at the heart of this project, and a large part of that is justly paying people for their labor.


Your funds will support this community norm and set the standard of what can be accomplished when folx are ethically compensated. Below are the team's hourly rates based on industry recommendations (before cost-of-living adjustments):

  • Collaborative Research Coordinator, $50/hr
  • Product Manager, $50/hr
  • Designer, $45/hr
  • Branding, $45/hr
  • UX, $45/hr
  • Content Strategist, $45/hr
  • Frontend Developer, $55/hr
  • Backend Developer, $55/hr
  • Legal, $50/hr
  • Community Stakeholder, $45/hr

 

We will not offer equity at any stage of this project in exchange for funding. We believe an app like this should be by the community and for the community, from discovery to implementation.

 

Here is a breakdown of our budget:

Total budget $6,000

Team cost: $5,073 (85.6%)

  • Leadership team: $1,985
  • UX, Design, Branding, Content Strategy: $1,962
  • Frontend and Backend Development: $682
  • Legal and Stakeholder: $444

 

Fees & margin of error: $853 (14.4%)

  • IndieGogo fee: $300
  • Payment processing fee: $300
  • Margin of error: $253

 

Risks & Challenges

This funding will be used for our research phase and to create a proprietary design document exclusively. 

We will need separate and larger funding to build out the app. There is the potential risk that we will be fully funded for this research phase, create the app design, but not receive enough funding to actually build out the app in the next phase. 

However, funding this initial research phase will be the foundation to building a better, more sustainable climbing guidebook app.

 

This is just one part of the puzzle

Addressing oppressive route names and monitoring online forums is one small part of the picture. Our mission is to re-imagine a more inclusive climbing community and experience, starting from the language we use when we describe and share what we're climbing.

We are 11 climbers, developers, designers, and community organizers from all around the United States who have expertise in universal design, web accessibility, and elevating marginalized folx in the outdoor space. We are passionate and hungry for change. But we need your help to get started.

 

Header photo credits
Left - Photographer: David Chu, Land of Jicarilla Apache, Cheyenne, Núu-agha-tʉvʉ-pʉ̱ 
Right - Photographer: Billy Dixon, Land of Cheyenne
Editing: Melissa Utomo
