story:
Alcove's quick-folding design collapses into a sleek laptop case.

Pop up privacy panels help to block out those time-sucking visual and noise distractions when you are at your most creative: day or night.

Alcove's light bar is your dedicated, mobile task light that helps to reduce eye strain when reading or writing in low lighting environments. 

 

The traditional office as we know it today is disappearing. The desk is no longer where the majority of work is happening. 

Our smart devices, productivity apps, and cloud networks enable us to share content at any given moment. Wherever you work, you need to focus. Alcove is redefining the way you find that focus, so you can be more productive when inspiration strikes.

 

Your Dedicated Mobile Office Anywhere Life Takes You

 

 

Airplane mode provides the right amount of privacy when traveling

 

Alcove transforms your personal space into a private workstation, instantly. Our goal is to help people create their best work wherever life takes them. 

Alcove is the first product of its kind, offering you privacy that’s truly portable. Talent on the go need tools they can carry with them, so we’ve created a mobile workspace that also functions as a stylish and professional laptop case.

 

 

We’ve spent the last year observing people working in different locations. Noise and visual distractions are top complaints of workers in open spaces, so we made these issues a high priority. We have consulted with Andrew Barnard, Ph.D., of Barnard Acoustics, and his team to analyze and measure sound within Alcove so that our patent-pending panels are designed in a way that creates a dedicated, distraction-free workspace.

 

 

Alcove patent-pending panels help to keep the sound you want in and noise you don't out

 

 

With Alcove's visor, block sun glare and increase sound and visual privacy wherever you work.

 

High-Quality Construction

Alcove's case is made of the highest quality vegan leather and wool felt. The case wipes clean with ease and the felt side panels are uber soft to the touch when opening and closing. 

 

Convenient access to laptop ports for charging

 

Beautifully balanced materials and colors

 

Alcove is slim enough to slip into your backpack/messenger bag or carry as a standalone (shoulder strap included)

Alcove founders, Yared Akalou and Sergio Aleman Jr., met at university in 2009. Yared was a principal designer and part-time adjunct lecturer and Sergio was a senior enrolled in Yared’s industrial design course. From the onset, Sergio was a standout in the class. In 2016, they reconnected at a local design critique. Yared had just returned from living and working in Sao Paulo, Brazil and Sergio was head of Industrial Design at his company. They began tinkering with the idea of a product that would support today’s mobile workforce. 

The seeds of Alcove were planted and the former adjunct professor and design student combined their collective experiences to design a groundbreaking mobile workstation for the modern workplace.

 

Along our journey, we have collaborated with some of the most talented individuals in their fields.

 

Special thanks to all who have given their time to provide us with feedback on our earlier concepts and to share their work experiences. Your valued input is why we exist.

We now need your help to bring Alcove to market. If we meet our campaign goal, we will use the funds to order tooling and molds, initiate the minimum requirement for our first production run, and successfully ship Alcove to you.

 

 

Shipping

We want people all over the world to have an Alcove to create their best work, and we've done our best to pre-negotiate shipping rates to each major country. Due to the variability of prices, it's difficult to be exactly sure what the end rate will be.

However, we've gotten individual shipping quotes by country, which will be reflected in your backing total. Please note, the international shipping estimates will not cover include import, duty, VAT, or customs fees.

story:
SUPPORT THE SPIRIT OF USF

  The women and men of USF Cheerleading epitomize the spirit and passion of the university experi- ence. Their work extends beyond Bulls athletics, as their presence reaches to all aspects of the campus community. From Saturday nights at Raymond James Stadium to special events for USF students, donors and dignitaries, members of the cheerleading squads work tirelessly in support of the university mission.

You can support their efforts by joining the USF Cheerleading Coach’s Club. Your support will go towards equipment, travel and scholarship costs for the USF cheerleaders. For more information on this or other ways to support the USF Cheerleaders, contact Head Coach Liisa Soncrant at usfcheerleading@msn.com 


                                                    NATIONAL SUCCESS    

  The USF Cheerleading squads have won numerous awards in recent years at UCA College Nationals and UCA Summer Camps, going head to head with some of the nations toughest competition. As with every USF program, it is their goal to be in the position to win at the highest levels. Your support will help them achieve the ulti- mate prize...bringing home a National Championship.

story:
Neighbours in Need

Hi. I am a fourth grade student at Ray Lewis Elementary School. Two students who go to my school had a horrible fire this last week that destroyed the contents of their house. My campaign is about helping this family raise money for all their new stuff and everything else. You will help us pay for books, toys, applyances, and a handicap ramp for their house, because the oldest boy has special needs. As you can see in the photo, the fire started in their kitchen but it affected all of the rooms and everything in their house. If everybody piches in together we can achieve so much!

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise at least 2000 dollars and delivering all proceeds to a family in need. My perks are the bronze level, the silver level and the gold levels.The bronze level is a level where if you donate $100 you will recive a $10 gift certificate for Chapters. The silver level is for if you donate $500 you will recive a $50 gift certificate for Montana's, Kelsey's Swiss Chalet and Harvey's resturant.The gold level is for if you (or your group) donate $1000 or more you will recive a $150 gift certificate for any WalMart location. Even if we don't reach our entire goal, all proceeds will go towards a family in need.

The Impact

If you are generous enough to donate even a small amount you will not only be helping a family from my school who greatly needs it, but you will be building my faith in people. I think we can do this!! Let's make a difference! I know every little bit helps! If you are willing to donate to this family, not only will you be helping them, you will be helping the people of the comunity, you will be making Hamilton a better place, you will be raising awarness all across the world for other families that need your help, you will also feel very good about yourself if you do donate, and lastly you will be helping a fourth grade student trying to make a diffrence in this families life. And if you donate $100, $500, or $1000 my mom will personaly go to each store and without taking money from the fundraiser proceeds, she will buy each gift certifacet herself. She doesn't think I can get somebody to donate $1000. Let's prove her wrong! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  I know some people just can't donate money, but that doesen't mean they can't help. If you are one of thoes people that just can't donate money it would realy help if you could tell everybody you know about this campaign. Maybe someone they tell can help. Another way you can help is donating stuft animals, toys or books. The Hamilton Mountain Police station is accepting donation of household goods and clothing. Once again, they have a 3 year old girl, a 8 year old girl and an 11 year old boy, so maybe girl sizes 4 and 8/10 and boy's size 14. I would realy apreaceat it. I hope most of you can contribute in some way.

Extra Information

If you are interested in reading about this family's whole story as reported in the newspaper, or watching the video of the report and interviews with the Red Cross, you should click on the following link:

http://www.thespec.com/news/local/article/801597--family-left-in-lurch-after-blaze-rips-through-home

story:
Hi deep freediving addicts!

After the success of our noseclip in 2016 and our lanyard in 2017, this year we are happy to introduce the Octopus pulling system!

It took Pascal over 10 months of development work and dizains of virtual and 3D prototypes to finalize this new project! The last prototype was tested this September in the blue waters of Amorgos in Greece and gave full satisfaction!

In the end, we are presenting you with a product which is easy to use, sturdy (max. load 250kg), efficient, compact, ergonomic and at a very affordable price while maintaining high-quality components and finish!

It is so resistant that you can just leave it hanging under your buoy, no real need to rinse in fresh water. You can even jump on it with both feet, it will keep working over and over (with any rope from 8 to 12 mm diameter)!

Finally, in case of emergency, it will enable you to pull the line up way more efficiently than the traditional way (a.k.a. laying like a sack of potatoes on top of your buoy...).

It has an ergonomic shape: regarding both its ease of use with one hand (or even two fingers only!), and also the absence of sharp edges (how many times have you bumped your head in your buoy on the way up when you were a little bit “up there in the clouds”?).

Be the first to pre-order your new Octopus pulling system, at a great discounted price!!! Production will start in december, and delivery is planned for march 2019.

Try it once and you will never go back to using just the simple carabiner!

Enough words, the video speaks for itself!!!

A warm thanks for your support!

Pascal

 

 

 

 

 

 

"I am a experienced freediver (VWT -131m) and ex-competitor, but I have also been working as industrial designer for many years. This makes me aware of what freedivers need and want, but also able to design products that will meet those needs. As a good Swissman, precision and attention to detail are my priorities in the manufacturing process, to ensure a high-quality final product."

After the success of our noseclip in 2016 and our lanyard in 2017, this year we are happy to introduce the Octopus pulling system!
It took Pascal over 10 months of development work and dizains of virtual and 3D prototypes to finalize this new project! The last prototype was tested this September in the blue waters of Amorgos in Greece and gave full satisfaction!
In the end, we are presenting you with a product which is easy to use, sturdy (max. load 250kg), efficient, compact, ergonomic and at a very affordable price while maintaining high-quality components and finish!
It is so resistant that you can just leave it hanging under your buoy, no real need to rinse in fresh water. You can even jump on it with both feet, it will keep working over and over (with any rope from 8 to 12 mm diameter)!
Finally, in case of emergency, it will enable you to pull the line up way more efficiently than the traditional way (a.k.a. laying like a sack of potatoes on top of your buoy...).
It has an ergonomic shape: regarding both its ease of use with one hand (or even two fingers only!), and also the absence of sharp edges (how many times have you bumped your head in your buoy on the way up when you were a little bit “up there in the clouds”?).
Be the first to pre-order your new Octopus pulling system, at a great discounted price!!! Production will start in december, and delivery is planned for march 2019.
Try it once and you will never go back to using just the simple carabiner!
Enough words, the video speaks for itself!!!
A warm thanks for your support!
Pascal
 
 

 
   "I am a experienced freediver (VWT -131m) and ex-competitor, but I have also been working as industrial designer for many years. This makes me aware of what freedivers need and want, but also able to design products that will meet those needs. As a good Swissman, precision and attention to detail are my priorities in the manufacturing process, to ensure a high-quality final product."

story: I recently got accepted to join a team of members to go on a mission trip to Costa Rica. My team's hope with this trip is to give back to people who are in need and spread the word of God. I feel like I am ready to immerse myself into another part of this world where there is less hope, less options, and less of what we have here. I yearn to establish relationships and share the love of Jesus. It will be a challenge but I know I can do this. The funding for this trip is 5,400 dollars. Through prayer, fundraising, yard sales, car washes, and your donations I will be blessed with the opportunity to be able to take on a role in this mission. God bless you all.

story:
Two years ago I spent a week working at Sager-Brown the United Methodist Church’s Disaster Relief Depot in Louisiana. I have been informed they are in desperate need of volunteers workers in August. I have Volunteered to go work for three weeks Aug 12-31. This trip will cost me about $1500. I am driving so will have Fuel, meals and hotel expenses. Room & board is $710 for the 3 weeks but we must feed our selves on the weekends as the kitchen is closed. If you can see it in you heart to help in any way it would be greatly appreciated If you would like info on Sager-Brown and UMCOR see  their website at http://new.gbgm-umc.org/umcor/work/sagerbrown/

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The hippiest, happiest & most unique          way to Tour San Francisco



Hitch a ride with us for an authentic way to sightsee and tour the beautiful City by the Bay. These hippie-busses are an entire experience of their own, refurbished for your comfort and fun with a new interior; shag carpets, electric blue seats and hand painted murals on the outside. Not only do our busses exude a San Francisco hippie feel, but also our routes go where the other big busses can’t! Join us, crank-up the volume and sing along to those timeless tunes as we groove down the City streets!



Why Hitch A Ride with SF Love Tours?

  • We sit only 6 passengers so we can cater more to your needs and desires, giving you the attention and treatment that you deserve.
  • Groove on with our knowledgeable tour guides who will share with you remarkable stories, history of the City and talk to you about exciting things to do that are actually of interest to you.
  • Ride with us through restricted streets! Because we have small hippie buses, we can take you to places where these other big buses can’t show you some of the best city views!

                      

                    

Places We Visit!

Our groovy little hippie VW busses have access to restricted streets in San Francisco! We can take you right through places like:

  • Haight Ashbury (Through forbidden streets)
  • Golden Gate Bridge
  • Union Square
  • Park Presidio (Through forbidden streets)
  • Golden Gate Park
  • Bay Bridge (Night Tour)
  • Castro District (Through forbidden streets)
  • Treasure Island (Night Tour)
  • China Town (Through forbidden streets)
  • North Beach (Little Italy)
  • Fisherman’s Wharf
  • Dolores Street (Through forbidden streets)
  • Embarcadero
  • Palace of Fine Arts (Through forbidden streets)
  • Lombard Street

Our Vision

This beautiful City by the Bay is ever changing, full of history, culture and new adventures. It is no wonder why Trip Advisor ranked San Francisco in the top 3 US Cities to visit, with over 16.9 Million visitors in 2013. This is probably why we are also saturated with those awkward big red London style busses full of tourist, usually freezing, on that top opened deck… which frankly do not quite fit the San Francisco vibe. Our hippie busses do!

Our vision is to be come an iconic San Francisco “moving landmark." We love taking people around the city, and we plan to grow our company to up to 5 buses in year-one of operation. This growth will bring in new jobs to the city of about 20 awesome tour guides and about 5 more support staff. We are stoked to be able to contribute the City’s economic growth and provide financial opportunity for our extended family. 


                  

Loves Back!

We have an unwavering belief of sharing our success with programs that enhance our community. We plan to meet our desires to Love Back in three ways: financial contributions, donating our services/products, and volunteering our time. We plan to contribute a fixed percentage of our profits to go directly to non-for-profit programs. We also believe in giving free tours to organizations that supports individuals and families in need. Lastly, we will volunteer our time to organizations that enrich our community.


Why an IndieGoGo Campaign?

Two main reasons: for one, we are one of the few local SF start-up companies, which is non-tech! With your support of pre-purchasing our tours we can reach $10,000 to reach the next milestone in making our dream come true: To operate as a City Sightseeing Tour company and Charter Service.

To do so, we are required to obtain TCP certificates from the Public Utility Commission (PUC), a business license from the City of San Francisco, and permits from the San Francisco Police Department (SFPD). Additionally, we need to purchase insurance premium that meets the City’s requirements and one that has coverage for classic vehicles. Our estimate is a little over $7,450 for permits and insurance. With the remaining $2,550 we will make improvements to the interior of the Love Bus.

Second, this is an awesome way to let people know of what is about to happen and give them the opportunity to participate in the Start of a new company!

Other Ways to Help

Now, we understand that not everyone is ready to pre-purchase a ride, an awesome tie-dye shirt or immortalize his or her name inside of our bus. So will really appreciate your support by following us on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter and also by helping us spread the word! 


   Perks: Pre-Purchase SF Love Tours!


         Immortalize your Name inside of our Bus!

Be a Star! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity offered through this IndieGoGo campaign only. You will be part of this start-up company which oozes San Francisco feel! Your name will be immortalized and always remembered by painting it inside one our hippie bus! 


                           City Sightseeing Tour

Hitch a ride with us for an experience you will always remember. Whether you are a native San Franciscan or visiting and need to get to know the city in a better way, let us drive you around and feel the vibes of peace, love, freedom and adventure!

IndieGoGo pre-purchase and receive a 25% Discount!


VIP Day Tour

Enjoy the exclusivity of a tour just for the two of you. Let us show you around the City, with amazing views and tastes of fine Ghirardelli chocolates, some of our favorite celebratory drinks from our local grown to worldwide known bubblies!

IndieGoGo pricing with over 37% discount of our regular $240 price.


VIP Night Tour

Fall in Love with San Francisco and enjoy the City Lights from some of the most amazing views! This VIP Night Tour is for 2 people, and in addition to our awesome night route, music and knowledgeable guide enjoy complimentary bubbly!

IndieGoGo pricing with over 40% Discount of our regular $300 price.


Charter Service

Let us take you and 5 of your coolest friends around San Francisco. Go bar hopping, check out restaurants in different neighborhoods, take a mural tour, or use for any charter service for up to 4 hours!

IndieGoGo pricing with over 20% discount of our regular $650 price.


Napa Valley Tour

You and 5 of your hippest friends will receive a full day tour of Napa Valley! We will remove all the heartaches of choosing versus driving and tasting. We will plan with you, which wineries you would like to visit, and we will do all the work of coordinating for a wonderful experience. Enjoy catered snacks, beverages, and groovy music during your ride! We cover the cost of two tastings for each of the 6 guests.

IndieGoGo pricing with over 15% discount of our regular $1,500 price.


                                Many Thanks!

On behalf of the entire San Francisco Love Tours team, we cannot express in words how exciting it has been for us to see this dream beginning to come true. 

Thank you all in advance for your support and we hope you love our perks and we look forward to having you on board on one of our tours, so you can also feel the vibes of Peace, Love, Freedom & Adventure!

story:
Reviews

 

A love-note from one of Bertha's first best friends and VIVA A VIDA homegirl; Lærke Kersten

 

Airbnb-reviews from more of our awesome
VIVA A VIDA-buddies - thank you!

FEATURES: Bertha & Rita

• Capacity 
2 adults + 1 child

• Bed 
Queen-size memory foam mattress - length 200cm
Double duvet, sheets, covers and towels
Attachable child bed - max length 130 cm

• Kitchen
Double gas stove
Cool box
Pots, pans, plates etc.
Pull-out table + 2 chairs

• Leisure-battery
Lights + charge your phone/computer/camera

• Surf board rack 
Fits up to 2 boards.

• Camping shower 
8 L capacity

• Storage space

• Insulation
Keeps the cold out in winter and the heat out in summer

 

 

FEATURES: Lola and The Band Van

 • Capacity 
5 adults - THE WHOLE BAND/FAMILY

• Bed 
Memory foam mattresses for 5 people - length 200cm
Duvets, sheets, covers and towels

• Kitchen
Double gas stove
Refrigerator
Pots, pans, plates etc.
Dining table + seats for 5 people

 • Bathroom
Cold shower
Toilet

• Leisure-battery
Lights + charge your phone/computer/camera

 • Storage space
Including space for surfboards

• Complete insulation
Keeping the cold out in the winter and the heat out in the summer. 

 

 

 

1st goal SUCCESSFULLY FUNDED!

How we will use the funds

 

 

NOW

Let's get THE BAND VAN on the road

Everything from this crowdfunding is
directed straight into building our existing vans

 

 

What we give you

 

 

We've partnered up with our favorite hotel

and our favorite tapas bar

Hotel Ting's Lisbon & Estaminé Art Food Drink

to make unique and high-valued adventure deals for you

 

Big SHOUT-OUT to both of the power-couples behind these amazing places

 

 

STAY TUNED FOR EXTRA PERKS 
DURING THE CAMPAIGN

Running a crowdfunding is a chance to be 100% transparent with our backers and tune into your needs as customers. We’ll do our very best to keep you posted on our progress.

And we promise to deliver the coolest van-spaces and all the guidance you need to have an epic trip in Portugal.

 

 

FAQ’s

 

Why crowdfunding?

We didn’t expect to have 4 vans by now - but: serendipity.

We received extraordinary offers out of the blue from two different pairs of friends who wanted us to adopt their van into the VIVA A VIDA family.

 

We are so close to the finish-line of having the 3 first darlings on the road.

Crowdfunding allows us to share the experience of van-adventure with our funders.

It also allows us to get directly in contact with our customers - with those of our customers who are in it for the win - it makes it easier for us to cater to your desires and needs.

It allows us to build community around these experiences

 

How do I get my van when I arrive in Lisbon?

We prefer to hand you over the van at our place in Graça. It is a chill place with all the time in the world for you to get to know your new traveling companion

 

Where can I park the van?

The short answer is: Anywhere!

It is perfectly allowed to park most places for free - go with your common sense and respect for people's private property - then you should be good.

We will send you lots of pinned suggestions for epic spots in a map we've made. 

Also, our small vans look like any other van from the outside - no one would guess that it is a camper unless they look inside. The stealthy outside appearance is a feature we have been very conscious about keeping as unspoiled as possible throughout the design and building process. 

 

What are you normal prices?

Here's our normal rates per night.

 

Do I need insurance?

No - we have insurance on the vans - a €1.000 deposit will be all the insurance you need.

This is how it works:
Both our vans come with a 3rd party insurance. This insurance contract will cover any damages accidentally caused by you to other people or property during your booking. No insurance company have been interested in signing an "all-risk" contract, thus the policy does not cover if you should cause damage to the van you are renting.

To resolve this situation we request a €1.000 deposit (blocked, not charged), when you rent one of our vans.
This will in turn be your maximum liability, should you accidentally cause any harm to one of our dear vans. 

 

Can you recommend anything to explore when in Portugal?

Oh yes. We have explored a lot and have awesome spots that we would love to share with you. 
We send you a Google map with a bunch of pins on it. It includes sweet beaches, awesome restaurants, beautiful lakes and mountains for you to check out.

 

Can I go on adventure with my children?

YES! Please let us know in advance and we will have you equipped with child-seats in the right size and a child bed for the two smaller vans (Bertha and Rita). 

We'll make sure to give you our best tips for child-friendly beaches.

 

Is there space for my surfboard?

Yes indeed - AND, we have a deal for you too.

Every VIVA A VIDA booking gives you a 15% discount on beginner boards, intermediary boards and wetsuits and a 10% discount on pro-level gear.

Check out our website for more info: https://www.vivaavida.pt/

 

Where can I charge my phone and other electrical devices?

In the vans of course. We have fitted all vans with an additional 'leisure' battery, that charges when you drive around in the van. This means that when you are parked for the night, you will have all the power you need for lights and charging of all your devices.

 

And what about a toilet?

This one's taken care of in our bigger vans - the campers (Lola and the Bandvan), where there's a bathroom inside the van. 

With the smaller vans, it takes a bit of finesse, that's all. We'll give you a map with lots of pinned public toilets, the big supermarkets usually have toilets and there are the restaurants and café's you use. If you're far away from civilization; go connect with nature respectfully :-).

 

Can I have wifi?

You can - it's not a feature in our vans, but we do have a mobile wifi-router that you can bring.

Let us know in advance and we'll get back to you with the price depending on how long you need it and how many gb's you need.

 

When does my perk expire?

Never - as long as VIVA A VIDA exists you can use it. 

The bonuses included also apply as long as VIVA A VIDA exists, but we may deliver them to you from different sources than our current awesome partners, if need be.

 

What if I want to go on a longer trip?

That's amazing! Write and email to: simon@vivaavida.pt and we'll simply arrange that.

You can max. use one Adventure Deal per booking, so the payment for the rest of the days of your trip we'll handle through our website.

 

What’s your refund policy?

We are subject to Indiegogo’s refund policy. Click here to read more about refunds: 

https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526876-Refunds-Can-I-get-my-money-back-

 

 

Who to contact?

Us! We’re only an email away!
So shoot if you have questions, feedback or simply just want to say hi.

 

Lisa
+351 964 391 942
lisa@vivaavida.pt

Simon
+351 964 391 951
simon@vivaavida.pt

Website
Facebook
Instagram

 

T H A N K  Y O U 

 

A special thank you to Dane Dodds our amazing friend - for doing your magic with the film and being our angel throughout the whole creation process. You're our hero man.

We have explored a lot and have awesome spots that we would love to share with you. We send you a Google map with a bunch of pins on it. It includes sweet beaches, awesome restaurants, beautiful lakes and mountains for you to check out. Can I go on adventure with my children?YES! Please let us know in advance and we will have you equipped with child-seats in the right size and a child bed for the two smaller vans (Bertha and Rita). We'll make sure to give you our best tips for child-friendly beaches. Is there space for my surfboard?Yes indeed - AND, we have a deal for you too.Every VIVA A VIDA booking gives you a 15% discount on beginner boards, intermediary boards and wetsuits and a 10% discount on pro-level gear.Check out our website for more info: https://www.vivaavida.pt/ Where can I charge my phone and other electrical devices?In the vans of course. We have fitted all vans with an additional 'leisure' battery, that charges when you drive around in the van. This means that when you are parked for the night, you will have all the power you need for lights and charging of all your devices. And what about a toilet?This one's taken care of in our bigger vans - the campers (Lola and the Bandvan), where there's a bathroom inside the van. With the smaller vans, it takes a bit of finesse, that's all. We'll give you a map with lots of pinned public toilets, the big supermarkets usually have toilets and there are the restaurants and café's you use. If you're far away from civilization; go connect with nature respectfully :-). Can I have wifi?You can - it's not a feature in our vans, but we do have a mobile wifi-router that you can bring.Let us know in advance and we'll get back to you with the price depending on how long you need it and how many gb's you need. When does my perk expire?Never - as long as VIVA A VIDA exists you can use it. The bonuses included also apply as long as VIVA A VIDA exists, but we may deliver them to you from different sources than our current awesome partners, if need be. What if I want to go on a longer trip?That's amazing! Write and email to: simon@vivaavida.pt and we'll simply arrange that.You can max. use one Adventure Deal per booking, so the payment for the rest of the days of your trip we'll handle through our website. What’s your refund policy?We are subject to Indiegogo’s refund policy. Click here to read more about refunds: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526876-Refunds-Can-I-get-my-money-back-  Who to contact?Us! We’re only an email away!So shoot if you have questions, feedback or simply just want to say hi. Lisa+351 964 391 942lisa@vivaavida.ptSimon+351 964 391 951simon@vivaavida.ptWebsiteFacebookInstagram T H A N K  Y O U  A special thank you to Dane Dodds our amazing friend - for doing your magic with the film and being our angel throughout the whole creation process. You're our hero man.

story:
When we first started DopeKicks we had one vision in mind, to build the coolest, eco-friendly, super resistant and waterproof shoes and still make it accessible to everyone. We wanted to outperform all the other shoes in every category, and that is exactly what we have done.

We have sad news everyone, our shoe is not for smoking. Hemp is actually the “sober cousin” of marijuana. It has a minimal amount of psychoactive components, and for that reason it is legal everywhere in the world. Our team has traveled across Europe, China and the US with it, and all you get is a bunch of excited security officers wanting to take a picture of them.

Did you know hemp is so strong Henry Ford once built a car with it. It was 10x stronger than steel, and Henry Ford was so confident on the strength of the panel that he took an axe to hit the car. The axe, that would have cut through any steel panel simply bounced back.

 

Hemp is a material with a lot of potential. Besides being super strong, it is also very environmentally friendly. It consumes 3 times less water than cotton, and it has a minimal impact on the soil. By backing our project you are directly supporting hemp farmers from around the world.  

Finding the right materials, the right soles and the right footbeds was just a small part of the process. In order to make something that people would use, we had to make something cool, something that we could be proud of. It took us several trials to actually reach a satisfactory result. And then it took us 2 prototypes to reach what we have now. 1 year later, we are proud of the final result.
story_txt:
When we first started DopeKicks we had one vision in mind, to build the coolest, eco-friendly, super resistant and waterproof shoes and still make it accessible to everyone. We wanted to outperform all the other shoes in every category, and that is exactly what we have done.

 
 

Rubber is an ecological material that comes from the plant commonly known as “Para tree” that grows in South America, and southeast Asia. It is collected there and brought all over the world to make all kinds of tools. 

But we decided to go the extra mile and actually help clean what our competitors left behind. We have partnered up with experienced portuguese outsole manufacturers to create upcycled soles made from old shoes. They are flexible, durable and save the environment at the same time.  
 



The global shoe industry makes over 25 billion pairs a year and most of them end up in landfills, or worse, in our oceans. By supporting our project you are directly contributing to remove these dirty shoes from the environment and transform them into something good.
 
 

One of the great advantages of rubber is its strength and durability. That’s why it is used in cars. At the same time, rubber can deform and go back to its original shape even after years of action, unlike many synthetic materials that eventually deform on regular usage. 
 


When designing our soles we had to think of a wide range of applications. We balanced a rugged design for the heavy outdoor user, that would be light enough for the casual user. By strategically carving the outsoles we got a maximum grip level with reduced overall weight.   
 
 

Cork is a premium material available in nature. It comes from the cork-oak tree that has been growing for decades in Portugal. Approximately every 9 years, cork oaks grow a thick bark around them that is later collected to be processed. 

After collecting the bark from the tree, it is ground and made into flat sheets. The next process is to cut it into molds and add foam for extra cushion. The process takes a few days. 
 


Cork is a non deforming, natural cushioned material that always regains its form after many years of usage. At the same time it is temperature regulating and it keeps your feet cold in the summer and warm in the winter. That’s why some portuguese people use it in construction as insulation. With the extra foam layer, we guarantee the right mix between hardness and cushion, perfect for either hiking or casual cruising.  
 


One of the great uses of cork is to make floors. Why? Because of the anti-microbial properties in cork which  can naturally repel small vermin and insects with a waxy substance called suberin (conveniently named after the cork oak tree). This wax allows it to have water-resistant attributes and helps promote healthy feet.
 
 

We wanted to make something for the active person, the challenger, the explorer, something that could provide the best experience under any conditions, and that’s why we built it waterproof.

At DopeKicks we spent months looking for the right supplier of Hemp to guarantee a premium fabric that was not only strong, flexible, and durable but also waterproof and dustproof.
 


Our hemp has been made to repel all water from coming in. During the manufacturing process we added a special coating layer that would protect the fabric and its properties from stains, liquids and dust particles. This will make the fabric very easy to clean as well. 
 


To guarantee that no water would come in we also added a special waterproof membrane, providing a total 2 layers of protection and keeping your feet dry no matter what.  100% protection against wind, cold, liquids and dust.
 
 


We chose Portugal for several reasons. The local shoe industry is huge and it has been supplying top world brands with nothing but the best quality, and we know we are delivering real value to people, not only our customers but also to the employees, the ones working hard to build DopeKicks.

If we don’t get people a fair salary, how can we expect them to opt-in for a more sustainable pair of sneakers? Ford once said that about his cars, and now we ask ourselves the same thing with our shoes.

 
By choosing fair trade production we are empowering people so that they too can choose environmentally friendly sneakers when they go to the store. Because only together, we can change things for the better. 

 
 

DopeKicks is designed for the outdoors, for the urban explorers and everything in between. 

Either if you are traveling in the tropics, running in the mountain or just chilling by the beach, DopeKicks will be there, because good sneakers take you to good places.

 
 

When we designed our kicks we made them in such a way to repel not only liquids but stains as well. Our special coating material makes sure that dirt doesn’t stick. 
No more napkins or waiting for your shoes to dry. Just rinse the dirt off your shoes with some water and you're good to go!

 

 

 
 We have sad news everyone, our shoe is not for smoking. Hemp is actually the “sober cousin” of marijuana. It has a minimal amount of psychoactive components, and for that reason it is legal everywhere in the world. Our team has traveled across Europe, China and the US with it, and all you get is a bunch of excited security officers wanting to take a picture of them.
 Did you know hemp is so strong Henry Ford once built a car with it. It was 10x stronger than steel, and Henry Ford was so confident on the strength of the panel that he took an axe to hit the car. The axe, that would have cut through any steel panel simply bounced back. 
It took us 4 months of samples and travel to find the right suppliers. We had to ensure that our material had the best strength while remaining flexible and durable.  
 Hemp is a material with a lot of potential. Besides being super strong, it is also very environmentally friendly. It consumes 3 times less water than cotton, and it has a minimal impact on the soil. By backing our project you are directly supporting hemp farmers from around the world.   Finding the right materials, the right soles and the right footbeds was just a small part of the process. In order to make something that people would use, we had to make something cool, something that we could be proud of. It took us several trials to actually reach a satisfactory result. And then it took us 2 prototypes to reach what we have now. 1 year later, we are proud of the final result. 
 

       
 

This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $275MM through crowdfunding.

story:
(We've been notified that the video isn't showing up on some browsers. We've asked Indiegogo to look into it.  In the meantime, if you can't view the video, please go to www.rewardtag.com to see it!)

 

CBS News: "RewardTag really is the MOST effective method for asset recovery available on the market today!”
NBC News: “RewardTag.com is a great way to get back your precious items that get lost!”
Southwest Airlines Spirit Magazine: The founders "sent a weather balloon toting a cell phone with a RewardTag on it into the skies over Los Angeles. Three months later, (they) received an email from a guy who found it while hiking in Joshua Tree National Park, 180 miles away. He sent the phone back—and refused the $100 reward.”

For more information, check out our newly launched website!

#1: How will the funding be used?

We’re getting orders from corporations and consumers alike, but after spending a lot of our earnings on a necessary rebranding effort, we now need to raise funds to load up on new RewardTags.  We need YOUR help to raise the necessary funds to be prepared to fill big orders.  The last thing we want to go through is to lose out on some of the corporate accounts because we can't afford to fill their order!  

As you may be able to tell from our old homepage design in comparison to our new design (as shown in the video), we are constantly looking to improve our product. Your funding will help us to continue to establish the RewardTag product line and brand as the best online “lost and found” resource in the market!

 

What exactly is a RewardTag?


A RewardTag is an adhesive, durable polyester label with a unique ID number that connects the owner’s contact information, personal message, and reward offer directly to their device in case they lose it.

RewardTags make for great gifts!  Each order will come with these gift envelopes.  The more RewardTags you buy, the more envelopes you get, so you can share with your forgetful friends. 

Take a look at the RewardTag Gift Envelope Perk Options right over here --->

  

How does one use RewardTag?




What goes into activation?

Our customers can enter whatever contact information they want the finder to see.  Options include name, email, phone number, alternate phone number (it’d be pretty tough to call someone’s phone if that’s what you found!), and zip code. The more information shared, the easier it will be for the finder to return the lost device. 

For each RewardTag, our customers can offer whatever reward and personal message for the finder to see.  We think that this “personal touch” is the reason why most people elect to return lost devices that have RewardTag labels on them (9 out of 10 lost devices were returned -- most within 24 hours).


And then the finder would see?:



The finder of the device can communicate directly with the owner either through the contact information displayed by the owner, or through our automated system which sends the finder’s information directly to the owner in the form of an email.


#2: More Details

What different sizes do you offer?
We currently only offer our universal sized RewardTag label, and for Indiegogo Backers, a keychain that doubles as a clothing tag for jackets and gloves.  Look for bigger sizes, different shapes for watches and sunglasses, and maybe even different colors, down the road...we just need some funding!

What is the long term plan?
We want RewardTag to become a household name so that the first thing that people look for when they find a lost item is our sticker. In order to do that, we will absolutely need to increase our distribution.  

Rewards:

This is a very grassroots project being run out of the office in Brian's little apartment, so every bit of support is greatly appreciated. As with other crowd-sourcing initiatives I will be offering rewards for different levels of support. Have a look at the different perks listed to the right and check out the cool stuff that's available. 


Team:
Brian Nichols graduated from the Annenberg School for Communications at the University of Southern California with a Master’s Degree in Communication Management and B.A. in Communications in 2010.


Danny Coorsh graduated from the Marshall School of Business at the University of Southern California in 2012 with a B.S. in Business Administration, with concentrations in Finance and Entrepreneurship.

story:
In order to accommodate the restrictions placed on carry-on luggage from various airlines, LOJEL has come up with an innovative luggage system that is extremely lightweight and has a large capacity. With carefully constructed details and a stylish design, we aim to provide the best carry-on luggage to all travelers worldwide.


ULTRA LIGHT WEIGHT:

• Lightest Weight: 1.8kg / 3.9lb 
• Magnesium pull Trolley 
• Nylon trimming Zipper: Instead of plastic trimming, this zipper significantly reduces the weight by 200 grams and provides a finer aspect design-wise
• Monolithic & Integrated wheel design: Wheels are embed into the luggage shell, which makes it light weight but not forgo the durability.



FASHIONABLE DESIGN:


• Contoured Profile

The whole shape of this luggage larger at the bottom and more narrow and rounded at the top. The purpose of this shape is to better resist impacts.
• Rounded corners
Unlike most luggages which have sharp corners, the shape of this collection is flexible enough to absorb impact and avoid cracks in the shell.


• Thinner & Waved shell surface
The waves on the shell surface keep the material dense enough in the areas more exposed to impact (the 4 top corners) while also reducing the weight of the luggage.


• Color matching in details (trimming, hinge & name tag)
• 100% genuine leather hinge & name tag


MAGNESIUM PULL TROLLEY:


• Special Material: LOJEL's ULTRA-LITE luggage trolley is made out of Magnesium instead of the traditional Aluminium luggage trolley. 
• The trolley is 30% lighter and 30% stronger than traditional Aluminum luggage trolleys.

STRONG CORE STRUCTURE FOR BETTER BALANCE: 

• Curved cut on top of the luggage - Keeps the handle close to the center to keep the luggage balanced when lifted. 
• Ultra Soft Foam Handle: The Ethylene Vinyl Acetate material provides a super soft texture which makes the handle more comfortable.

SUPER STRONG DUAL COIL ZIPPER:


In most luggages a single coil zipper is used. LOJEL's ULTRA-LITE luggage features a dual coil zipper. This zipper provides better security and is more durable than a single coil zipper.

ADVANCE PC MATERIAL: The 3-layer Polycarbonates material used in the ULTRA-LITE luggage is an exclusively made strong material. This material is light weight while still remaining highly resistant to impact.

ACCESSORIES FOR BETTER ORGANIZATION:











"The magnesium trolley makes it amazingly light; the shell is made of a special material that prevents punctures."


"No other competitor has been able to get their hard-sided carry-on under four pounds and still preserve quality."
                                                                                                  by Valerie Wilson





About us

As the Lojel US distributor, we always want to bring the best luggage options to the US market. However, the challenge we have been facing is coming up with the most accurate forecast for specific products. In the past, we have tried introducing products to the US market, however many didn’t take off as projected. In order to convince the Lojel headquarters that the U.S. market is ready for the Ultra-Lite luggage, we decided to go on Indiegogo to ask for your help.

Lojel HQ has already produced a small quantity of samples, but we are still having trouble getting HQ on board with our ideas. We believe the Ultra-Lite Luggage is perfect for our US customers. That’s why we need a solid number of backers to prove that we are able to bring this amazing product into the U.S. At the same time, by using crowd funding, we are able to lower the cost to our customers.

We need your support to make this happen! We would like to pass the savings on to our backers on Indiegogo, the customers who are willing to help Lojel build a better name in the US market.
